commentary.comment: The first half of this match is about to start.
Close! Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Everton will have a goal kick.
Goal! Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 1:0.
Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) is sent off after deserving nothing other than a red card from a referee for clattering into his opponent!
Ashley Williams (Everton) is yellow-carded.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ross Barkley (Everton) replaces Tom Davies.
It's in the back of the net! Danny Welbeck sprays a pass out to Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal), and he has an easy job to slot the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:0.
Phil Jagielka (Everton) gets a yellow card.

Romelu Lukaku (Everton) wins the ball near the penalty spot and unleashes a header towards the roof of the net, but Petr Cech is alert and denies him. The ball is out of play. Everton win a corner kick.
The match has reached half-time.
The second half has just started.
The game is over for Idrissa Gueye. Gareth Barry (Everton) comes on for the second half.
Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) has a sight of goal and shoots goalwards, but the goalkeeper makes a comfortable save.
Gabriel (Arsenal) gets a yellow card.
Problems for Arsene Wenger as Gabriel is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Per Mertesacker (Arsenal) replaces him.
The players claim that Rob Holding (Arsenal) handled the ball inside the box and it seems they are right. A penalty is given to Everton!
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the left side of the net.
Morgan Schneiderlin (Everton) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
The referee signals a substitution. Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) is brought on as a substitute for Granit Xhaka.
Rob Holding (Arsenal) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Goal disallowed! Enner Valencia (Everton) scores but Michael Oliver blows his whistle for a foul.
Arsene Wenger has decided to make a change. Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) replaces Alexis Sanchez.
The whistle blows and Leighton Baines (Everton) is booked for an infringement.
Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a low strike towards the middle of the goal. Joel Robles guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Here's the change. Enner Valencia leaves the pitch and Arouna Kone (Everton) comes on as a substitute.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) blasts the ball towards goal from the edge of the penalty box and it flies straight into the top right corner of the net!
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
James Tarkowski (Burnley) misses a good chance to score. A perfect cross into the box finds James Tarkowski (Burnley) who rises for a header, but he sends the ball well over the bar.
James Collins (West Ham) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
It's a goal! Andre Gray plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Sam Vokes (Burnley). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 1:0.
Ashley Westwood (Burnley) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
GOAL! Superb work from Andre Ayew, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Sofiane Feghouli (West Ham), who beats Tom Heaton with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
Yellow card. Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Andre Gray (Burnley) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Madley has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
A substitution has been made. Robbie Brady goes off and Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley) comes on.

Edimilson Fernandes (West Ham) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the top right corner. Tom Heaton pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Andre Ayew (West Ham) gets to the rebound in the goalmouth and plants a header home.
The substitution is prepared. Steven Defour (Burnley) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Ashley Westwood.
Sean Dyche has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ashley Barnes (Burnley) replacing Andre Gray.

Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) attempts to threaten the goalkeeper from the free kick on the edge of the box. He produces a stunning blast which only flies inches over the crossbar. It could have been a beautiful goal!
The substitution has been made. Ashley Fletcher (West Ham) has replaced Robert Snodgrass.
What was Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Substitution. Edimilson Fernandes is replaced by Declan Rice (West Ham).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
After a goalmouth scramble the ball rebounds out to Javier Manquillo (Sunderland) who buries it from close range into the roof of the net.
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) failed to convert a mid-range free kick and sends the ball narrowly over the bar.
Willian (Chelsea) collects a delightful pass inside the box and slashes the ball into the middle of the goal. What a clinical finish!
Jordan Pickford gets a well deserved ovation! He pulls off a remarkable save to block a long-range effort from Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) towards the right side of the target. Nice goalkeeping skills!
Diego Costa (Chelsea) receives a lofted pass from the flank and shoots from close range, but the ball flies slightly wide, almost brushing the left-hand post.
It's time for a substitution. Gary Cahill (Chelsea) comes on in place of John Terry.
Neil Swarbrick rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Diego Costa (Chelsea).
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
A yellow card for a tackle by Billy Jones (Sunderland). Neil Swarbrick doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Goal - 2:1! Diego Costa laid the ball off to Eden Hazard (Chelsea), who shot from close range into the right side of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Diego Costa leaves the pitch and Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea) comes on.
David William Moyes has decided to make a change. Lynden Gooch (Sunderland) replaces Adnan Januzaj.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Pedro (Chelsea) comes onto the pitch so that Eden Hazard can be given a rest.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Pedro (Chelsea), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches over the top.
Goal! Pedro (Chelsea) is gifted a chance inside the box and makes no mistake putting the ball into the net with a fine header. 3:1.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Lee Cattermole walks off the pitch to be replaced by Darron Gibson (Sunderland).
Goal! Pedro provides Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a strike into the middle of the goal. 4:1.
Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea) receives a well-taken defence-splitting low pass inside the box and scores! His great effort makes its way into the left side of the goal.
Neil Swarbrick is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Brilliant finish! Harry Kane (Tottenham) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Christian Eriksen, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 0:1.
Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right-hand post. David Marshall is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his shot towards the roof of the net, but the keeper makes a superb save!
Dele Alli (Tottenham) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Marco Silva decided to make a change. Curtis Davies is replaced by Kamil Grosicki (Hull City).

Goal! Oumar Niasse plays in Sam Clucas (Hull City), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders. He shoots from inside the box into the right side of the net! Great finish - 1:3.
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the left post. His promising effort is kept out by David Marshall, who pulls off a stunning save!
GOAL! Christian Eriksen curls the free kick into the box. Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) peels off his marker and arrows a brilliant header past David Marshall and into the left side of the net. 1:4.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) latched on to a sweet ball in the box and coolly slotted in near the left post.
Marco da Silva has decided to introduce fresh legs, with  replacing Jarrod Bowen (Hull City).
The manager makes a subsitution with Andrew Robertson (Hull City) coming on for Josh Tymon.
Here comes a substitution. Mousa Dembele (Tottenham) is brought on as a substitute for Eric Dier.
Dele Alli will be replaced by Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham).
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to make a change. Vincent Janssen (Tottenham) replaces Harry Kane.
What a big chance! Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Ben Davies (Tottenham) finds some space just outside the penalty area after exchanging the ball with his teammate and strikes a shot towards goal that goes inside the right post!
Kieran Trippier showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Toby Alderweireld (Tottenham) gets onto the scoresheet by heading inside the left post. It's 1:7.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
Goal! Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) fires the rebound low into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:1.

Riyad Mahrez (Leicester)'s poor effort is easily saved by Ryan Allsop. He connects well with a cross, but mistimes it a little, and it heads towards the middle of the target and straight into the grateful hands of the goalkeeper.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Yohan Benalouane (Leicester) is given a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
The game restarts for the second half.
GOAL! Islam Slimani meets a cross inside the box and heads the ball across the goal, where Jamie Vardy (Leicester) lurks and pokes it into the back of the net. 1:1.
The free kick from a promising distance is taken by Andrew Surman (Bournemouth), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the left post. What a chance!
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to Danny Simpson (Leicester) for his blatant foul. Bournemouth are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.
Here's the change. Yohan Benalouane leaves the pitch and Daniel Amartey (Leicester) comes on as a substitute.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Jamie Vardy (Leicester) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Eddie Howe decides to make a substitution. Lys Mousset will be replaced by Benik Afobe (Bournemouth).
Marc Pugh will be replaced by Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth).

Jamie Vardy (Leicester) wastes a huge opportunity. He attempts to knock a rebound into the top right corner with a delicate header, but Ryan Allsop dives to keep the ball from hitting the net. Corner kick. Leicester will have an opportunity.
It's time for a substitution. Demarai Gray (Leicester) comes on in place of Marc Albrighton.
Here is a change. Ryan Fraser is going off and Eddie Howe gives the last tactical orders to Matt Worthington (Bournemouth).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Simon Francis (Bournemouth) was quite harsh and Lee Mason didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) gets booked for the first time in this match.

Islam Slimani (Leicester) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He produced a header which went wide of the right post by a whisker.
Benjamin Chilwell (Leicester) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Lee Mason had an easy-decision to make.
Lee Mason is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has started.
Nathaniel Clyne (Liverpool) is furious with himself as he misses a clear opportunity from the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.

What a chance that is! Emre Can (Liverpool) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Middlesbrough.
Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the top right corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) unleashes a beautiful rocket of a shot from a long-range free kick. The ball goes into the bottom left corner and leaves the goalkeeper beaten. This takes hours and hours on the training ground. The score is 2:0.
Adam Lallana (Liverpool) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball inside the right post.
Rudy Gestede (Middlesbrough) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the left post. Brad Guzan pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. Liverpool have a corner.
Here is a change. Fabio is going off and Steve Agnew gives the last tactical orders to Daniel Ayala (Middlesbrough).
Here comes a substitution. Rudy Gestede is given a rest as he is replaced by Alvaro Negredo (Middlesbrough).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) comes onto the pitch for Roberto Firmino.
What a chance for Adam Forshaw (Middlesbrough) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball went just wide of the right post.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to substitute Daniel Sturridge and he is replaced by Divock Origi (Liverpool).
The game has come to an end for James Milner. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Alberto Moreno (Liverpool).
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Goal! Paul Pogba slips it to Joshua Andrew Harrop (Manchester United) on the edge of the box and he finds the right side of the net with a great effort. The score is 1:0.

Goal! Paul Pogba (Manchester United) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the middle of the net. Wayne Hennessey is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 2:0.
Substitution. Michael Carrick (Manchester United) in, Paul Pogba out.
Jose Mourinho prepares a substitution. Jesse Lingard is replaced by Anthony Martial (Manchester United).
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The foul by Scott McTominay (Manchester United) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Anthony Taylor.
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) leaps high to meet a lofted pass around the penalty spot, but his header crashes against the crossbar!
Substitution. Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as James McArthur walks off.
Samuel Allardyce decides to make a substitution. Patrick van Aanholt will be replaced by Sullay Kaikai (Crystal Palace).
Michael Carrick (Manchester United) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Luka Milivojevic (Crystal Palace) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Joel Pereira to dive and make a save.
Samuel Allardyce has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Fraizer Campbell (Crystal Palace) replacing Wilfried Zaha.
It's time for a substitution. Angel Gomes (Manchester United) comes on in place of Wayne Rooney.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Joe Allen (Stoke City) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

It's a goal! Peter Crouch (Stoke City) makes it 0:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Geoff Cameron and planted his close-range header into the top of the net. Fraser Forster was helpless.
Glenn Whelan (Stoke City) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The substitution is prepared. Sofiane Boufal (Southampton) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Dusan Tadic.
Claude Puel decides to make a substitution. Charlie Austin will be replaced by Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton).
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Ramadan Sobhi (Stoke City) is given a yellow card.
Substitution. Mame Diouf did his best and is replaced by Jonathan Walters (Stoke City).
What was Sofiane Boufal (Southampton) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) takes a good first touch from a cross and fires a powerful shot from the edge of the box, low towards the middle of the target. The goalkeeper, though, is ready and easily denies him.
Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) has a huge chance to score from close range, but his effort goes just a few inches wide of the right-hand post.
The manager makes a subsitution with Jeremy Pied (Southampton) coming on for James Ward-Prowse.
Jack Stephens (Southampton) was probably a bit loose with his words to Lee Probert, who decides to show him a yellow.
Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) is cautioned by the referee after being shown a yellow card for dissent.
Here is a change. Xherdan Shaqiri is going off and Mark Hughes gives the last tactical orders to Marc Muniesa (Stoke City).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The match has just started.
Gylfi Sigurdsson picks out Leroy Fer (Swansea) unmarked inside the box, but he blazes the ball well over the bar. The ball goes out of play and West Brom will have a goal kick.
Jonny Evans (West Brom) meets the corner and displays his eye for goal as he coolly plants a header from close range into the bottom right corner. The score is 0:1.

Close! Kyle Naughton (Swansea) unleashes a rocket of a shot from the edge of the box and his shot flies just a few inches over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and West Brom will have a goal kick.
Michael Dean has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Lovely run from Salomon Rondon (West Brom). He finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper, lines up a shot, but the keeper boldly launches himself to intercept the ball. The referee points to the corner flag and West Brom will take a corner.
Marc Wilson (West Brom) goes into the book and receives a yellow card.
Substitution. Luciano Narsingh (Swansea) on for Leon Britton.

Goal! Fernando Llorente peels away from his marker to connect with the resulting free kick and heads the ball towards Jordan Ayew (Swansea), who does brilliantly to nod the ball into the net. He makes it 1:1.
Tony Pulis has decided to make a change. James McClean (West Brom) replaces Jake Livermore.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea) comes onto the pitch for Leroy Fer.
Tony Pulis has decided to substitute James Morrison and he is replaced by Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom).

Goal! Fernando Llorente (Swansea) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. Luciano Narsingh assisted in the goal. 2:1.
Tony Pulis prepares a substitution. Marc Wilson is replaced by Jonathan Leko (West Brom).

Jonny Evans (West Brom) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the right side of the goal, but Kristoffer Nordfeldt pulls off an exquisite save to deny him. West Brom force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Federico Fernandez (Swansea) receives a yellow card for infringement.
The manager makes a subsitution with Stephen Kingsley (Swansea) coming on for Jordan Ayew.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Kevin De Bruyne takes the corner and Vincent Kompany (Manchester City) rises highest near the penalty spot to plant a brilliant header into the left side of the goal. The score is 0:1.
M'Baye Niang (Watford) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Sergio Aguero (Manchester City). Kevin De Bruyne plays a fantastic through ball and finds Sergio Aguero (Manchester City), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the bottom left corner. 0:2.
It's a goal! Leroy Sane plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Sergio Aguero (Manchester City). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 0:3.
Problems for Walter Mazzarri as Daryl Janmaat is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Andrew Eleftheriou (Watford) replaces him.

It's in the back of the net! Gabriel Jesus slips the ball through to Fernandinho (Manchester City), and he darts into the box to unleash a magnificent shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:4.
Jonathan Moss shows the yellow card to Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) for a heavy challenge. Manchester City win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Jonathan Moss has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Wilfredo Caballero makes a brilliant save! Stefano Okaka (Watford) easily weaves through the defence and fires the ball from mid-range. His effort goes towards the right side of the goal but is saved by the keeper! Watford earn a corner.

M'Baye Niang (Watford) produced a promising shot towards the bottom left corner after his wonderful solo run, but Wilfredo Caballero thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same. The ball goes out of play. Watford are awarded a corner kick.
What a big chance! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
GOAL! Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Heurelho Gomes, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 0:5.
Walter Mazzarri decides to make a substitution. Nordin Amrabat will be replaced by Troy Deeney (Watford).
Pep Guardiola has decided to make a change. Jesus Navas (Manchester City) replaces Leroy Sane.
The substitution is prepared. Bacary Sagna (Manchester City) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Yaya Toure.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the roof of the net. Heurelho Gomes guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The linesman points to the corner flag, Manchester City are going to take it.

Heurelho Gomes pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) fired on target after a rebound. His effort from inside the box flew straight towards the right post, but was stopped by the goalkeeper. Manchester City have been awarded a corner kick.
Substitution. Sergio Aguero is replaced by Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City).

Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the bottom left corner that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance. The referee blows his whistle, Watford are awarded a corner kick.
Walter Mazzarri prepares a substitution. M'Baye Niang is replaced by Dion Pereira (Watford).
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Jamie Vardy (Leicester) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the middle of the goal. Hugo Lloris has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) has a great chance to score from deep inside the box! He creates some space for the shot, but blazes it high over the crossbar. Very bad attempt.
Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) wastes a big chance! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box and it goes narrowly over the crossbar.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Heung-Min Son, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low accurate shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 0:1.

GOAL! Superb work from Dele Alli, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Heung-Min Son (Tottenham), who beats Kasper Schmeichel with a brilliant shot into the bottom left corner. 0:2.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Michael Oliver starts the second half.
Craig Shakespeare makes a half-time substitution. Islam Slimani (Leicester) comes on in place of Shinji Okazaki.
What a stunner from just outside the box! Benjamin Chilwell (Leicester) produces a perfect low drive into the middle of the goal.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) rises high to beat the goalkeeper with a perfect header. He heads the ball inside the right post.
Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Marc Albrighton (Leicester) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Substitution. Yohan Benalouane did his best and is replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).
Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) finds the back of the net with a strike from the edge of the penalty box, with the ball finding the bottom right corner of the goal.
The yellow card goes to Demarai Gray (Leicester).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Vincent Janssen (Tottenham) comes onto the pitch for Heung-Min Son.
Substitution. Ahmed Musa (Leicester) replaces Jamie Vardy.
The yellow card is received by Danny Simpson (Leicester). A mid-range free kick is awarded to Tottenham.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the right post!
Substitution. Mousa Dembele makes his way off the pitch and Filip Lesniak (Tottenham) comes on as his replacement.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Vincent Janssen (Tottenham) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Goal - 1:5! Harry Kane (Tottenham) gets a low shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the middle of the net. Filip Lesniak provided an assist for the goal.
Substitution. Moussa Sissoko will be replaced by Georges-Kevin N'Koudou (Tottenham).

Goal! That was a fantastic finish by Harry Kane (Tottenham) from just outside the box. He wasted little time in getting away a bullet of a shot that flew past the goalkeeper into the bottom left corner of the net.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Eric Bailly (Manchester United) probably handled the ball inside the penalty area. PENALTY to Southampton!

Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) places the ball on the penalty spot and sends it towards the left post. His effort isn't powerful enough, allowing Sergio Romero to dive and keep the ball out with an excellent save. The ball goes out of play. Southampton are awarded a corner kick.
Oriol Romeu (Southampton) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Dean had an easy-decision to make.

The free kick from a promising distance is taken by James Ward-Prowse (Southampton), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the left post. What a chance! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Manchester Utd.
Cedric Soares (Southampton) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Phil Jones (Manchester United) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Dusan Tadic (Southampton) fires the resulting free kick to the left side of the goal from the edge of the box, but Sergio Romero pulls off a superb save to deny him.

Oriol Romeu (Southampton) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the left post. Sergio Romero pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The ball is out of play and Southampton manage to earn a corner.
Jack Stephens (Southampton) gets to a rebound inside the goalmouth, but even from this distance he misses the target and fails to score.

James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the top right corner, but Sergio Romero easily deals with the threat. It will be a corner kick for Southampton.
Claude Puel has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) replacing Manolo Gabbiadini.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Axel Tuanzebe will be replaced by Michael Carrick (Manchester United).

Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Ben Foster to dive and make a save. Manchester City have a corner.

What a chance that is! Leroy Sane (Manchester City) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the right post.

Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Goal! Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 1:0.

Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes inside the right post. He couldn't have done it any better. 2:0.

A big opportunity is wasted by Sergio Aguero (Manchester City), who makes a yard for himself and produces a mid-range rocket of a shot towards the middle of the goal. Unfortunately for him, Ben Foster pulls off a fantastic save to stop the effort.
What a chance that is! Leroy Sane (Manchester City) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box, but he blazes it just over the crossbar.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.

Craig Dawson (West Brom) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.

Leroy Sane (Manchester City) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the top right corner, but Ben Foster was alert and the score remains the same. The referee signals a corner kick to Manchester City.

Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Ben Foster makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the right side of the goal.

Well-positioned Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot towards the top of the net, but Ben Foster reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop! Corner kick. Manchester City will have an opportunity.

Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the right post. Unfortunately for him, Jordan Pickford makes a great save to stop his effort.

That's a clear yellow card. Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) goes into the book.

Didier Ndong (Sunderland) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Petr Cech makes a decent save to deny his effort directed to the bottom left corner. Sunderland force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.

The foul by Cedric Soares (Southampton) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Neil Swarbrick.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Neil Swarbrick has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
David Silva takes over corner duties and expertly finds Vincent Kompany (Manchester City), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the middle of the goal. The score is now 0:1.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Shane Long (Southampton) for James Ward-Prowse.
Claude Puel has decided to make a change. Sofiane Boufal (Southampton) replaces Manolo Gabbiadini.
Goal! Leroy Sane (Manchester City) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Kevin De Bruyne, then sends the ball into the bottom left corner. 0:2.

Kevin De Bruyne sends a superb cross into the box. Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Fraser Forster beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:3.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Pablo Zabaleta (Manchester City) will replace David Silva.
Claude Puel decides to make a substitution. Shane Long will be replaced by Jay Rodriguez (Southampton).
Here comes a substitution. Leroy Sane is given a rest as he is replaced by Raheem Sterling (Manchester City).
Here is a change. Sergio Aguero is going off and Pep Guardiola gives the last tactical orders to Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City).
That's it for today, Neil Swarbrick has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Christian Fuchs sends a superb cross into the box. Robert Huth (Leicester) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the right post, leaving Wayne Hennessey beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.
Danny Simpson (Leicester) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Dean had an easy-decision to make.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Michael Dean starts the second half.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) jinks his way past two defenders and from the edge of the box has an effort which goes just wide of the left post.

An amazing individual effort from Jamie Vardy (Leicester) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball into the left side of the goal and makes it 1:2. Wayne Hennessey was helpless.
Goal! Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 1:2.
Andy King (Leicester) has tested the patience of referee Michael Dean and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. Crystal Palace have a free kick.
The substitution is prepared. Daniel Drinkwater (Leicester) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Andy King.
Samuel Allardyce decides to make a substitution. Jeffrey Schlupp will be replaced by Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace).

It's a goal! Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) makes it 2:2. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Andros Townsend and planted his close-range header into the bottom right corner. Kasper Schmeichel was helpless.
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) muscles his way past two defenders but his shot from inside the box smashes against the left post!
Substitution. Demarai Gray (Leicester) in, Riyad Mahrez out.
Craig Shakespeare has decided to make a change. Benjamin Chilwell (Leicester) replaces Yohan Benalouane.
Substitution. James McArthur (Crystal Palace) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Wilfried Zaha walks off.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.

Michael Keane (Burnley) won himself just enough space to connect with the corner inside the box. His header flew towards the right post, but the goalkeeper dived superbly to stop the effort. Burnley have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Kevin Mirallas (Everton) reacts well to get to the rebound and takes a shot from the edge of the box, but he fails to get the ball through the players standing between him and the goal.
Mark Clattenburg shows a yellow card to Idrissa Gueye (Everton), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Sam Vokes (Burnley) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Joel Robles.
The goalkeeper is not tested by the free kick from 20 metres out by Kevin Mirallas (Everton) as his effort only hit the wall. Everton win a corner.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Mark Clattenburg starts the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Ronald Koeman gives a chance to Enner Valencia (Everton) and Idrissa Gueye is off.

Enner Valencia (Everton) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Tom Heaton leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Goal! Ashley Williams plays the ball into the area and Phil Jagielka (Everton) gets on the end of it to glance a header into the back of the net. He makes it 1:0.
An opponent rises to his feet after being downed by Tom Heaton (Burnley). Mark Clattenburg saw the sliding tackle and blows for a foul. Everton are awarded a penalty!
Sam Vokes (Burnley) converts the penalty with ease by slotting the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal after the goalkeeper guesses wrong and dives the opposite way!
Tom Heaton pulls off a great save to deny Kevin Mirallas (Everton) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.

Kevin Mirallas (Everton) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
OWN GOAL! Ben Mee (Burnley) scores an unlucky own goal after he deflected a shot which went into his own net! 2:1.
Ross Barkley (Everton) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Andre Gray (Burnley) will replace Sam Vokes.
Goal - 3:1! Leighton Baines tees up Romelu Lukaku (Everton) inside the box and he curls the ball into the left side of the net and past Tom Heaton.
Here is a change. Kevin Mirallas is going off and Ronald Koeman gives the last tactical orders to Gareth Barry (Everton).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Daniel Agyei (Burnley) replaces Ashley Barnes.
Sean Dyche has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ashley Westwood (Burnley) replacing Jeff Hendrick.
Ronald Koeman prepares a substitution. Ross Barkley is replaced by Ademola Lookman (Everton).
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
GOAL! Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) got to the ball in front of the goal and he couldn't miss from there. His strike went in off the crossbar. The score is 1:0.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Saido Berahino (Stoke City) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Oumar Niasse (Hull City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Stuart Attwell had an easy-decision to make.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
GOAL! Harry Maguire (Hull City) got to the ball in front of the goal and he couldn't miss from there. His strike went in off the left-hand post. The score is 1:1.
Here is a change. Saido Berahino is going off and Mark Hughes gives the last tactical orders to Peter Crouch (Stoke City).
We are about to witness a substitution. Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) is replacing Charles Graham Adam.

A perfect lofted pass from Jonathan Walters finds Peter Crouch (Stoke City), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the bottom left corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Eldin Jakupovic had no chance of stopping that. 2:1.
Lazar Markovic (Hull City) receives a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee.
Substitution. Tom Huddlestone will be replaced by Abel Hernandez (Hull City).

What a beautiful moment! Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the top left corner. Eldin Jakupovic just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 3:1.
The manager makes a subsitution with Dieumerci Mbokani (Hull City) coming on for Oumar Niasse.
Marco Silva has decided to make a change.  replaces Lazar Markovic (Hull City).
It is time for a substitution. Mame Diouf (Stoke City) is on for Xherdan Shaqiri.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Lee Cattermole (Sunderland) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Andre Marriner had an easy-decision to make.
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) unleashes the free kick from the edge of the box. The ball goes towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper denies him.

A superb goal from great team play! Andre Ayew (West Ham) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent low shot inside the right post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.
Robert Snodgrass (West Ham) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the right post.
Unbelievable! Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland) scores direct from the corner. He curls the ball and it goes straight into the back of the net. 1:1.
Andre Ayew (West Ham) misses a rebound from close range. His effort floats narrowly over the crossbar!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Gooal! Robert Snodgrass takes over corner duties. James Collins (West Ham) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the bottom left corner. 1:2.

Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball goes behind for a corner. Sunderland will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Samuel Byram (West Ham) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Andre Marriner didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
CHANCE! Didier Ndong (Sunderland) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he blazes his shot well over the top.
The manager makes a subsitution with Adnan Januzaj (Sunderland) coming on for Lee Cattermole.
Slaven Bilic prepares a substitution. Robert Snodgrass is replaced by Havard Nordtveit (West Ham).
Billy Jones is substituted due to injury. David William Moyes gives a chance to Fabio Borini (Sunderland).
Here comes a substitution. Javier Manquillo is given a rest as he is replaced by Lamine Kone (Sunderland).

Goal! Fabio Borini (Sunderland) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom left corner. Darren Randolph is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 2:2.
Samuel Byram (West Ham) receives a yellow card from Andre Marriner and because it's his second he will have an early bath.
Victor Anichebe (Sunderland) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the right post. Terrific solo effort, though.
Here's the change. Andre Ayew leaves the pitch and Jonathan Calleri (West Ham) comes on as a substitute.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) has a sight of goal and shoots towards the right post, but the goalkeeper makes a superb save. Corner kick. Swansea will have an opportunity.
Federico Fernandez (Swansea) is furious with himself for wasting a glorious chance. He got to a rebound inside the 6-yard box, but his header floated over the crossbar.

Troy Deeney (Watford) hammers a powerful first-time shot from close range, sending the ball towards the top of the net, but the goalkeeper stops it with a miraculous save. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Watford.
Goal! Etienne Capoue (Watford) fires the rebound inside the left post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Lee Mason has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Substitution. Borja Baston (Swansea) replaces Luciano Narsingh.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Christian Kabasele (Watford) for Nordin Amrabat.
We are about to witness a substitution. Thomas Carroll (Swansea) is replacing Jay Fulton.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Stefano Okaka (Watford) replaces M'Baye Niang.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Stefano Okaka (Watford) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
Paul Clement has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jordan Ayew (Swansea) replacing Fernando Llorente.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Valon Behrami (Watford) is coming onto the pitch as Tom Cleverley cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.

Mousa Dembele (Tottenham) gets on the end of the corner kick deep inside the box and scores past the keeper with a superb low shot into the bottom right corner.
Goal - 2:0! Harry Kane laid the ball off to Heung-Min Son (Tottenham), who shot from close range low into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Michael Oliver has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.

Goal! Harry Kane (Tottenham) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 3:0.

A substitution has been made. Junior Stanislas is replaced by Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth).
Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Oliver had an easy-decision to make.
That's the end of the game for Benik Afobe, who is replaced by Lys Mousset (Bournemouth).
Here is a change. Harry Kane is going off and Mauricio Pochettino gives the last tactical orders to Victor Wanyama (Tottenham).
Here comes a substitution. Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) is brought on as a substitute for Dele Alli.
Mauricio Pochettino decides to make a substitution. Christian Eriksen will be replaced by Vincent Janssen (Tottenham).
Goal! Vincent Janssen (Tottenham) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 4:0.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Mohamed Elneny (Arsenal) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the left-hand post, but Wayne Hennessey was alert and the score remains the same. Arsenal earn a corner.
Fantastic team goal! Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) was set free in the area by Wilfried Zaha and fired past Emiliano Martinez. 1:0.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal) was quite harsh and Michael Oliver didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) latches on to a lovely pass inside the box and fires towards the left side of the net, but the effort is smothered by the keeper. Crystal Palace have been awarded a corner kick.
Michael Oliver has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Here comes a substitution. Mohamed Elneny is given a rest as he is replaced by Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal).
Here is a change. Danny Welbeck is going off and Arsene Wenger gives the last tactical orders to Olivier Giroud (Arsenal).
Goal - 2:0! Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) tries his luck from the edge of the box and scores with an accurate shot inside the left post. Wilfried Zaha provided an assist for the goal.

Michael Oliver blows his whistle and signals a foul after Damian Martinez (Arsenal) brought his opponent down. The referee makes a quick call and points to the penalty spot. Big scoring opportunity for Crystal Palace.
Luka Milivojevic (Crystal Palace) steps up and confidently powers the spot kick into the bottom left corner.
Arsene Wenger decides to make a substitution. Theo Walcott will be replaced by Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal).
Substitution. James McArthur (Crystal Palace) replaces Yohan Cabaye.
It's time for a substitution. Mathieu Flamini (Crystal Palace) comes on in place of Luka Milivojevic.

Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) controls a cross inside the box and sends a low drive towards the left post, but one of the defenders reacts superbly to block his effort. The ball is out of play. Crystal Palace will have a chance to score from a corner.
Substitution. Damien Delaney (Crystal Palace) in, Wilfried Zaha out.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Tom Davies (Everton) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Kevin Mirallas. The score is 1:0.
Islam Slimani (Leicester) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and nets into the bottom right corner.
Marc Albrighton (Leicester) scores a goal from the resulting free kick, sending it into the top right corner. What a strike that is, absolutely fantastic!

The ball hits the back of the net! Ross Barkley showcases his brilliant technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Romelu Lukaku (Everton) manages to convert it into a sweet goal. He heads it inside the right post and gets on the scoresheet  2:2.
The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Robert Huth (Leicester).
Kevin Mirallas (Everton) is booked by the referee.
Kevin Mirallas sends in a great cross from the corner, finding Phil Jagielka (Everton) who outjumps the defence to finish into the top right corner with a header. The score is 3:2.
Leighton Baines (Everton) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Madley has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) wins himself some space inside the box after the corner kick and finishes with a low shot into the middle of the goal.
Substitution. Demarai Gray makes way for Riyad Mahrez (Leicester).
Craig Shakespeare decides to make a substitution. Jamie Vardy will be replaced by Ahmed Musa (Leicester).
It's like he was asking for a caution. Andy King (Leicester) receives a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Morgan Schneiderlin leaves the pitch and Gareth Barry (Everton) comes on.
Substitution. Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) in, Marc Albrighton out.

Robert Huth (Leicester) gathers a nice lofted pass deep inside the box and attempts to put the ball low into the middle of the goal, but his shot is deflected away by one of the defending players. The referee signals a corner kick to Leicester.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Luke Shaw (Manchester United) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the bottom right corner, but Jordan Pickford made an astonishing save! Manchester Utd earn a corner.
Goal! Ander Herrera tees up Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) connects with a precise cross inside the goalmouth and shoots. One of the defending players reacts in time and clears the ball to safety.
Bryan Oviedo is substituted due to injury. David William Moyes gives a chance to Javier Manquillo (Sunderland).

Victor Anichebe (Sunderland) makes a good run inside the box to meet a precise cross. He latches on to it and shoots, but the goalkeeper pulls off an excellent save. Corner kick. Sunderland will have an opportunity.
Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland) makes an ugly tackle on his opponent and is sent off by the referee!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Brilliant finish! Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Manchester United) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Luke Shaw, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 0:2.
Daley Blind (Manchester United) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Luke Shaw.
Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Jose Mourinho has decided to make a change. Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) replaces Jesse Lingard.
Substitution. Fabio Borini (Sunderland) has come on for Lee Cattermole.
The substitution has been made. Anthony Martial (Manchester United) has replaced Henrikh Mkhitaryan.
A yellow card is awarded to Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United).
Anthony Martial (Manchester United) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The free kick from the edge of the box is taken by Paul Pogba (Manchester United), who fires in a direct effort just wide of the right post. What a chance!
Didier Ndong (Sunderland) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Goal! Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Zlatan Ibrahimovic, then sends the ball into the bottom left corner. 0:3.
What was Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Victor Moses (Chelsea) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Andre Marriner pulls out a yellow card.
OWN GOAL! Adam Smith (Bournemouth) scores an unlucky own goal after he deflected a shot which went into his own net! 0:1.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) receives a well-taken defence-splitting pass inside the box and scores! He buries the ball into the bottom left corner.
Harry Arter (Bournemouth) gathers the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot. The ball only rattles the right post.
Harry Arter (Bournemouth) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.

A good lofted pass from Benik Afobe finds Joshua King (Bournemouth) on the edge of the area. He collects the ball and rips in a wonderful shot which ends up in the top right corner. The score is now 1:2.
Andre Marriner has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
Caution goes to N'Golo Kante (Chelsea).
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) scores a beautiful goal from the resulting free kick. He bends the ball into the top right corner. A technically stunning goal.
Eddie Howe decides to make a substitution. Marc Pugh will be replaced by Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth).
Pedro (Chelsea) is yellow-carded.
Lys Mousset (Bournemouth) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Benik Afobe.

The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.

Evandro (Hull City) has tested the patience of referee Jonathan Moss and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
An unfortunate own goal is conceded by Ahmed Elmohamady (Hull City), who attempted to smack the ball away after a cross, but instead he sends it inside the left post of his own goal.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Goal! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 2:0.
Marco da Silva has decided to substitute Evandro and he is replaced by Abel Hernandez (Hull City).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Markus Henriksen (Hull City) for Sam Clucas.
Fabian Delph (Manchester City) latches on to a superb pass and breaks through the defence before firing a shot from mid-range that goes past the goalkeeper inside the right post.

Alfred John Momar N'Diaye (Hull City) is shown a yellow card after a horrible tackle.
It's time for a substitution. Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) comes on in place of David Silva.
Pep Guardiola decides to make a substitution. Yaya Toure will be replaced by Fernando (Manchester City).
Oumar Niasse comes off the pitch to be replaced by Shaun Maloney (Hull City).

3:1. Andrea Ranocchia (Hull City) latches on to a pass on the edge of the penalty area and immediately fires in a fantastic first-time effort. His rocket of a shot goes through Claudio Bravo and low into the middle of the goal. Shaun Maloney provided the assistance.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.
Robbie Brady (Burnley) takes the resulting free kick from the edge of the box. His rocket of a shot crashes against the crossbar! What a shot.
Stephen Ward (Burnley) is booked for saying more than Martin Atkinson was willing to tolerate.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) is given a yellow card.
What a chance that is! Robbie Brady (Burnley) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the right post.
Substitution. Christian Stuani makes way for Alvaro Negredo (Middlesbrough).
Sean Dyche prepares a substitution. Andre Gray is replaced by Sam Vokes (Burnley).
Alvaro Negredo (Middlesbrough) picks up a lofted cross inside the box and fires a quick shot to the middle of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Tom Heaton, who pulls off a stunning save!
Rudy Gestede goes off the pitch and Adama Traore (Middlesbrough) comes on.
Tom Heaton pulls off a great save to deny Adam Clayton (Middlesbrough), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
Sam Vokes (Burnley) takes a wonderful touch after collecting a pass inside the box. He steers his low drive towards the right post, but the keeper dives low to keep the ball out.

Robbie Brady (Burnley) attempts to threaten the goalkeeper from the free kick on the edge of the box. He produces a stunning blast which only flies inches over the crossbar. It could have been a beautiful goal!
We are about to witness a subsitution. Patrick Bamford (Middlesbrough) for Bernardo Espinosa.
Michael Keane (Burnley) makes an awful challenge on his opponent and can count himself very lucky that the referee didn't issue a red card.
A poorly taken free kick by Stewart Downing (Middlesbrough)! He sends a shot from the edge of the box into the defensive wall. The ball is out of play. Middlesbrough win a corner kick.
The game has come to an end for Ashley Barnes. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of James Tarkowski (Burnley).

The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) is coming onto the pitch as Joe Allen cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) threw away a promising scoring opportunity. He received a fine cross inside the 6-yard box, but missed to the left of the target.

A perfect lofted pass from Xherdan Shaqiri finds Jonathan Walters (Stoke City), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the top right corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Simon Mignolet had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
