Ragnar Klavan (Liverpool) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.

Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and drills a shot to the middle of the goal, but is denied by a reflex save from Simon Mignolet. It will be a corner kick for Stoke.
James Milner (Liverpool) meets a cross inside the box, but he is unable to produce an accurate header and it goes just over the bar. The ball goes out of play and Stoke will have a goal kick.
Here is a change. Jonathan Walters is going off and Mark Hughes gives the last tactical orders to Glenn Whelan (Stoke City).
The substitution is prepared. Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Divock Origi.
Goal! Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the left post. It's 1:1.

A good lofted pass from Georginio Wijnaldum finds Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) on the edge of the area. He collects the ball and rips in a wonderful shot which ends up in the roof of the net. The score is now 1:2.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) picked up a yellow card from referee.

A cross following the corner kick finds its way to Bruno Martins Indi (Stoke City) inside the box and he manages to steer it low to the middle of the target. He is about to start celebrating a goal, but Simon Mignolet makes a save in the nick of time to maintain the current score. The referee signals a corner kick to Stoke.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Ramadan Sobhi (Stoke City) for Charles Graham Adam.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.

Jordy Clasie (Southampton) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the top right corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 0:1.
Jonny Evans (West Brom) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Chris Kavanagh had an easy-decision to make.
Fraser Forster makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the top left corner by Salomon Rondon (West Brom) after a cross from the side.
Shane Long (Southampton) rises high to meet a perfect cross, but powers his header just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and West Brom will have a goal kick.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Matt Phillips (West Brom) is very lucky to stay on the pitch after using excessive force to bring down his opponent with a two-footed challenge.
It will be a substitution. Chris Brunt (West Brom) is ready to enter the pitch as Gareth McAuley walks off.
Substitution. Matt Phillips makes way for James McClean (West Brom).
Tony Pulis has decided to make a change. Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) replaces Darren Fletcher.
Nathan Redmond (Southampton) was waiting for the ball on the penalty spot and produced a powerful volley towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper made an amazing save to deny him.

Dusan Tadic (Southampton) and his stunning dribble! He zig-zags through the defence and gets in front of the keeper. He faints to shoot and then suddenly strikes goalwards, but his effort misses the target by a whisker. Very unlucky for Dusan Tadic (Southampton). This could have been a legendary goal. The ball goes out of play and West Brom will have a goal kick.
A substitution has been made. Nathan Redmond is replaced by Joshua Sims (Southampton).
Here is a change. James Ward-Prowse is going off and Claude Puel gives the last tactical orders to Sam McQueen (Southampton).
Chris Kavanagh shows a yellow card to Cedric Soares (Southampton) for his blatant foul.
A substitution has been made. Jordy Clasie goes off and Harrison Reed (Southampton) comes on.

Craig Dawson (West Brom) latches on to a precise lofted cross inside the box, controls the ball and unleashes a fine strike towards the roof of the net. His dangerous effort is blocked by Fraser Forster, who makes a glorious save!
Fraser Forster (Southampton) picked up a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee. He has to be careful for the remainder of the match.
Jonny Evans (West Brom) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the underside of the crossbar is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper.
That's it for today, Chris Kavanagh has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.

What a save from Lukasz Fabianski! Robert Snodgrass (West Ham) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant save to keep it out.
Andre Ayew (West Ham) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Lukasz Fabianski is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Mark Noble (West Ham) is penalised.
Michail Antonio is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Jonathan Calleri (West Ham).

Brilliant finish! Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Robert Snodgrass, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 1:0.
Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) picked up a yellow card from referee.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Kevin Friend blows his whistle to start the second half.
Paul Clement has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Luciano Narsingh (Swansea) comes on the pitch for Wayne Routledge.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Thomas Carroll is replaced by Fernando Llorente (Swansea).
Kevin Friend rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Manuel Lanzini (West Ham).
Jack Cork goes off the pitch and Jefferson Montero (Swansea) comes on.
Here is a change. Robert Snodgrass is going off and Slaven Bilic gives the last tactical orders to Sofiane Feghouli (West Ham).
Federico Fernandez (Swansea) is given a yellow card.
Andre Ayew (West Ham) is the one who receives a yellow card.

Andre Ayew (West Ham) picks up the rebound inside the penalty area and releases a good shot to the left side of the goal. Unfortunately for him, Lukasz Fabianski shows how quick his reflexes are and dives superbly to stop his effort. What a save but what a wasted opportunity! It will be a corner kick for West Ham.
Substitution. Andre Ayew makes his way off the pitch and Edimilson Fernandes (West Ham) comes on as his replacement.
The referee shows the yellow card to Darren Randolph (West Ham).
That's it for today, Kevin Friend has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Heurelho Gomes pulls off a great save to deny Vincent Janssen (Tottenham), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.

OFF THE BAR! Vincent Janssen (Tottenham) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the crossbar! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.

Heung-Min Son passes to Dele Alli (Tottenham), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the top right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 1:0.
Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) is cautioned by the referee.

Goal! Eric Dier (Tottenham) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. Heurelho Gomes is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 2:0.

Christian Eriksen slides a pass towards Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) who unleashes a fabulous shot from long range. The ball goes behind the surprised goalkeeper and into the bottom left corner. The score is now 3:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
What a hit! Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 4:0.
Here comes a substitution. Camilo Zuniga (Watford) is brought on as a substitute for Abdoulaye Doucoure.
Mauricio Pochettino decides to make a substitution. Vincent Janssen will be replaced by Harry Kane (Tottenham).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Troy Deeney (Watford) is coming onto the pitch as Nordin Amrabat cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) receives a good pass just outside the box, unleashes a strike from a promising position, but the shot is blocked by the defender.
The manager makes a subsitution with Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) coming on for Mousa Dembele.
Golden chance! Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.

What a chance that is! Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass on the edge of the box and fires towards the net. Unfortunately for him, he only hits the crossbar!
The substitution has been made. Christian Kabasele (Watford) has replaced Stefano Okaka.
Substitution. Joshua Onomah (Tottenham) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Heung-Min Son walks off.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) wastes a promising chance! He tries his luck with a shot from mid-range, but his effort hits the crossbar! A few inches lower and it could have been a sweet goal!
That's all for today as the game is over.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) scores as he latches on to a pass inside the penalty box and fires a perfect strike that goes inside the left post.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) picks up a pass and has an effort from the edge of the box, but Thibaut Courtois gets down to his right to keep it out.
CHANCE! Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) has a shot from inside the box which is deflected and crashes against the crossbar! Good work from Chelsea as they win a corner.

Thibaut Courtois can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from David Silva (Manchester City). The ball would have probably ended up inside the left post.
Goal! The rebound fell to Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:1.
Leroy Sane (Manchester City) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
Michael Dean blows his whistle and signals a foul after Fernandinho (Manchester City) brought his opponent down. No point in arguing there. Chelsea will take a penalty kick.

Eden Hazard (Chelsea) places the ball on the penalty spot and sends it towards the bottom right corner. His effort isn't powerful enough, though, allowing Wilfredo Caballero to dive and keep the ball out with an excellent save.
Goal! Eden Hazard (Chelsea) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 2:1.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
Antonio Conte has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Nemanja Matic (Chelsea) comes on the pitch for Kurt Zouma.

Vincent Kompany (Manchester City) wasted a great chance as he climbed high to connect with a cross from the free kick inside the penalty area. He planted a header against the bar and it glanced away off it.
Gael Clichy (Manchester City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Dean had an easy-decision to make.
John Stones (Manchester City) wins himself just enough space inside the box to connect with the corner. His header flies towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper blocks the effort.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) is afforded space inside the box after collecting a pass, but the chance is wasted as his shot goes harmlessly over the crossbar.
Fabian Delph (Manchester City) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Substitution. Kevin De Bruyne is replaced by Raheem Sterling (Manchester City).
Antonio Conte has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Willian (Chelsea) replacing Cesc Fabregas.
Vincent Kompany (Manchester City) makes a really bad tackle on his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nolito (Manchester City) comes onto the pitch for Leroy Sane.
Here is a change. Eden Hazard is going off and Antonio Conte gives the last tactical orders to Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea).

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) receives a lofted pass and is given time inside the box to unleash a shot goalwards. The ball is directed towards the bottom right corner, but it lacks power and Thibaut Courtois pulls off a comfortable save to thwart the effort. The referee signals a corner kick to Manchester City.
N'Golo Kante (Chelsea) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Dean ignores the protests.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.
Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) comes face-to-face with the goalkeeper and smashes the ball into the bottom right corner!
Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) finds himself with a great opportunity! He unleashes a shot from the edge of the box, which whizzes just wide of the right post!

Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) blows a good opportunity. He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific shot from the edge of the box towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one!
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) for a tough tackle.

Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the middle of the goal. Artur Boruc has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Close effort! Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) takes the resulting free kick from a promising distance, but he sends it narrowly wide of the right post.

Goal! Roberto Firmino plays in Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders and from inside the box slots it into the bottom left corner 1:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Lee Mason has ended it.
The second half has just started.

What a great touch by Nathaniel Clyne (Liverpool)! He picks up a precise pass inside the box and immediately produces a shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, his bullet only crashes against the crossbar.
Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) finds himself unmarked on the edge of the box, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.
It's in the back of the net! Georginio Wijnaldum puts the ball on a plate for Divock Origi (Liverpool), who has an easy finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 2:1.
Substitution. Jordon Ibe leaves the pitch and is replaced by Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth).
Here is a change. Philippe Coutinho is going off and Jurgen Klopp gives the last tactical orders to Joel Matip (Liverpool).
Max Gradel (Bournemouth) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Marc Pugh.
Goal! Joshua King (Bournemouth) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the bottom left corner. He makes it 2:2.
Joel Matip (Liverpool) rises high to meet a cross from the corner kick and plants a header from inside the penalty area. His effort went just narrowly wide of the left post.
Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth) is yellow-carded.
Ragnar Klavan (Liverpool) wins the ball near the penalty spot and unleashes a header towards the right post, but Artur Boruc is alert and denies him.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Martin Atkinson shows the yellow card to Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) for a heavy challenge.

Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) clutches his head in despair after blowing a huge opportunity! He receives the ball after the free kick and takes good first touch to unleash a low shot from close range, but Darren Randolph makes a nice save.
A yellow card for a tackle by Manuel Lanzini (West Ham). Martin Atkinson doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Michail Antonio will not participate anymore and Robert Snodgrass (West Ham) is coming on.

Goal! Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom left corner. Darren Randolph is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 1:0.
Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Darren Randolph pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Martin Atkinson had an easy-decision to make.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Andrew Carroll as he is replaced by Diafra Sakho (West Ham).
Goal! Mesut Ozil displays great vision and sends a pass to Theo Walcott (Arsenal), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 2:0.
Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) comes close to scoring. He peels away from his marker and gets on the end of a cross from Alexis Sanchez, but he hits a shot just wide of the left post.
Arsene Wenger has decided to make a change. Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) replaces Danny Welbeck.

Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) blows a good opportunity. He has a lot of space around him and fires a terrific shot from the edge of the box towards the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a brilliant save and stops this one!
The foul by Samuel Byram (West Ham) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Martin Atkinson.
The substitution is prepared. Edimilson Fernandes (West Ham) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Mark Noble.
Arsene Wenger decides to make a substitution. Theo Walcott will be replaced by Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal).
Substitution. Mohamed Elneny makes his way off the pitch and Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) comes on as his replacement.
Goal! Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) collects a pass and without hesitation fires an unstoppable shot inside the left post.
That's it for today, Martin Atkinson has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has started.
Oumar Niasse (Hull City) has a goal ruled out for offside!
Alvaro Negredo (Middlesbrough) produces a beautiful volley and the ball goes into the back of the net!
Abel Hernandez (Hull City) controls a cross inside the box and shoots towards goal, but one of the defenders reacts superbly to block his effort.
Goal! Lazar Markovic (Hull City) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 1:1.
Michael Oliver shows the yellow card to Sam Clucas (Hull City) for a heavy challenge.
Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to Adam Clayton (Middlesbrough) for a tough tackle.
Goal! Oumar Niasse (Hull City) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner.

Eldin Jakupovic gets a well deserved ovation! Alvaro Negredo (Middlesbrough) produces a decent first-time strike towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it. Nice goalkeeping skills.
What a hit! Abel Hernandez (Hull City) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 3:1.
GOAL! The corner comes over and Benjamin Gibson wins a simple header before Marten de Roon (Middlesbrough) nods the ball into the back of the net. 3:2.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Abel Hernandez is being substituted because of an injury. Marco Silva sends Evandro (Hull City) on the pitch.
Here's the change. James Husband leaves the pitch and Adlene Guedioura (Middlesbrough) comes on as a substitute.
The ball from the free kick finds its way to Harry Maguire (Hull City) who rises and scores with a thunderous header inside the left post. An incredible long-range header!
Steve Agnew has decided to substitute Alvaro Negredo and he is replaced by Patrick Bamford (Middlesbrough).
Harry Maguire has picked up an injury and is replaced by Michael Dawson (Hull City).
Here comes a substitution. Christian Stuani (Middlesbrough) is brought on as a substitute for Rudy Gestede.
Alfred John Momar N'Diaye (Hull City) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Marco Silva has decided to make a change. Markus Henriksen (Hull City) replaces Kamil Grosicki.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Shane Long (Southampton) takes the chance to have an effort at goal from inside the box but misses to the left of the target.
OFF THE POST! Luka Milivojevic (Crystal Palace) produces a stunning shot towards goal from the free kick, but the ball rattles the right post.

Nathan Redmond (Southampton) receives a lofted pass and is given time inside the box to unleash a shot goalwards. The ball is directed towards the left side of the goal, but it lacks power and Wayne Hennessey pulls off a comfortable save to thwart the effort. Southampton will take a corner kick.

Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition. The ball is out of play. Crystal Palace will have a chance to score from a corner.
It's in the back of the net! Andros Townsend plays it into the box, and Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 0:1.
Nathan Redmond (Southampton) latches onto a cross in the penalty area and fires the ball into the bottom right corner!
The end of the first half.
Roger East blows his whistle and the second half starts.
It will be a substitution. Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) is ready to enter the pitch as Yohan Cabaye walks off.
James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) announces himself with a close-range shot after a cross, but one of the defenders gets in the way of the ball to thwart him.
Cedric Soares (Southampton) misses the left post by a whisker with a mid-range rebound. What a chance that was!
Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went inches over the bar.
Shane Long (Southampton) is afforded space inside the box after collecting a pass, but the chance is wasted as his shot goes harmlessly over the crossbar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jeffery Schlupp departs the field of play to be replaced by Damien Delaney (Crystal Palace).
Martin Kelly (Crystal Palace) takes a nice first touch to control a cross and shoots at goal from near the penalty spot, but his effort only hits the right-hand post!
Shane Long (Southampton) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Wayne Hennessey. Southampton win a corner.
Oriol Romeu (Southampton) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Roger East didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The foul by Cedric Soares (Southampton) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Roger East.
What a chance! Steven Davis (Southampton) gets on the end of a pass inside the box and takes a shot to the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players makes a crucial goal-line clearance.

Steven Davis (Southampton) reacts well to latch onto a rebound inside the box, but his shot is well blocked. The ball goes behind for a corner. Southampton will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Goal! Maya Yoshida (Southampton) scores after an assist by Jack Stephens that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:1.
Goal! Cedric Soares feeds James Ward-Prowse (Southampton), who taps the ball into an empty net. He makes it 3:1.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton) for Steven Davis.
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) receives a yellow card.
Samuel Allardyce has decided to make a change. Mathieu Flamini (Crystal Palace) replaces Luka Milivojevic.
Substitution. Nathan Redmond makes way for Jay Rodriguez (Southampton).

Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top right corner only for Fraser Forster to dive and make a save. Crystal Palace have been awarded a corner kick.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.
Goal! Jordan Ayew puts the ball on a plate for Wayne Routledge (Swansea), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 1:0.
Jordan Ayew (Swansea) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
The end of the first half.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

He should have scored! Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) gathered a short pass deep inside the box but took too long to shoot, allowing the defender to make the block. The ball goes behind for a corner. Tottenham will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Moussa Sissoko will be replaced by Vincent Janssen (Tottenham).
The substitution has been made. Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea) has replaced Kyle Naughton.
Here is a change. Jordan Ayew is going off and Paul Clement gives the last tactical orders to Oliver McBurnie (Swansea).
Eric Dier (Tottenham) has tested the patience of referee Jonathan Moss and goes into the book for a previous late challenge. A free kick is awarded to Swansea.
Substitution. Ben Davies is replaced by Georges-Kevin N'Koudou (Tottenham).
Lukasz Fabianski pulls off a fantastic save! Dele Alli (Tottenham) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the right post, but the effort is kept out.
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) decides to strike the ball towards goal, but his effort fails to threaten the goalkeeper after being blocked by one of the defenders.
Goal! Dele Alli (Tottenham) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:1.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) unleashes a quick low drive into the middle of the net and past the goalkeeper. Here is an example of luck being on your side.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Heung-Min Son as he is replaced by Kieran Trippier (Tottenham).
Substitution. Wayne Routledge will be replaced by Luciano Narsingh (Swansea).
Brilliant finish! Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Dele Alli, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 1:3.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
GOAL - 0:1! The corner comes over and Ashley Williams flicks on with his head to Phil Jagielka (Everton), who makes no mistake and fires the ball into the back of the net.
Daley Blind (Manchester United) sets the ball for the free kick from 18 metres out. His attempt is aimed towards the top right corner, but Joel Robles is alert and makes a comfortable save.
Ander Herrera (Manchester United) fires a rebound from close range onto the bar!

Ander Herrera (Manchester United) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Joel Robles, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Manchester Utd.
Neil Swarbrick shows a yellow card to Idrissa Gueye (Everton), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Neil Swarbrick has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Jose Mourinho probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Daley Blind. He is replaced by Paul Pogba (Manchester United).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Gareth Barry (Everton) was quite harsh and Neil Swarbrick didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Paul Pogba (Manchester United) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His almost perfect header hits the bar and ricochets away off it.
It's a yellow card for Ashley Young (Manchester United).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Michael Carrick as he is replaced by Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Manchester United).
Jose Mourinho has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Luke Shaw (Manchester United) replacing Ashley Young.
Today's match ends for Kevin Mirallas who will be replaced by Matthew Pennington (Everton).
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
That will be all from Ross Barkley who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton).
Tom Davies (Everton) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Neil Swarbrick had an easy-decision to make.
Joel Robles (Everton) was probably a bit loose with his words to Neil Swarbrick, who decides to show him a yellow.
Handball by Ashley Williams (Everton). PENALTY to Manchester Utd!
Ashley Williams (Everton) is ordered to leave the field of play by the referee after receiving a red card!
Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) steps up to take the penalty and leaves the keeper helpless with a shot into the bottom right corner.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Stephen Ward (Burnley) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Joey Barton (Burnley) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Kevin Friend blows his whistle to start the second half.
Substitution. Robbie Brady (Burnley) has come on for Steven Defour.

Jeff Hendrick passes to George Boyd (Burnley) who collects the ball and unleashes a shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the middle of the net and past the surprised goalkeeper. The score is 1:0.
Mark Hughes has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Peter Crouch (Stoke City) replacing Saido Berahino.
The foul by Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Kevin Friend.
Sean Dyche prepares a substitution. Andre Gray is replaced by Ashley Barnes (Burnley).
We are about to witness a subsitution. James Tarkowski (Burnley) for Sam Vokes.
Mark Hughes has decided to make a change. Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City) replaces Joe Allen.
Kevin Friend shows a yellow card to Bruno Martins Indi (Stoke City) for a tough tackle.
George Boyd (Burnley) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Graham Scott shows the yellow card to Lee Cattermole (Sunderland) for a heavy challenge.

Demarai Gray (Leicester) shows great individual ability and unleashes a beautiful strike from about 25 metres. His effort heads inside the right post but is saved by Jordan Pickford. The score remains the same. The referee signals a corner kick to Leicester.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The whistle blows and Graham Scott starts the second half.
Substitution. Shinji Okazaki is replaced by Islam Slimani (Leicester).
Here is a change. Demarai Gray is going off and Craig Shakespeare gives the last tactical orders to Marc Albrighton (Leicester).
A header by Robert Huth (Leicester) from very close range goes towards the bottom right corner, but doesn't get past Jordan Pickford, who makes a brilliant save.

A perfect lofted pass from Marc Albrighton finds Islam Slimani (Leicester), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the bottom right corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Jordan Pickford had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
Substitution. Lee Cattermole did his best and is replaced by Victor Anichebe (Sunderland).
David William Moyes prepares a substitution. Sebastian Larsson is replaced by Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland).
Victor Anichebe (Sunderland) has a sight of goal and fires from the edge of the box, but his strike rattles the left post!
Goal! Marc Albrighton displays great vision and sends a pass to Jamie Vardy (Leicester), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the top left corner. The score is 2:0.
David William Moyes decides to make a substitution. Jack Rodwell will be replaced by Darron Gibson (Sunderland).
Substitution. Wilfred Ndidi will be replaced by Andy King (Leicester).
Graham Scott is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Nacer Chadli (West Brom) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Heurelho Gomes.

Goal! M'Baye Niang (Watford) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box inside the right post. Ben Foster had no chance of reaching it. The score is 1:0.
Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Paul Tierney had an easy-decision to make. West Brom win a free kick. It's a promising situation for a direct shot.
Nacer Chadli (West Brom) fires in the free kick from a promising position just outside the box. It's a fantastic strike and looks set for glory, but it only rattles the left post!
Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) has tested the patience of referee Paul Tierney and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Problems for Walter Mazzarri as Sebastian Prodl is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Daryl Janmaat (Watford) replaces him.
The referee gives a yellow card to James McClean (West Brom).
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. James McClean is replaced by Matt Phillips (West Brom).
Troy Deeney (Watford) hits a shot towards goal after getting on the end of a cross and the goalkeeper fails to keep it out even though the ball is not struck perfectly!
Tony Pulis has decided to substitute Gareth McAuley and he is replaced by James Morrison (West Brom).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jake Livermore (West Brom) was quite harsh and Paul Tierney didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jake Livermore departs the field of play to be replaced by Jose Rondon (West Brom).

Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) must have known he would be sent off for this foul, but he had to stop the opponent at all costs. Paul Tierney shows him a second yellow card and the game has ended for him.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Adrian Mariappa (Watford) for Nordin Amrabat.
Paul Tierney shows a yellow card to M'Baye Niang (Watford) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. M'Baye Niang leaves the pitch and is replaced by Isaac Success (Watford).
Allan Nyom (West Brom) has tested the patience of referee Paul Tierney and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
Goal! Kevin De Bruyne produces a great pass that finds Leroy Sane (Manchester City) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a low shot into the back of the net. 0:1.
Jesus Navas (Manchester City) sees a yellow card from Andre Marriner after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

What a great touch by Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City)! He picks up a precise pass on the edge of the box and immediately unleashes a shot on goal. His effort, however, only rattles the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.

David Silva (Manchester City) gets to a rebound in front of goal and sends the ball towards the right-hand post. However, he couldn't beat David Ospina, who shows off his superb goalkeeping ability by pulling off a great save.
Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Andre Marriner didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) for a tough tackle.
Goal! Theo Walcott (Arsenal) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and strikes the ball into the bottom left corner.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) misses a great chance to score after his effort hits the left post!
Goal! David Silva produces a great pass that finds Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom left corner. 1:2.
CHANCE! Theo Walcott (Arsenal) picks up a perfect pass inside the box, makes himself some space for a shot, but his effort goes just over the crossbar.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Laurent Koscielny is replaced by Gabriel (Arsenal).
Pep Guardiola has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Yaya Toure (Manchester City) comes on the pitch for Raheem Sterling.
Today's referee Andre Marriner rightly decides to book Fernandinho (Manchester City) for his harsh tackle.
Goal! Mesut Ozil launched the corner kick and superbly found the head of Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal), whose accurate header from near the penalty spot went into the right side of the goal. It's 2:2.
Chance! Fernandinho (Manchester City) gets to the rebound on the edge of the box and smashes the ball towards the left side of the goal, but David Ospina is alert and makes a save to deny him.
The yellow card goes to Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal).
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) rises above the defenders and places a towering header towards the left post, but David Ospina is prepared and dives to thwart him.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Theo Walcott will be replaced by Olivier Giroud (Arsenal).
Arsene Wenger prepares a substitution. Danny Welbeck is replaced by Alex Iwobi (Arsenal).
Substitution. David Silva walks off the pitch and Pablo Zabaleta (Manchester City) comes on as a substitute.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
A brilliant individual effort! Martin Olsson (Swansea) tricks his way past challenges into the box and blazes his shot just a few inches over the top.
Today's referee Robert Madley rightly decides to book Leroy Fer (Swansea) for his harsh tackle.
Robert Madley shows a yellow card to Fabio (Middlesbrough) for a tough tackle.
Thomas Carroll (Swansea) collects a wonderful lead pass and creates some space to smash the ball goalwards from long range. His shot goes painfully wide of the left post!
Gaston Ramirez is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Rudy Gestede (Middlesbrough).
Robert Madley has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Adama Traore (Middlesbrough) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the left post. Terrific solo effort, though.
Alvaro Negredo (Middlesbrough) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls it and sends it straight at Lukasz Fabianski, who makes a comfortable save.
Alfie Mawson (Swansea) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Robert Madley ignores the protests.
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) has a sight of goal, fires a shot in from distance towards the right post and forces a good save out of Victor Valdes.
Steve Agnew is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Fabio suffers an injury and Adam Forshaw (Middlesbrough) comes on.
A yellow card for a tackle by Alvaro Negredo (Middlesbrough). Robert Madley doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Robert Madley shows a yellow card to Rudy Gestede (Middlesbrough), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
What a big chance! Leroy Fer (Swansea) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
Rudy Gestede (Middlesbrough) rises above the defence inside the box, but his header flies narrowly wide of the left post.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.

The ball from the corner kick lands at the feet of Andrew Surman (Bournemouth) deep inside the box and he takes a shot. His low strike heads towards the middle of the target, but it's deflected away thanks to a brilliant intervention by one of the defenders.

Golden chance! Dusan Tadic (Southampton) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Bournemouth.

It's unbelievable, Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) blows a huge opportunity! He is totally unmarked and fires a first-time shot towards the roof of the net, but Artur Boruc reacts superbly to keep the ball out. It will be a corner kick for Southampton.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half gets underway.
Eddie Howe is forced to make a change. Andrew Surman is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Harry Arter (Bournemouth).
Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Southampton will have a goal kick.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Sofiane Boufal (Southampton) for James Ward-Prowse.
Claude Puel prepares a substitution. Jay Rodriguez is replaced by Shane Long (Southampton).
Shane Long (Southampton) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Substitution. Joshua King makes his way off the pitch and Jack Wilshere (Bournemouth) comes on as his replacement.

That was absolutely fantastic! Adam Smith (Bournemouth) tries his luck with a hammer shot from long range, but his effort only rattles the left post! Here is an example of luck not being on your side.
Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Fraser Forster.
Ryan Bertrand (Southampton) is penalised for holding. Jonathan Moss signals a set piece. The referee uncompromisingly points to the spot and it's a penalty to Bournemouth.
Harry Arter (Bournemouth) doesn't keep his cool and fails to convert the penalty. He skies the ball way over the bar and into the stands.
The game has come to an end for Dusan Tadic. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Sam McQueen (Southampton).

Harry Arter (Bournemouth) tries his luck with a long-range effort after receiving a precise pass. It goes to the right side of the goal, but Fraser Forster has a clear view of it and makes a comfortable save.
Oriol Romeu (Southampton) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Jonathan Moss is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Dele Alli (Tottenham) latched on to an accurate pass deep into the box and attempted to fire the ball past the keeper, but the shot is way off target. What a miskick!
Victor Wanyama is substituted due to injury. Mauricio Pochettino gives a chance to Mousa Dembele (Tottenham).
Harry Winks is being substituted because of an injury. Mauricio Pochettino sends Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) on the pitch.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Stuart Attwell shows a yellow card to Michael Keane (Burnley) for his blatant foul.
Ben Davies (Tottenham) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the left post. Tom Heaton is alert and denies him with a nice save.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sam Vokes (Burnley) comes onto the pitch for Andre Gray.
Goal! Eric Dier (Tottenham) fires the rebound inside the right post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 0:1.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Vincent Janssen will be replaced by Heung-Min Son (Tottenham).
Sean Dyche has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Robbie Brady (Burnley) replacing George Boyd.
Goal! Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) finishes from close range with an easy finish and he makes it 0:2. He was ably assisted there by Dele Alli.
Here comes a substitution. Steven Defour (Burnley) is brought on as a substitute for Scott Arfield.
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) has tested the patience of referee Stuart Attwell and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
It's 1:0! Eden Hazard feeds Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the bottom left corner.

A wonderful pass found its target. Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) received it well and shot from about 14 metres out. He did really well to send the ball past the goalkeeper and into the bottom left corner.
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems fires the ball into the back of the net.

Wayne Hennessey earns applause from the crowd! He dives superbly to deny a dangerous first-time effort from the edge of the six-yard box. Diego Costa (Chelsea) was the player who tested the keeper's reflexes. Nice goalkeeping skills.

That was a brilliant piece of goalkeeping! Wayne Hennessey dived superbly to block a header by Nemanja Matic (Chelsea) from around the penalty spot. His effort was directed straight towards the roof of the net, but Wayne Hennessey pulled off a remarkable save! The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Chelsea.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Here is a change after the half-time break. James Tomkins is replaced by Scott Dann (Crystal Palace).
Diego Costa (Chelsea) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Substitution. Nemanja Matic leaves the pitch and is replaced by Willian (Chelsea).
Samuel Allardyce has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Damien Delaney (Crystal Palace) replacing Scott Dann.
A substitution has been made. Andros Townsend is replaced by Martin Kelly (Crystal Palace).

Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Thibaut Courtois guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Crystal Palace.
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Luka Milivojevic (Crystal Palace) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea) will replace Marcos Alonso.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) rises high to meet a perfect cross, but powers his header just wide of the left post.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Gary Cahill (Chelsea) is given a yellow card.
The referee gives a yellow card to David Luiz (Chelsea) for talking back. He must be careful for the remainder of the match.

Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Wayne Hennessey leaps like a salmon to deny him.
That was close by Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes by a whisker over the crossbar.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea) replaces Cesc Fabregas.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The match has just started.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jose Fonte (West Ham) was quite harsh and Mike Jones didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Robert Snodgrass (West Ham) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the middle of the goal. Eldin Jakupovic shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) meets a perfect cross from Aaron Cresswell deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike inside the left post. It's 0:1.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Mike Jones starts the second half.
Marco Silva decides to make a substitution. Curtis Davies will be replaced by Kamil Grosicki (Hull City).
Andrew Robertson (Hull City) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and nets into the bottom right corner.
Oumar Niasse (Hull City) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
Abel Hernandez (Hull City) gathers a cross inside the box and strikes the ball. He wastes a great scoring opportunity as his shot only hits the right-hand post.
Kamil Grosicki (Hull City) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
Andrew Carroll (West Ham) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The substitution has been made. Edimilson Fernandes (West Ham) has replaced Robert Snodgrass.
Aaron Cresswell just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Arthur Masuaku (West Ham) replaces him.
Alfred John Momar N'Diaye (Hull City) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
It is time for a substitution. Shaun Maloney (Hull City) is on for Alfred John Momar N'Diaye.
Marco Silva has decided to make a change. Markus Henriksen (Hull City) replaces Abel Hernandez.

Andrea Ranocchia (Hull City) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a great header into the right side of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 2:1.
It will be a substitution. Jonathan Calleri (West Ham) is ready to enter the pitch as Cheikhou Kouyate walks off.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.

Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) takes out his opponent with a horrific tackle and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card. Leicester are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.
Wilfred Ndidi (Leicester) collected a pass and decided to shoot from about 22 metres out. He hit it perfectly! The ball zoomed around the goalkeeper and ended up in the top right corner.
Glenn Whelan (Stoke City) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
Lee Mason has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) meets a perfect cross from Danny Simpson deep inside the box and controls it with a nice first touch. He produces an accurate strike inside the left post. It's 2:0.
Substitution. Jonathan Walters did his best and is replaced by Peter Crouch (Stoke City).
It's like he was asking for a caution. Christian Fuchs (Leicester) receives a yellow card.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Lee Grant, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.
Peter Crouch (Stoke City) does well to meet a cross from Marko Arnautovic, but he directs his shot just wide of the right post.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Peter Crouch (Stoke City).
Substitution. Saido Berahino makes way for Mame Diouf (Stoke City).
Mark Hughes has decided to substitute Glenn Whelan and he is replaced by Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Daniel Amartey (Leicester) replaces Shinji Okazaki.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the right post by a whisker.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jamie Vardy trots off the pitch and is replaced by Islam Slimani (Leicester).
Substitution. Demarai Gray will be replaced by Benjamin Chilwell (Leicester).
Great ball in from Mame Diouf. Peter Crouch (Stoke City) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar.
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Lee Mason had an easy-decision to make.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
The foul by Marcos Rojo (Manchester United) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Dean.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Michael Dean has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Allan Nyom (West Brom) for his blatant foul.
Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from James McClean as he is replaced by James Morrison (West Brom).
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Manchester United) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Ben Foster.
A substitution has been made. Nacer Chadli goes off and Claudio Yacob (West Brom) comes on.
Tony Pulis has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jose Rondon (West Brom) replacing Hal Robson-Kanu.
The substitution is prepared. Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Henrikh Mkhitaryan.
Jake Livermore (West Brom) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Dean ignores the protests.

Darren Fletcher (West Brom) unleashes a great shot from long distance, forcing a beautiful save out of the keeper. His attempt went towards the top of the net, but David de Gea leapt like a salmon and punched the ball onto the bar and away.

A truly beautiful footballing moment. Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) takes the free kick from a very promising position, but the goalkeeper thwarts the effort with an amazing save. The ball is out of play. Manchester Utd win a corner kick.
A yellow-coloured card is received by Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United).
Claudio Yacob (West Brom) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Michael Dean is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.

Adnan Januzaj (Sunderland) tries his luck with a long-range effort after receiving a precise pass. It goes to the left side of the goal, but Heurelho Gomes has a clear view of it and makes a comfortable save. Sunderland have a corner.
Younes Kaboul is being substituted because of an injury. Walter Mazzarri sends Daryl Janmaat (Watford) on the pitch.
Craig Cathcart (Watford) rises highest from the corner and heads at goal, but his effort towards the bottom right corner is saved by Jordan Pickford.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
Substitution. Nordin Amrabat leaves the pitch and is replaced by Isaac Success (Watford).
GOAL! Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) scores with a header from close range after Craig Cathcart headed a pin-point lofted cross into his path. It's 1:0.
Here is a change. Darron Gibson is going off and David William Moyes gives the last tactical orders to Didier Ndong (Sunderland).
Substitution. Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland) has come on for Adnan Januzaj.
Billy Jones (Sunderland) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland) is awarded a yellow card for a sharp discussion with the referee. He should relax or he could be sent off.
Lamine Kone (Sunderland) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Fabio Borini (Sunderland) has an effort from distance and sends the ball towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper is equal to it. The ball is out of play. Sunderland win a corner kick.
That will be all from M'Baye Niang who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Camilo Zuniga (Watford).
What was Etienne Capoue (Watford) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
Sadio Mane (Liverpool) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom right corner.
Emre Can (Liverpool) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot to the roof of the net, but is thwarted by a great save from Joel Robles.
Tom Davies (Everton) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Goal 1:1! Matthew Pennington (Everton) taps home from close range after the rebound fell kindly into his path.

Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) rounds off a sensational solo effort with a shot from about 13 metres out. The ball slams into the right side of the goal, leaving the goalkeeper beaten. The score sheet now reads 2:1.
Ross Barkley (Everton) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Jurgen Klopp is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Sadio Mane suffers an injury and Divock Origi (Liverpool) comes on.
Divock Origi (Liverpool) accepts a sweet pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box that goes inside the left post and past the helpless goalkeeper.
Ashley Williams (Everton) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
It's time for a substitution. Enner Valencia (Everton) comes on in place of Tom Davies.
Ronald Koeman has decided to make a change. Gareth Barry (Everton) replaces Matthew Pennington.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Emre Can (Liverpool) receives a yellow card!

Mason Holgate (Everton) blew a promising chance when he got to a rebound just outside the penalty area. He struck it towards the left side of the target, but Simon Mignolet pulled off a nice save to stop the attempt.
We are about to witness a substitution. Trent Alexander-Arnold (Liverpool) is replacing Philippe Coutinho.

Trent Alexander-Arnold (Liverpool) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the left post. Joel Robles pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Ronald Koeman has decided to substitute Dominic Calvert-Lewin and he is replaced by Kevin Mirallas (Everton).
Here comes a substitution. Ragnar Klavan (Liverpool) is brought on as a substitute for Roberto Firmino.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Oliver ignores the protests.
David Silva (Manchester City) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
Yaya Toure (Manchester City) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Sadio Mane (Liverpool) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Wilfredo Caballero.
Fernandinho (Manchester City) has a huge chance to score from close range, but his effort goes just a few inches wide of the right-hand post.
Adam Lallana (Liverpool) collects a rebound and his promising attempt goes towards the roof of the net, but Wilfredo Caballero keeps it out with an amazing save. Now Liverpool have a corner.
Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to Joel Matip (Liverpool), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Sadio Mane (Liverpool) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Sadio Mane (Liverpool) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. Liverpool earn a corner.
Michael Oliver blows for a foul after Gael Clichy (Manchester City) was too aggressive in the battle for the ball. The advantage of a penalty kick is given to Liverpool.
Gael Clichy (Manchester City) is the one who receives a yellow card.
David Silva (Manchester City) was probably a bit loose with his words to Michael Oliver, who decides to show him a yellow.
James Milner (Liverpool) converts the penalty with ease by slotting the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal after the goalkeeper guesses wrong and dives the opposite way!

Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Liverpool.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Bacary Sagna (Manchester City) replaces Yaya Toure.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
The substitution has been made. Divock Origi (Liverpool) has replaced Philippe Coutinho.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) sends a rebound from close range to the right post.
Adam Lallana (Liverpool) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Wilfredo Caballero.
What a big chance! Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and misses the net well wide of the right post.
Leroy Sane will be replaced by Fernando (Manchester City).

This would have been a magnificent goal from Sergio Aguero (Manchester City), who collected the ball inside the box and prodded a first-time shot on goal that flew just narrowly wide of the right post.
Sadio Mane (Liverpool) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Michael Oliver didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Substitution. Roberto Firmino makes his way off the pitch and Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) comes on as his replacement.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) finds some space inside the box and produces a first-time shot that goes high over the bar. High, wide and not at all pretty.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save. Now Tottenham have a corner.
Eric Dier (Tottenham) has tested the patience of referee Andre Marriner and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Mousa Dembele passes to Christian Eriksen (Tottenham), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 1:0.
Nathan Redmond (Southampton) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Andre Marriner had an easy-decision to make.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Shane Long (Southampton) is coming onto the pitch as Manolo Gabbiadini cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Andre Marriner blows his whistle after Steven Davis (Southampton) kicks an opponent's legs instead of the ball. PENALTY AWARDED to Tottenham!
Dele Alli (Tottenham) steps up and confidently powers the spot kick into the bottom left corner.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Kyle Walker (Tottenham) was quite harsh and Andre Marriner didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Andre Marriner has ended it.
The second half has just started.

James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) scores a goal after nicely controlling a pass and unleashing a powerful close-range shot into the bottom right corner. The keeper couldn't do anything to stop this wonderful effort.
Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Dusan Tadic will be replaced by Sofiane Boufal (Southampton).
Here is a change. Heung-Min Son is going off and Mauricio Pochettino gives the last tactical orders to Harry Winks (Tottenham).
Kyle Walker comes off the pitch to be replaced by Kieran Trippier (Tottenham).
We are about to witness a substitution. Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) is replacing Nathan Redmond.
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Sofiane Boufal (Southampton) for his blatant foul.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to substitute Christian Eriksen and he is replaced by Vincent Janssen (Tottenham).
Oriol Romeu (Southampton) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Victor Valdes pulls off a great save to deny Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!

Gaston Ramirez (Middlesbrough) weaves his way through the defence and gets within shooting range inside the box, but his effort to the right post is thwarted by David de Gea. Good work from Middlesbrough as they win a corner.
Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Victor Valdes.
Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) collects a rebound and his promising attempt heads towards the bottom right corner, but Victor Valdes keeps it out with an amazing save.
Jonathan Moss shows the yellow card to Phil Jones (Manchester United) for a heavy challenge.
Goal! Ashley Young produces a brilliant lofted pass and Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) gets on the end of it to finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 0:1.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Adam Clayton (Middlesbrough) gets booked.
The match has reached half-time.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Goal - 0:2! Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the top right corner. Juan Manuel Mata provided an assist for the goal.
It's time for a substitution. Rudy Gestede (Middlesbrough) comes on in place of Grant Leadbitter.
Here is a change. Gaston Ramirez is going off and Steve Agnew gives the last tactical orders to Adama Traore (Middlesbrough).
The game has come to an end for Juan Manuel Mata. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Marcos Rojo (Manchester United).
Goal! Rudy Gestede (Middlesbrough) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 1:2.
Jesse Lingard is being substituted because of an injury. Jose Mourinho sends Anthony Martial (Manchester United) on the pitch.
Goal! Some very poor defending from the opponent allows Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) the chance to get to the edge of the box and he makes no mistake with a lovely finish. It's 1:3.
It is time for a substitution. Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) is on for Marcus Rashford.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has started.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.
OWN GOAL! Alfie Mawson (Swansea) scores an unlucky own goal after he deflected a shot which went into his own net! 1:0.
Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom left corner is blocked by Lukasz Fabianski, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Bournemouth.

Sung-Yong Ki will be replaced by Wayne Routledge (Swansea).
Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) gets on the end of a pass inside the box and fires into the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.

The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Jack Cork (Swansea) is given a yellow card.
Lukasz Fabianski makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the bottom right corner by Joshua King (Bournemouth) after a cross from the side.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Fernando Llorente will be replaced by Borja Baston (Swansea).
Eddie Howe has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Max Gradel (Bournemouth) replacing Joshua King.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marc Pugh departs the field of play to be replaced by Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth).
Michael Dean is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.

The game has come to an end for Daryl Janmaat. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Nordin Amrabat (Watford).

OWN GOAL! The free kick is whipped in and Troy Deeney (Watford) is unlucky enough to head the ball into his own net. 1:0.
Here comes a substitution. Isaac Success (Watford) is brought on as a substitute for Tom Cleverley.
Here is a change. James Tomkins is going off and Samuel Allardyce gives the last tactical orders to Scott Dann (Crystal Palace).
The referee signals a substitution. Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) is brought on as a substitute for Yohan Cabaye.
Samuel Allardyce has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Damien Delaney (Crystal Palace) replacing Andros Townsend.
That's the end of the match.

Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) finds some space deep inside the box to fire a volley into the back of the net, leaving the keeper helpless. A stunning goal!
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Romelu Lukaku (Everton) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Morgan Schneiderlin is being substituted because of an injury. Ronald Koeman sends Gareth Barry (Everton) on the pitch.
Sam Clucas (Hull City) wastes a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box after firing the ball a few inches over the crossbar.

Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Substitution. Dominic Calvert-Lewin is replaced by Ramiro Mori (Everton).
Paul Tierney shows a yellow card to Ashley Williams (Everton), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Substitution. Curtis Davies leaves the pitch and is replaced by Kamil Grosicki (Hull City).
Andrew Robertson (Hull City) rips an amazing volley from deep inside the box that goes narrowly wide of the left post.

It's a foul from Tom Huddlestone (Hull City). Surprisingly, the referee comes and pulls out a red card. It was a very harsh one and Tom Huddlestone (Hull City) complains, but it's no use of course. The decision has been made.
Tom Davies will be replaced by Enner Valencia (Everton).
Fantastic team goal! Enner Valencia (Everton) was set free in the area by Romelu Lukaku and he made no mistake with a lovely finish into the bottom left corner. 2:0.
The foul by Gareth Barry (Everton) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Paul Tierney.
Marco da Silva has decided to substitute Abel Hernandez and he is replaced by Adama Diomande (Hull City).
Lazar Markovic (Hull City) comes off the pitch to be replaced by .
Goal - 3:0! Romelu Lukaku (Everton) receives a precise pass inside the box from Enner Valencia and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the bottom right corner.
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.
The match has just finished.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Willian (Chelsea) takes the free kick with a powerful low drive that goes inside the left-hand post and ends up behind the goalkeeper. A real jaw dropper!
Joe Allen (Stoke City) has tested the patience of referee Anthony Taylor and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) picked up a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee. He has to be careful for the remainder of the match.

Lee Grant earns applause from the crowd! He dives superbly to deny a dangerous first-time effort from the edge of the six-yard box. Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) was the player who tested the keeper's reflexes. Nice goalkeeping skills.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Bruno Martins Indi (Stoke City) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Gary Cahill (Chelsea) makes a rough challenge and Anthony Taylor blows his whistle for a foul. That's a penalty to Stoke! They have a good chance to score now.

Lee Grant was forced into action to thwart Pedro (Chelsea). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper. Chelsea have been awarded a corner kick.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Nemanja Matic as he is replaced by Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea).

Lee Grant makes a brilliant save! Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea) easily weaves through the defence and fires the ball from mid-range. His effort goes towards the bottom right corner but is saved by the keeper!

Phillip Bardsley (Stoke City) should have been more careful. He commits a bad foul, receives his second yellow card and is sent-off!

Close! Scott Arfield (Burnley) takes the resultant free kick from 20 metres out and his shot goes just wide of the right post.

Adnan Januzaj sprays a wonderful pass out to Darron Gibson (Sunderland), who cannot get enough power or direction to cause Tom Heaton problems and the goalkeeper is able to watch the ball go just over the crossbar.

Adnan Januzaj (Sunderland) gets on the end of a cross into the box and unleashes a shot towards the top of the net, but the goalkeeper produces an amazing save to push his effort onto the crossbar.

Darron Gibson (Sunderland) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Robert Madley had an easy-decision to make.

Billy Jones (Sunderland) picks up a yellow card for a foul.

Fabio Borini (Sunderland) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. Tom Heaton guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. Sunderland earn a corner.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) latches on to a brilliant pass and hits a poor shot towards the middle of the goal, but the ball goes into the back of the net after the goalkeeper makes a howler!
Marc Albrighton produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Robert Huth (Leicester) rises high to head the ball into the middle of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 0:2.
A substitution has been made. Winston Reid goes off and Robert Snodgrass (West Ham) comes on.
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) struck with a perfectly taken free kick from the edge of the box. He curled the ball straight into the top left corner. A technically perfect strike!
Goal! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top left corner. It's 1:3.

Daniel Drinkwater (Leicester) takes out his opponent with a horrific tackle and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) unleashes a mid-range direct free kick, but sees his strike well saved by the goalkeeper.

Pedro Obiang doesn't have to suffer any longer with the painful injury as Edimilson Fernandes (West Ham) comes onto the pitch to replace him.

Andrew Carroll (West Ham) connects with the ball in the six-yard box after the resulting free kick and shoots towards goal, but Kasper Schmeichel makes a magnificent save!
