Nacer Chadli takes over corner duties and expertly finds Craig Dawson (West Brom), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the back of the net. The score is now 1:0.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) connects with a cross inside the box and takes a brilliant touch to fire the ball in off the crossbar, leaving the keeper helpless.
Ben Foster pulls off a great save to deny Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom right corner.

Petr Cech pulls off a great save to deny James McClean (West Brom) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! The ball is out of play. West Brom will have a chance to score from a corner.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Petr Cech limps off the pitch to be replaced by David Ospina (Arsenal).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by James McClean (West Brom) was quite harsh and Neil Swarbrick didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Goal! Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) fires the rebound inside the left post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.

Joey Barton (Burnley) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.

Brilliant finish! Michail Antonio (West Ham) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Sofiane Feghouli, then produced a nice strike into the bottom right corner. The score is 0:1.

Steve Cook (Bournemouth) connects with an inch-perfect cross and from around the penalty spot he steers a header towards the top of the net, but Darren Randolph pulls off a brilliant save and diverts the ball onto the crossbar. Bournemouth earn a corner.

The foul by Lazar Markovic (Hull City) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Andre Marriner.
Substitution.  replaces Lazar Markovic (Hull City).
It's a goal! Oumar Niasse (Hull City) scores with a brilliant low shot into the middle of the goal after being released inside the box by a superb lofted pass from . The score is now 2:0.
Marco Silva prepares a substitution. Abel Hernandez is replaced by David Meyler (Hull City).

It's in the back of the net! Gylfi Sigurdsson flights the free kick into the box, where Alfie Mawson (Swansea) peels off his marker and heads it straight into the bottom right corner from the edge of the six-yard box. He makes it 2:1.
That's the end of the match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) meets a cross inside the penalty area and unloads a good attempt towards the bottom left corner. Wilfredo Caballero is prepared, though, and denies him with a fantastic save.
Phillip Bardsley (Stoke City) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Leroy Sane (Manchester City) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Here comes a substitution. David Silva (Manchester City) is brought on as a substitute for Jesus Navas.
Mark Hughes is forced to make a change. Mame Diouf is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City).
David Silva (Manchester City) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the right post.
Substitution. Yaya Toure leaves the pitch and is replaced by Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City).

Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) meets a cross inside the box, but he is unable to produce an accurate header and it goes just over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stoke.
Mark Hughes has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Glenn Whelan (Stoke City) replacing Saido Berahino.
This is a yellow card! Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) is not happy with the decision, but from our point of view it was clear.
Substitution. Joe Allen will be replaced by Gianelli Imbula (Stoke City).
Ramadan Sobhi (Stoke City) receives a yellow card.

Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went a few inches wide of the right post.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
It's a goal! Pedro plays a lovely pass into the box and finds Eden Hazard (Chelsea). He tries his luck from close range and coolly strikes the ball into the back of the net. 0:1.
Victor Moses (Chelsea) gets to the rebound and shoots, but the effort is blocked.
Pedro (Chelsea) tries to put the rebound into the net from the edge of the box, but the goalkeeper pulls off a good save to deny him.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) is given a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The whistle blows and Andre Marriner starts the second half.
The ball finds its way to Diego Costa (Chelsea) after a confusing situation inside the goalmouth. He finds some space and easily knocks the ball in with his body and alters the score to 0:2.
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the right post.
Sofiane Feghouli (West Ham) reacts well to latch onto a rebound inside the box, but his shot is well blocked.
Today's match ends for Sofiane Feghouli who will be replaced by Andre Ayew (West Ham).
Slaven Bilic has decided to substitute Winston Reid and he is replaced by Samuel Byram (West Ham).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nemanja Matic (Chelsea) comes onto the pitch for Pedro.

That didn't go as planned! Diego Costa (Chelsea) tried his luck from the edge of the box, but his effort towards the bottom left corner was too weak to get past Darren Randolph, who easily kept it out. Chelsea have been awarded a corner kick.
Here comes a substitution. Willian (Chelsea) is brought on as a substitute for Eden Hazard.
Antonio Conte has decided to make a change. Kurt Zouma (Chelsea) replaces Victor Moses.
It will be a substitution. Edimilson Fernandes (West Ham) is ready to enter the pitch as Mark Noble walks off.
Goal - 1:2! Andre Ayew tees up Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) inside the box and he rolls the ball into the bottom left corner and past Thibaut Courtois.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.

Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) got in a good shooting position on the edge of the box and pulled the trigger. The ball flew towards the left side of the goal, but Wilfredo Caballero punched it onto the post.
John O'Shea (Sunderland) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
Goal! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot inside the right post. He makes it 0:1.
Gooal! No wait, it's been ruled out for offside. David Silva (Manchester City) disagrees, but the linesman is sure about his call.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.

Leroy Sane (Manchester City) controls the ball on the edge of the box after a superb low pass by David Silva. He makes a yard for himself and fires a wonderful strike into the bottom right corner via the woodwork. 0:2!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Darron Gibson departs the field of play to be replaced by Jack Rodwell (Sunderland).
Substitution. Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) has come on for Yaya Toure.
Pep Guardiola has decided to make a change. Nolito (Manchester City) replaces Raheem Sterling.
Substitution. Adnan Januzaj will be replaced by Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland).
Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) has a goal ruled out for offside!

Nolito (Manchester City) shoots from the edge of the penalty area. The ball travels towards the right side of the target, but Jordan Pickford easily deals with the threat. The referee signals a corner kick to Manchester City.
The manager makes a subsitution with Fabian Delph (Manchester City) coming on for Leroy Sane.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

What a spectacular moment! Harry Kane (Tottenham) skips past defenders and finds some space before blasting a long-range strike at goal. The fans are amazed when they see the ball go into the bottom left corner. The scoreline is 1:0.

This was a piece of cake for Joel Robles. Harry Kane (Tottenham) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went towards the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
Dele Alli links up with Christian Eriksen (Tottenham), who fires just wide of the left post from the edge of the box. The ball goes out of play and Everton will have a goal kick.
Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) collects an accurate pass and tries his luck from about 20 metres. He was very close to scoring, but the ball ends up hitting the left post.
Idrissa Gueye (Everton) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Oliver had an easy-decision to make.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Dele Alli (Tottenham) meets a splendid cross on the edge of the 6-yard box and sends the ball towards the left post, forcing Joel Robles into a superb diving save to keep it out.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) received a pass and blasted a beautiful rocket of a shot from just outside the penalty area into the bottom right corner. He was given an ovation. Excellent finish.
Substitution. Kevin Mirallas (Everton) has come on for Tom Davies.
Ronald Koeman has decided to substitute Gareth Barry and he is replaced by James McCarthy (Everton).
Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to Mousa Dembele (Tottenham) for his blatant foul.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Harry Winks (Tottenham) is coming onto the pitch as Mousa Dembele cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) breaks through before collecting a brilliant pass and producing a precise strike to beat the goalkeeper. The ball went into the bottom left corner.
Ronald Koeman prepares a substitution. Idrissa Gueye is replaced by Enner Valencia (Everton).
Harry Kane (Tottenham) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Joel Robles makes a great save to stop his effort.
The referee signals a substitution. Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) is brought on as a substitute for Christian Eriksen.
Here is a change. Harry Kane is going off and Mauricio Pochettino gives the last tactical orders to Vincent Janssen (Tottenham).
Dele Alli (Tottenham) receives the ball inside the penalty area from the free kick and scores! His effort goes past the goalkeeper into the bottom right corner.
Goal! The ball from the resulting free kick arrives at the feet of Enner Valencia (Everton) inside the box, and he fires a lovely shot into the bottom left corner.
Ashley Williams (Everton) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Goal - 1:0! Sadio Mane laid the ball off to Roberto Firmino (Liverpool), who slots it into the back of the net from close range, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Goal! Roberto Firmino displays great vision and sends a pass to Sadio Mane (Liverpool), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 2:0.

Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Petr Cech guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Arsene Wenger probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Francis Coquelin. He is replaced by Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal).

Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball towards the roof of the net. Simon Mignolet shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Goal! Alexis Sanchez gets to the ball, slips Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) into the area and he scores with a delightful chipped finish to make it 2:1.
Emre Can (Liverpool) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.
We are about to witness a substitution. Lucas Perez (Arsenal) is replacing Olivier Giroud.
Arsene Wenger decides to make a substitution. Danny Welbeck will be replaced by Theo Walcott (Arsenal).

Joel Matip (Liverpool) leaps highest in the penalty area to get on the end of a cross from the set piece, and he produces a promising goal-bound header towards the left side of the goal, but Petr Cech pulls off a decent save to deny him.
Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) picked up a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee. He has to be careful for the remainder of the match.
The substitution is prepared. Divock Origi (Liverpool) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Philippe Coutinho.
Divock Origi (Liverpool) is really unlucky not to score after heading the ball onto the right post!

It's in! Divock Origi spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) doesn't think twice and rifles a first-time shot into the bottom right corner. The score is now 3:1.
Adam Lallana comes off the pitch to be replaced by Lucas Leiva (Liverpool).
Jurgen Klopp has decided to substitute Sadio Mane and he is replaced by Trent Alexander-Arnold (Liverpool).
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Sam Clucas (Hull City) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low into the middle of the net. It's 0:1.
Goal! Jamie Vardy displays great vision and sends a pass to Christian Fuchs (Leicester), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 1:1.
Michael Dean has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The corner kick falls to Harry Maguire (Hull City), who does his best to finish. The snap shot, however, only marks the left post!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Daniel Drinkwater (Leicester) was quite harsh and Michael Dean didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Goal! Robert Huth tees up Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom right corner. 2:1.
Kamil Grosicki (Hull City) produces a shot from a mid-range free kick. His effort is directed under the crossbar but is caught by the goalkeeper.
Substitution. Abel Hernandez (Hull City) replaces Alfred John Momar N'Diaye.
Craig Shakespeare has decided to substitute Shinji Okazaki and he is replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).
It is time for a substitution. Adama Diomande (Hull City) is on for Lazar Markovic.
Craig Shakespeare has decided to make a change. Islam Slimani (Leicester) replaces Riyad Mahrez.

Oumar Niasse (Hull City) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike to the bottom left corner. Kasper Schmeichel pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill. The ball is out of play. Hull win a corner kick.
Tom Huddlestone (Hull City) has tested the patience of referee Michael Dean and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Demarai Gray (Leicester) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom left corner is blocked by Eldin Jakupovic, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Leicester.
Tom Huddlestone (Hull City) attempts to head the ball away from inside the six-yard box, but unluckily he turns a cross from the resulting corner inside the right post of his own net.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The match has just started.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Daniel Ayala leaves the pitch to be replaced by Bernardo Espinosa (Middlesbrough).

OFF THE BAR! Ramadan Sobhi (Stoke City) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the crossbar! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Victor Valdes displays his ability to read the game and clears the danger after Peter Crouch (Stoke City) threatened to latch onto a through ball from just outside the box.
Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Craig Pawson had an easy-decision to make.
What an outstanding solo effort by Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) as he weaves through the defence inside the box and rolls the ball into the back of net.
Goal! The resulting corner is whipped into the box and Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) buries the ball into the back of the net from a Peter Crouch knock down. 2:0.
The yellow card goes to George Friend (Middlesbrough).
The match has reached half-time.
The second half gets underway.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Aitor Karanka de la Hoz probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Gaston Ramirez. He is replaced by Christian Stuani (Middlesbrough).
A goal, which was scored by Benjamin Gibson (Middlesbrough), was disallowed due to offside.

Christian Stuani (Middlesbrough) collects a wonderful lead pass and creates some space to smash the ball goalwards from long range. His shot goes painfully close to the right post! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Stoke.
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) comes onto the pitch because Marko Arnautovic simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Grant Leadbitter will be replaced by Adlene Guedioura (Middlesbrough).
A yellow card for bad language! Marten de Roon (Middlesbrough) couldnt remain silent and the result is obvious.
Peter Crouch is not able to continue due to his injury and will be replaced by Saido Berahino (Stoke City).
CHANCE! Ramadan Sobhi (Stoke City) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a low shot to the bottom right corner, but Victor Valdes produces an excellent save.
Bruno Martins Indi is substituted due to injury. Mark Hughes gives a chance to Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City).
Joe Allen (Stoke City) picks up a pass inside the box and finds some space for a shot before unleashing a low drive goalwards, but one of the defending players blocks his effort.
What an amazing save by Victor Valdes! Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the bottom right corner, but fails.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Stephen Ward (Burnley) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Anthony Taylor had an easy-decision to make.
What an opportunity! Alfie Mawson (Swansea) disappointed the fans as he smashed a first-time shot from inside the box against the left post!

A perfect lofted pass from Leroy Fer finds Fernando Llorente (Swansea), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header straight into the bottom right corner. His effort was both strong and precise, and Paul Robinson had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
Handball! A player from Swansea handled the ball. The referee uncompromisingly points to the spot and it's a penalty to Burnley.
Andre Gray (Burnley) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Lukasz Fabianski to move before rolling the ball into the middle of the goal!
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Ben Mee (Burnley) has tested the patience of referee Anthony Taylor and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Leroy Fer (Swansea) commits a nasty foul by bringing down his opponent.
Andre Gray (Burnley) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Scott Arfield (Burnley) comes onto the pitch so that Robbie Brady can be given a rest.
Goal! Gylfi Sigurdsson displays great vision and sends a pass to Martin Olsson (Swansea), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the top left corner. The score is 2:2.
Paul Clement has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jordan Ayew (Swansea) replacing Luciano Narsingh.
Substitution. Sam Vokes makes way for James Tarkowski (Burnley).
Sean Dyche has decided to substitute Joey Barton and he is replaced by Ashley Westwood (Burnley).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jack Cork (Swansea) was quite harsh and Anthony Taylor didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
That's the end of the game for Kyle Naughton, who is replaced by Angel Rangel (Swansea).

It's a goal! Fernando Llorente (Swansea) makes it 3:2. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Thomas Carroll and planted his close-range header into the top of the net. Paul Robinson was helpless.
The manager makes a subsitution with Jordi Amat (Swansea) coming on for Thomas Carroll.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
A superb goal from great team play! Troy Deeney (Watford) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent shot inside the left post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.

James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the right post. Heurelho Gomes has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. The ball goes out for a corner. Southampton can continue in their attacking effort.
What was Cedric Soares (Southampton) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Goal! Dusan Tadic (Southampton) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a low shot into the bottom right corner. Heurelho Gomes is unable to keep the ball out of the net. It's 1:1.
Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

Dusan Tadic (Southampton) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom left corner. Heurelho Gomes guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Stefano Okaka (Watford) goes into the referee's book for dissent.
Goal - 1:2! Nathan Redmond (Southampton) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom left corner. Dusan Tadic provided an assist for the goal.
Jonathan Moss has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Heurelho Gomes stretches to his right and makes a brilliant save! Dusan Tadic (Southampton) met a rebound outside the box and attempted to beat the keeper into the top left corner. The ball is out of play. Southampton win a corner kick.
Isaac Success (Watford) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Etienne Capoue.
Sebastian Prodl (Watford) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Stefano Okaka (Watford) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Fraser Forster is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Claude Puel decides to make a substitution. James Ward-Prowse will be replaced by Sofiane Boufal (Southampton).

GOAL! Superb work from Isaac Success, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Stefano Okaka (Watford), who beats Fraser Forster with a brilliant shot into the left side of the net. 2:2.
Troy Deeney (Watford) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Great touch by Dusan Tadic (Southampton) as he receives a precise pass deep inside the box and rips a shot goalwards, but the keeper pulls off an amazing save!
Goal! Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 2:3.
Claude Puel prepares a substitution. Manolo Gabbiadini is replaced by Shane Long (Southampton).
What a hit that is! Nathan Redmond (Southampton) scores a great goal from approximately 14 metres out. His effort goes straight into the roof of the net. It's 2:4.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Dusan Tadic walks off the pitch to be replaced by Jordy Clasie (Southampton).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Stefano Okaka trots off the pitch and is replaced by Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford).
It's in the back of the net! Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera plays it into the box, and Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the back of the net. 3:4.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Mike Jones ignores the protests.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Goal! Yohan Cabaye sends a precise cross into the box, Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) latches on to it and puts the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 0:1.
Jason Puncheon is being substituted because of an injury. Samuel Allardyce sends Jeffrey Schlupp (Crystal Palace) on the pitch.
Tony Pulis has decided to introduce fresh legs, with James McClean (West Brom) replacing Nacer Chadli.
Here comes a substitution. Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) is brought on as a substitute for Allan Nyom.
Samuel Allardyce decides to make a substitution. Yohan Cabaye will be replaced by Scott Dann (Crystal Palace).

Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Ben Foster is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Tony Pulis has decided to substitute Darren Fletcher and he is replaced by Jonathan Leko (West Brom).

An amazing individual effort from Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom left corner and makes it 0:2. Ben Foster was helpless.
It will be a substitution. James McArthur (Crystal Palace) is ready to enter the pitch as Wilfried Zaha walks off.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has just begun.

What an amazing save by Artur Boruc! Paul Pogba (Manchester United) swirls around the defenders and attempts to beat the keeper with a close-range shot towards the bottom right corner, but fails. The ball is out of play. Manchester Utd win a corner kick.
Harry Arter (Bournemouth) has tested the patience of referee Kevin Friend and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Artur Boruc pulls off a great save to deny Anthony Martial (Manchester United), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the left side of the goal. Manchester Utd force a corner. They send men into the box.
Antonio Valencia feeds the ball through to Marcos Rojo (Manchester United), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:0!
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Andrew Surman (Bournemouth) was quite harsh and Kevin Friend didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) goes into the referee's book for dissent.
Phil Jones (Manchester United) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Kevin Friend signals. Bournemouth are awarded a penalty kick!
Joshua King (Bournemouth) slides the penalty home, curling the ball into the top left corner! A well-placed shot!

Artur Boruc was forced into action to thwart Wayne Rooney (Manchester United). He found himself some space after picking up a pass and unleashed a shot to the left post but couldn't beat the keeper. Manchester Utd force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
RED CARD! Andrew Surman (Bournemouth) makes a bad challenge and receives a second yellow card from Kevin Friend. He can have an early bath.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Referee Kevin Friend blows his whistle to start the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Eddie Howe probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Marc Pugh. He is replaced by Dan Gosling (Bournemouth).

That was a nice football moment. Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the left post. Artur Boruc guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! Manchester Utd will take a corner kick.

Paul Pogba (Manchester United) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the top right corner. Artur Boruc has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. Manchester Utd win a corner.
Michael Carrick (Manchester United) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Kevin Friend had an easy-decision to make.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Wayne Rooney trots off the pitch and is replaced by Jesse Lingard (Manchester United).
Jose Mourinho decides to make a substitution. Michael Carrick will be replaced by Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United).
It is time for a substitution. Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) is on for Luke Shaw.
The ball spins up and hits the hand of Adam Smith (Bournemouth) after he fails to control it and the referee blows his whistle for a foul. Manchester Utd are awarded a penalty kick!
A yellow card for bad language! Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) couldnt remain silent and the result is obvious.
Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) has a great chance to score from the penalty. He shoots to the bottom left corner, but Artur Boruc leaps out to thwart his attempt.
Eddie Howe is forced to make a change. Tyrone Mings is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Bailey Cargill (Bournemouth).
Kevin Friend shows a yellow card to Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) for his blatant foul.
We are about to witness a substitution. Max Gradel (Bournemouth) is replacing Joshua King.

Paul Pogba (Manchester United) picks up the rebound inside the penalty area and releases a good shot towards the bottom right corner. Unfortunately for him, Artur Boruc shows how quick his reflexes are and dives superbly to stop the effort. What a save but what a wasted opportunity!
That's all for today as the game is over.
The first half has started.

Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) attempts to convert a cross into a goal, but his promising header from near the penalty spot towards the right post is denied by a decent save from Simon Mignolet. The ball goes out of play and Leicester have been awarded a corner kick.
Goal! Marc Albrighton slips it to Jamie Vardy (Leicester) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom right corner with a great effort. The score is 1:0.
What an absolute cracking goal! Daniel Drinkwater (Leicester) hits a perfect volley from long range and the ball flies into the bottom right corner. Take a bow son.

Emre Can (Liverpool) gets into a good scoring position. He creates some space for himself and tries his luck from distance. His decent effort towards the bottom right corner is, however, superbly saved by Kasper Schmeichel! The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Liverpool will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.

The ball hits the back of the net! Christian Fuchs showcases his brilliant technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Jamie Vardy (Leicester) gets onto the scoresheet by sweetly heading it low inside the right post  3:0.
It will be a substitution. Alberto Moreno (Liverpool) is ready to enter the pitch as Sadio Mane walks off.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to make a change. Divock Origi (Liverpool) replaces Adam Lallana.
Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) scores! He latches on to a pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box that goes inside the left post and past the goalkeeper.
The manager makes a subsitution with Daniel Amartey (Leicester) coming on for Shinji Okazaki.
Riyad Mahrez comes off the pitch to be replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).
Jurgen Klopp has decided to substitute Lucas Leiva and he is replaced by Benjamin Woodburn (Liverpool).
A substitution has been made. Marc Albrighton is replaced by Benjamin Chilwell (Leicester).
That's it for today, Michael Oliver has blown his whistle and the game is over.

Joe Allen (Stoke City) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms around the left post.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Harry Kane (Tottenham) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom left corner. Good team effort!
The foul by Glenn Whelan (Stoke City) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jonathan Moss.
CHANCE! Kyle Walker (Tottenham) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he blazes his shot well over the top.
Erik Pieters (Stoke City) tries his luck with a low long-range effort after receiving a precise pass, but Hugo Lloris has a clear view of it and makes a comfortable save.
Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) sees a yellow card from Jonathan Moss after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Harry Kane (Tottenham) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) gets on the end of the corner kick deep inside the box and beats the keeper with a precise strike into the bottom left corner.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) fires a daisy-cutter inside the right post from the free kick just outside the box. Football supporters are always happy to see such a fabulous goal.
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Jonathan Moss ignores the protests.
Goal! Harry Kane provides Dele Alli (Tottenham) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort under the bar. 4:0.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Toby Alderweireld is being substituted because of an injury. Mauricio Pochettino sends Kevin Wimmer (Tottenham) on the pitch.
Dele Alli (Tottenham) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and shoots towards goal, but it goes well wide of the right post.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) receives a lofted pass in the goal area and unleashes a dangerous header which sails narrowly wide of the right post!
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Peter Crouch as he is replaced by Saido Berahino (Stoke City).
Mark Hughes decides to make a substitution. Charles Graham Adam will be replaced by Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City).
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to make a change. Harry Winks (Tottenham) replaces Jan Vertonghen.
Jonathan Moss shows a yellow card to Kevin Wimmer (Tottenham) for a tough tackle.

Harry Winks (Tottenham) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Harry Winks (Tottenham) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. It will be a corner kick for Tottenham.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) receives a pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Lee Grant makes a great save to stop his effort.
Here comes a substitution. Glenn Whelan is given a rest as he is replaced by Geoff Cameron (Stoke City).
Dele Alli (Tottenham) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the left post. Lee Grant is alert and denies him with a nice save.

Kyle Walker (Tottenham) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Lee Grant makes a great save to stop the effort going low into the middle of the goal.

A yellow card for a tackle by Victor Wanyama (Tottenham). Jonathan Moss doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Jonathan Moss is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Craig Pawson no option but to blow his whistle. It's a penalty! Watford have an opportunity to score from the penalty spot.
Troy Deeney (Watford) scores from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner to give the goalkeeper no chance!

M'Baye Niang (Watford) tries to threaten the goalkeeper as he takes the ball and fires from long range. The shot flies just over the crossbar! The ball goes out of play and West Ham will have a goal kick.

Robert Snodgrass (West Ham) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Heurelho Gomes guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. West Ham have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Daryl Janmaat (Watford) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Michail Antonio (West Ham) goes on a weaving run through the defence and gets within shooting range but his effort is blocked. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. West Ham will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) will replace Mauro Zarate.
Michail Antonio (West Ham) makes a really bad tackle on his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.

The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Jose Fonte (West Ham) finds some space in the penalty area and produces a bullet of a header towards the top right corner, but his attempt is denied by the goalkeeper. Now West Ham have a corner.
Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Robert Snodgrass leaves the pitch and Andre Ayew (West Ham) comes on.
Tom Cleverley (Watford) is cautioned and receives a yellow card.

What a chance that is! Aaron Cresswell swings the ball into the box, and Michail Antonio (West Ham) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Watford.
Michail Antonio (West Ham) creates a good chance for himself and fires in a powerful close-range shot, but his effort ricochets off the left post.
Goal! Andre Ayew (West Ham) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the middle of the net. It's 1:1.
Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Today's match ends for M'Baye Niang who will be replaced by Isaac Success (Watford).
Yellow card. Jose Holebas (Watford) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.
Michail Antonio (West Ham) sees a second yellow card from the referee and already knows what will come next. It's a red and the match is over for Michail Antonio (West Ham).

Craig Pawson is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.

Goal - 1:0! Pedro laid the ball off to Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) was waiting for the ball on the penalty spot and produced a powerful volley towards the left side of the target, but the goalkeeper made an amazing save to deny him.
Neil Swarbrick shows a yellow card to Kyle Naughton (Swansea) for a tough tackle.
Neil Swarbrick shows the yellow card to Martin Olsson (Swansea) for a heavy challenge.

Goal! Fernando Llorente (Swansea) peels away from his marker to meet the resulting free kick from Gylfi Sigurdsson, and he steers a powerful header from near the penalty spot inside the left post. What a finish that is - 1:1!

Lukasz Fabianski pulls off a great save to deny Eden Hazard (Chelsea), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) wastes a promising chance as he unleashes a first-time shot from mid-range which hits the crossbar!
Pedro (Chelsea) latches on to a pass and controls it with a good first touch. He unleashes a deadly strike from around 20 metres out which goes into the bottom left corner.
David Luiz (Chelsea) is awarded a yellow card.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pedro leaves the pitch and Nemanja Matic (Chelsea) comes on.
Paul Clement has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jordan Ayew (Swansea) replacing Thomas Carroll.
Leroy Fer (Swansea) is booked.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Luciano Narsingh (Swansea) replaces Wayne Routledge.

Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Victor Valdes, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Patrick van Aanholt (Crystal Palace) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a great shot into the bottom right corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Victor Valdes, so the score changes to 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Wayne Hennessey pulls off a superb save! He leapt to block the shot Christian Stuani (Middlesbrough) fired on target after a rebound. His effort from inside the box flew straight towards the middle of the goal, but was stopped by the goalkeeper.

It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Christian Stuani as he is replaced by Adama Traore (Middlesbrough).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Joel Ward (Crystal Palace) was quite harsh and Robert Madley didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Jeffery Schlupp (Crystal Palace) on for Patrick van Aanholt.
Here is a change. Wilfried Zaha is going off and Samuel Allardyce gives the last tactical orders to Scott Dann (Crystal Palace).

Nice individual effort by Idrissa Gueye (Everton). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the bottom left corner, but Jordan Pickford does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out. The referee and his assistant both point at the corner flag. Everton will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.
Darron Gibson (Sunderland) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

It's in the back of the net! Idrissa Gueye (Everton) fires a brilliant volley into the roof of the net from the edge of the box, leaving the goalkeeper helpless. Seamus Coleman provided the assist. What a finish! 1:0.

Ross Barkley (Everton) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the bottom right corner. Jordan Pickford pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The linesman makes the right call and Everton will have a corner.
Tom Davies (Everton) hits the right post with a rebound from just outside the box.
The match has reached half-time.
Stuart Attwell blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Kevin Mirallas (Everton) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.

Ross Barkley (Everton) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike wasn't accurate at all and the ball went well over the bar.

Romelu Lukaku (Everton) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Jordan Pickford makes a decent save to deny his effort directed to the left side of the target.

OFF THE POST! Good play from Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) as skips past two defending players and from the edge of the box unleashes a decent strike that smashes against the crossbar!

Allan Nyom (West Brom) holds his opponent to prevent him from getting the ball and the referee blows for a foul after seeing the whole situation. That's a penalty to Bournemouth! They have a good chance to score now.
Joshua King (Bournemouth) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the right side of the goal.
Chris Brunt (West Brom) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Bournemouth will have a goal kick.

Adam Smith (Bournemouth) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the top right corner. Ben Foster has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. Bournemouth will take a corner kick.
Goal! Nacer Chadli passes the ball to Craig Dawson (West Brom) and he fires in a shot from the edge of the box which is deflected. Artur Boruc couldn't do anything about it. 1:1.
Goal! Gareth McAuley (West Brom) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the middle of the net. It's 2:1.
Jose Rondon (West Brom) goes on a solo run, but he fails to create a chance as an opposition player blocks him.
Jonny Evans (West Brom) jumps inside the box to meet the resulting set piece and aims a header towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper shows his reflexes and makes a superb save.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Mark Clattenburg blows his whistle to start the second half.
Allan Nyom (West Brom) has tested the patience of referee Mark Clattenburg and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
A cross from the corner kick arrives close to the penalty spot. Gareth McAuley (West Brom) outjumps the defence, but his promising header bounces away off the bar!

This was a piece of cake for Artur Boruc. James McClean (West Brom) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went low to the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.

Lys Mousset (Bournemouth) unleashes a decent shot towards the roof of the net, but Ben Foster thwarts him with a nice save. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Bournemouth.
Ryan Fraser sends a lovely ball from the corner into the path of Andrew Surman (Bournemouth), whose close-range header flashes just wide of the left post.

Tyrone Mings (Bournemouth) creates himself some space around the penalty spot and connects with the free kick. His accurate header would have probably ended up in the top left corner, but Ben Foster pulls off a superb reflex save to thwart him.
That's it for today, Mark Clattenburg has blown his whistle and the game is over.

What was Yaya Toure (Manchester City) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Problems for Eddie Howe as Jack Wilshere is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) replaces him.

Goal! Alfie Mawson (Swansea) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Federico Fernandez, then sends the ball inside the right post. 1:0.
Jack Cork (Swansea) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Goal Martin Olsson (Swansea)! Martin Olsson (Swansea) was put through by Gylfi Sigurdsson and he showed brilliant composure to tuck it home from inside the box. 2:0.

Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the top left corner is blocked by Kasper Schmeichel, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Benjamin Chilwell (Leicester) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
What a sweet touch by Islam Slimani (Leicester) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Lukasz Fabianski to hold.

What a sweet touch by Eden Hazard (Chelsea) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Tom Heaton to hold.
Goal! After receiving a sweet pass, Pedro (Chelsea) unleashes a shot straight into the bottom left corner. Good team effort!
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and releases a promising effort. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies painfully close to the right post.

Thibaut Courtois pulls off a great save to deny Matthew Lowton (Burnley), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner.

That was a nice football moment. Andre Gray (Burnley) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the bottom left corner. Thibaut Courtois guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save!

It's in the back of the net! Georginio Wijnaldum slips the ball through to Sadio Mane (Liverpool), and he darts into the box to unleash a strong shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 1:0.
Superb touch by Adam Lallana (Liverpool) as he receives a precise pass into the box, but the goalkeeper stops the ball as it heads towards the top of the net. Brilliant save!

Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) picks up the rebound inside the penalty area and releases a good shot to the middle of the goal. Unfortunately for him, Hugo Lloris shows how quick his reflexes are and dives superbly to stop his effort. What a save but what a wasted opportunity!
Goal! Sadio Mane (Liverpool) fires the rebound into the middle of the goal after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 2:0.

Sadio Mane (Liverpool) gets on the end of a pass and takes a low shot from the edge of the box which is straight at Hugo Lloris, who makes a comfortable save. The ball goes behind for a corner. Liverpool will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

Hugo Lloris stretches to his right side and makes a brilliant save! Sadio Mane (Liverpool) met a rebound outside the box and attempted to beat the keeper into the top right corner. The ball goes out of play. Liverpool are awarded a corner kick.
Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Simon Mignolet is alert and denies him.
Dele Alli (Tottenham) plants a goal-bound header towards the left post after a nice cross inside the box, but one of the defenders manages to deflect it away. Tottenham get a corner.
What was Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) produced a promising shot towards the bottom left corner after his wonderful solo run, but Hugo Lloris thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.
A decent effort by Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) from a close-range free kick! His attempt flies narrowly over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Liverpool will have a goal kick.

Good team movement sets up Jose Holebas (Watford) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.

What a wonderful moment! Paul Pogba (Manchester United) receives a perfect pass in the middle of the pitch, lines up the ball and unloads a powerful strike towards the right post. His effort fails to surprise Heurelho Gomes, who makes a nice save. The ball goes out of play. Manchester Utd are awarded a corner kick.

Paul Pogba (Manchester United) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He latches on to a precise pass and fires a decent first-time shot towards the bottom left corner from a promising distance, but Heurelho Gomes denies him.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the bottom left corner. Heurelho Gomes shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.

Walter Mazzarri makes a switch. Daryl Janmaat (Watford) is coming on in place of Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera at the start of the second period.
Anthony Martial (Manchester United) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he misses the right post by a whisker.
A truly beautiful footballing moment. Mauro Zarate (Watford) takes the free kick from a very promising position, but the goalkeeper thwarts the effort with an amazing save.

Anthony Martial (Manchester United) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Heurelho Gomes is just a bystander as the ball flies into the bottom left corner. The score is 2:0.
CHANCE! Daryl Janmaat (Watford) picks up a pass inside the box and has a sight of goal, but he blazes his shot well over the top.
Substitution. Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) on for Juan Manuel Mata.

Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Romelu Lukaku (Everton) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a low shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the middle of the goal, but Victor Valdes made an astonishing save!
The referee had an easy-decision to make. A yellow card is given to Adam Clayton (Middlesbrough) for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Well-positioned Ademola Lookman (Everton) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot towards the bottom left corner, but Victor Valdes reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Adam Clayton (Middlesbrough) escapes his marker to connect with a cross and heads towards the top of the net, but the keeper pulls off an excellent save to deny him.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Adam Forshaw will be replaced by Adlene Guedioura (Middlesbrough).
Ronald Koeman has decided to make a change. Enner Valencia (Everton) replaces Idrissa Gueye.
Substitution. Gaston Ramirez (Middlesbrough) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Christian Stuani walks off.

Ademola Lookman (Everton) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the bottom right corner. Victor Valdes guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.

Rudy Gestede (Middlesbrough) wins a header inside the box after a cross and steers it goalwards, but Joel Robles produces a wonderful reflex save. The ball goes out for a corner. Middlesbrough can continue in their attacking effort.
That's the end of the match.

The game is interrupted because of a yellow card that is shown to Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace).

Ryan Bertrand sends a superb cross into the box. Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Vito Mannone beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:1.
Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton) receives the ball inside the box, reacts quickly and without any problems stabs the ball low in the middle of the goal.

Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! James Morrison displays great vision and sends a pass to Nacer Chadli (West Brom), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the back of the net. The score is 0:1.
Ben Foster reacts well to deny a long-range free kick from Robert Snodgrass (West Ham) towards the bottom left corner. West Ham will take a corner kick.

What a great touch by Salomon Rondon (West Brom)! He picks up a precise pass inside the box and immediately produces a shot towards the net. Unfortunately for him, his bullet only crashes against the crossbar.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.

There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Slaven Bilic probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Aaron Cresswell. He is replaced by Jonathan Calleri (West Ham).

Pedro Obiang (West Ham) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Oliver had an easy-decision to make.
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort smashes against the crossbar! What an opportunity!
Goal! Sofiane Feghouli (West Ham) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:1.

Salomon Rondon (West Brom) has tested the patience of referee Michael Oliver and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Winston Reid (West Ham) was quite harsh and Michael Oliver didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Ambitious effort from Marcus Rashford (Manchester United). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well over the bar.

Yaya Toure (Manchester City) takes the resulting free kick from 23 metres out. He attempts to send his effort into the top left corner, but Lukasz Fabianski is alert and keeps the ball out. The ball goes out of play. Manchester City are awarded a corner kick.

Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball goes out of play. Manchester City are awarded a corner kick.

Wayne Hennessey pulls off a great save to deny Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far! Sunderland earn a corner.

Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.

Sofiane Feghouli sends a terrific cross into the box. Andrew Carroll (West Ham) gets on the end of it but his header from the centre of the box goes just over the bar.
Goal! Jay Rodriguez plays it to Manolo Gabbiadini (Southampton), whose deflected shot from inside the box goes past the helpless Darren Randolph. 1:0.
It's 1:1! Pedro Obiang feeds Andrew Carroll (West Ham) inside the box, who is unmarked and buries the ball in the bottom right corner.

Robert Snodgrass (West Ham) connects with a cross on the edge of the box, controls the ball and pulls the trigger. Fraser Forster makes a beautiful save to deny his effort which would have ended inside the left post.

Pedro Obiang (West Ham) quickly gets to a rebound. He is not worried how far out he is and slams the ball towards the goal. To the amazement of all, it goes all the way into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:2 with this magnificent strike.

Substitution. Jay Rodriguez leaves the pitch and is replaced by Nathan Redmond (Southampton).
Goal! The free-kick is fired in by Mark Noble (West Ham) and the ball inadvertently flicks off a defender and spins into the net, leaving Fraser Forster stranded. 1:3.
