Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) gets a yellow card. The referee Graham Scott made the right call.
Winston Reid (West Ham) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Graham Scott didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

What a wasted opportunity by Steven Davis (Southampton)! He creates some space for himself inside the penalty box and unleashes a decent strike towards the bottom right corner, but Darren Randolph makes an astonishing save to thwart him.
Substitution. Sofiane Feghouli will be replaced by Jonathan Calleri (West Ham).
Michail Antonio (West Ham) collects a pass on the edge of the box but he slips the ball just wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has just begun.
The game is interrupted. M'Baye Niang (Watford) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.
Michael Oliver shows a red card with no hesitation. Jeff Hendrick (Burnley) can have an early bath and think about his challenge.

It's a goal! Troy Deeney (Watford) makes it 1:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from M'Baye Niang and planted his close-range header into the left side of the goal. Tom Heaton was helpless.
Jose Holebas (Watford) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Michael Oliver didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
M'Baye Niang (Watford) produces a long-range cannon of a shot after a nice pass. The ball heads under the crossbar, but is stopped by a great save from Tom Heaton. Watford get a corner.

Joey Barton (Burnley) latches on to a lofted pass from the resulting set piece and pulls the trigger from around the penalty spot. His effort towards the roof of the net is saved by the excellent Heurelho Gomes. Now Burnley have a corner.
Michael Oliver shows the yellow card to Etienne Capoue (Watford) for a heavy challenge.

Jose Holebas sends a superb cross into the box. M'Baye Niang (Watford) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header inside the right post, leaving Tom Heaton beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 2:0.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Michael Oliver has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Sean Dyche has decided to make a change. Robbie Brady (Burnley) replaces Andre Gray.
Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Valon Behrami.
Troy Deeney (Watford) picks up a cross inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the right side of the goal. His promising effort is kept out by Tom Heaton, who pulls off a stunning save!
The referee allows time for a substitution. Scott Arfield will be replaced by Ashley Westwood (Burnley).
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Sebastian Prodl (Watford) is given a yellow card.
Joy for one side, despair for the other as the referee gives a penalty to Burnley!
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) is going to take the penalty!
Ashley Barnes (Burnley) easily converts the penalty kick as he sends the ball straight into the bottom left corner, ricocheting in off the post. Heurelho Gomes was helpless.
Substitution. Isaac Success (Watford) in, M'Baye Niang out.
Sean Dyche has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sam Vokes (Burnley) replacing George Boyd.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Daryl Janmaat (Watford) comes onto the pitch for Mauro Zarate.
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Troy Deeney (Watford) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
The foul by Craig Cathcart (Watford) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Oliver.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Salomon Rondon (West Brom) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
James Morrison (West Brom) connects with a pass inside the box and slams home into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper was helpless.
Salomon Rondon (West Brom) makes a yard for himself inside the box after an accurate pass and takes a shot that goes just wide of the right post.
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) sees a yellow card from Kevin Friend after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Kevin Friend starts the second half.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Peter Crouch trots off the pitch and is replaced by Saido Berahino (Stoke City).
Mark Hughes prepares a substitution. Charles Graham Adam is replaced by Mame Diouf (Stoke City).
Kevin Friend shows a yellow card to Matt Phillips (West Brom), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Substitution. Nacer Chadli makes his way off the pitch and James McClean (West Brom) comes on as his replacement.
Ben Foster (West Brom) earns the yellow card.
Mark Hughes has decided to make a change. Julien Ngoy (Stoke City) replaces Ibrahim Afellay.
Matt Phillips goes off the pitch and Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) comes on.
Tony Pulis has decided to substitute James Morrison and he is replaced by Sam Field (West Brom).
Bruno Martins Indi (Stoke City) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Kevin Friend didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) connects with a cross near the penalty spot and produces a header which hits the crossbar!
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) gets to a rebound inside the six-yard box and produces a header. He manages to put the ball low into the middle of the goal, and thus alter the score to 1:0.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Hector Bellerin limps off the pitch to be replaced by Gabriel (Arsenal).
Close! Diego Costa (Chelsea) picks up the ball in space and from inside the penalty area sends a shot inches wide of the right post.
Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Thibaut Courtois pulls off a fantastic save! Gabriel (Arsenal) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the top of the net, but the effort is kept out. The ball goes out of play and Arsenal have been awarded a corner kick.
Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) takes a brilliant touch after he latches on to a pass on the edge of the box and strikes the ball to the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper dives low and saves his attempt.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Petr Cech is just a bystander as the ball flies into the bottom left corner. The score is 2:0.
Here comes a substitution. Francis Coquelin is given a rest as he is replaced by Olivier Giroud (Arsenal).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Theo Walcott trots off the pitch and is replaced by Danny Welbeck (Arsenal).
Nemanja Matic (Chelsea) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.

Thibaut Courtois pulls off a fantastic save! Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) attempts to head home after a precise cross into the box. He aims his header towards the left post, but the effort is kept out. The ball is out of play and Arsenal manage to earn a corner.
Antonio Conte prepares a substitution. Eden Hazard is replaced by Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea).
Substitution. Pedro makes way for Willian (Chelsea).
GOAL! Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 3:0.
Substitution. Victor Moses did his best and is replaced by Kurt Zouma (Chelsea).

Diego Costa (Chelsea) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms over the bar.

It's in the back of the net! Nacho Monreal sends a superb cross into the box. Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) latches on to it and from near the penalty spot powers a header low inside the left post, leaving Thibaut Courtois beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 3:1.
Martin Atkinson is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Oumar Niasse (Hull City) was quite harsh and Mike Jones didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the right-hand post, but Eldin Jakupovic was alert and the score remains the same. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Manchester Utd.

Paul Pogba (Manchester United) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Eldin Jakupovic is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him. Manchester Utd earn a corner.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Jose Mourinho gives a chance to Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) and Michael Carrick is off.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Chris Smalling (Manchester United) replaces Phil Jones.
Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) controls a cross inside the six-yard box, but sends his shot slightly wide of the left post.

Marcus Rashford slides a brilliant pass into Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Hull.
The game has come to an end for Henrikh Mkhitaryan. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United).
Substitution. Josh Tymon did his best and is replaced by Andrea Ranocchia (Hull City).
Marco Silva has decided to make a change. Abel Hernandez (Hull City) replaces Oumar Niasse.
Substitution. Evandro will be replaced by Omar Elabdellaoui (Hull City).

Eldin Jakupovic was forced into action to thwart Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United). He found himself some space after latching on to a pass and unleashed a shot to the bottom left corner but couldn't beat the keeper.
Sam Clucas (Hull City) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Lazar Markovic (Hull City) has tested the patience of referee Mike Jones and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The yellow card goes to Wayne Rooney (Manchester United).
Lazar Markovic (Hull City) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the left post! What an opportunity that was!
That's a clear yellow card. David Meyler (Hull City) goes into the book.

Eldin Jakupovic gets a loud ovation for his save! Marcos Rojo (Manchester United) meets the rebound and heads the ball towards the top left corner from a promising distance, but the goalkeeper keeps it out.

A neat pass is well received by Paul Pogba (Manchester United), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the top right corner. The goalkeeper makes a decent save to block his shot.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Peter Crouch (Stoke City) has acres of space after latching on to a precise pass into the box. He doesn't hesitate to unleash a great effort which ends up in the right side of the goal.
Goal! Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) sent the ball towards his own goal in an attempt to intercept a pass.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Mason Holgate is replaced by James McCarthy (Everton).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Saido Berahino (Stoke City) comes onto the pitch so that Joe Allen can be given a rest.
Ronald Koeman decides to make a substitution. Kevin Mirallas will be replaced by Ademola Lookman (Everton).
The booking goes to Phillip Bardsley (Stoke City).
Marko Arnautovic comes off the pitch to be replaced by Julien Ngoy (Stoke City).
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.

Goal! Gabriel Jesus displays great vision and sends a pass to Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom right corner. The score is 0:1.
Pedro Obiang (West Ham) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) uses bad language while talking to the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.
David Silva (Manchester City) receives a killer pass, finds himself one-on-one with the goalkeeper and coolly sends the ball into the back of the net.
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) picked up a yellow card from referee.
What a chance that is! David Silva swings the ball into the box, and Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the right post.
What a big chance! Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and skies the ball well over the bar.
Goal! Raheem Sterling rounded the goalkeeper and sent a sweet pass to Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City), who had an easy finish to put it into an empty net. 0:3.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) picks up a yellow card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
Yellow card. Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) goes into the referee's book after a bad challenge.
Substitution. Sofiane Feghouli is replaced by Edimilson Fernandes (West Ham).
Slaven Bilic has decided to make a change. Robert Snodgrass (West Ham) replaces Pedro Obiang.
Kevin Friend blows his whistle and signals a foul after Jose Fonte (West Ham) brought his opponent down. The referee gives a penalty to Manchester City!
Yaya Toure (Manchester City) is going to take the penalty!
Goal! Yaya Toure (Manchester City) slams home the penalty with a precise low shot into the bottom left corner.
It will be a substitution. Fernandinho (Manchester City) is ready to enter the pitch as Kevin De Bruyne walks off.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Andrew Carroll (West Ham) is given a yellow card.
Pep Guardiola has decided to substitute Raheem Sterling and he is replaced by Sergio Aguero (Manchester City).
It's time for a substitution. Ashley Fletcher (West Ham) comes on in place of Andrew Carroll.
Pep Guardiola decides to make a substitution. David Silva will be replaced by Fabian Delph (Manchester City).
A goal, which was scored by Michail Antonio (West Ham), was disallowed due to offside.
Robert Snodgrass (West Ham) dribbles into the box, but Wilfredo Caballero is quick enough to come off his line and stop him. West Ham win a corner.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) receives a pass and tries his luck with a shot from 23 metres out. Thibaut Courtois pulls off a decent save to stop the effort going into the right side of the goal.
David Luiz (Chelsea) takes a free kick from 25-metres out. He surprises the goalkeeper and curls the ball in off the left post. What a strike that is!
Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) was probably a bit loose with his words to Mark Clattenburg, who decides to show him a yellow.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) has a great chance to score from deep inside the box! He creates some space for the shot, but blazes it high over the crossbar. Very bad attempt.
Victor Moses (Chelsea) takes a shot from inside the box and hits the right post!
Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) finds some space inside the box and scores with a crashing header low into the middle of the net, giving the goalkeeper no chance.
James Milner (Liverpool) sees a yellow card from Mark Clattenburg after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Today's match ends for Eden Hazard who will be replaced by Pedro (Chelsea).
Jurgen Klopp has decided to make a change. Sadio Mane (Liverpool) replaces Philippe Coutinho.
Mark Clattenburg blows his whistle for a foul after Joel Matip (Liverpool) hacks down one of his opponents. PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for Chelsea.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Simon Mignolet anticipates the direction of the penalty by Diego Costa (Chelsea). He attempted to put the ball into the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper was there in time to deny him.
Willian (Chelsea) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
Antonio Conte has decided to substitute Willian and he is replaced by Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea).
Good team movement sets up Pedro (Chelsea) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Divock Origi (Liverpool) is coming onto the pitch as Adam Lallana cannot continue after picking up an injury.

What a save from Thibaut Courtois! Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.
Substitution. Diego Costa makes way for Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Younes Kaboul (Watford) fires in a first-time projectile from about 30 metres. Petr Cech stretches but the ball is out of his reach and ends up inside the bottom left corner.

Etienne Capoue (Watford) doesn't hesitate and begins a run towards the opponent's goal. Defenders try to tackle him, but he manages to keep the ball at his feet and pulls the trigger in front of the goal. The strike, though, was not as successful as the solo run and the ball is easily stopped by the keeper.
Goal! Troy Deeney (Watford) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 0:2.
Aaron Ramsey just cannot continue due to injury and has to be substituted. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) replaces him.
Gabriel (Arsenal) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) is yellow-carded.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Half-time substitution. Olivier Giroud will not participate anymore and Theo Walcott (Arsenal) is coming on.
Theo Walcott (Arsenal) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Heurelho Gomes. Arsenal have a corner.
Goal! Alexis Sanchez puts a cross into the box and finds Alex Iwobi (Arsenal), who latches on to it and strikes the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:2.
Substitution. Valon Behrami is replaced by Abdoulaye Doucoure (Watford).
The referee gives a yellow card to Sebastian Prodl (Watford).
Arsene Wenger decides to make a substitution. Francis Coquelin will be replaced by Lucas Perez (Arsenal).
Isaac Success (Watford) joins the action as a substitute, replacing M'Baye Niang.
The referee signals a substitution. Stefano Okaka (Watford) is brought on as a substitute for Troy Deeney.
Lucas Perez (Arsenal) gathers the ball inside the box and produces a snap shot. The ball only crashes against the crossbar.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) receives a yellow card.
Stefano Okaka (Watford) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Tom Cleverley (Watford) is given a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
OFF THE POST! Good play from Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) as skips past two defending players and from the edge of the box unleashes a decent strike that smashes the left post!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Jonathan Moss has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

What a wonderful finish! Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) latches on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and drills a low shot into the bottom left corner. There are not enough superlatives to describe that goal.
Today's referee Jonathan Moss rightly decides to book Joel Ward (Crystal Palace) for his harsh tackle.
Joshua King (Bournemouth) launches himself at the ball from the free kick and produces a header which lacks accuracy, sending it just over the bar.
Substitution. Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) has come on for Benik Afobe.
Eddie Howe has decided to substitute Junior Stanislas and he is replaced by Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Bradley Smith will be replaced by Harry Arter (Bournemouth).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) for James McArthur.
Samuel Allardyce has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Joe Ledley (Crystal Palace) replacing Yohan Cabaye.
What an opportunity! Steve Cook (Bournemouth) picked the ball up and fired a projectile of a shot from long range which threatened the goalkeeper. The shot went painfully close to the right post!
Jonathan Moss shows a yellow card to Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) for a tough tackle.
The foul by Damien Delaney (Crystal Palace) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Jonathan Moss.
Jack Wilshere (Bournemouth) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Wayne Hennessey to dive and make a save.

Andros Townsend sends a superb cross into the box. Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Artur Boruc beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 0:2.
A yellow card is awarded to Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Mathieu Flamini (Crystal Palace) will replace Jason Puncheon.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Sean Dyche is forced to make a change. Steven Defour is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Scott Arfield (Burnley).
Matthew Lowton (Burnley) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) gets to the rebound inside the box and shoots to the middle of the goal, but his sidefooter is blocked by an alert Tom Heaton. What a save!
The substitution is prepared. Ahmed Musa (Leicester) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Demarai Gray.

Michael Keane (Burnley) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick low strike towards the middle of the goal that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a superb goal-line clearance.
A dangerous towering header by Ben Mee (Burnley) from around the penalty spot goes just over the bar. This corner kick didn't change the score.
Marc Albrighton goes off the pitch and Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) comes on.
Stephen Ward (Burnley) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Kasper Schmeichel is alert and denies him.
Sean Dyche has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sam Vokes (Burnley) replacing Ashley Barnes.
Goal! Sam Vokes (Burnley) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top of the net. It's 1:0.
Substitution. James Tarkowski (Burnley) has come on for Jeff Hendrick.
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The first half has started.

It's in! Darren Fletcher spots his teammate in a good position on the edge of the box and provides him with a nice pass. James Morrison (West Brom) doesn't think twice and rifles a first-time shot into the bottom right corner. The score is now 0:1.

Stuart Attwell blows his whistle for a foul after Gareth McAuley (West Brom) hacks down one of his opponents. The crowd is going crazy! The referee makes a call and gives the penalty to Middlesbrough.
Alvaro Negredo (Middlesbrough) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal to give the goalkeeper no chance!
The goalkeeper pulls off a remarkable reflex save to deny a rebound from Christian Stuani (Middlesbrough)! That was a huge opportunity! The ball goes out of play and it will be a corner kick.
Bernardo Espinosa (Middlesbrough) is cautioned by the referee.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Stuart Attwell has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Alvaro Negredo (Middlesbrough) picked up a yellow card from referee.
Here comes a substitution. Nacer Chadli is given a rest as he is replaced by James McClean (West Brom).
Tony Pulis has decided to substitute Jose Rondon and he is replaced by Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Patrick Bamford (Middlesbrough) comes onto the pitch so that Christian Stuani can be given a rest.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Rudy Gestede (Middlesbrough) will replace Alvaro Negredo.
Craig Dawson (West Brom) is penalised.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Fabio Borini (Sunderland) zig-zags his way into the box and fires the ball towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a great reaction save to stop the effort.
Jack Rodwell (Sunderland) lunges into his opponent and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Danny Rose is substituted due to injury. Mauricio Pochettino gives a chance to Ben Davies (Tottenham).
The end of the first half.
The second half gets underway.
Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) rises high to meet a perfect cross, but luckily for the goalkeeper he steers his header just over the crossbar.
Javier Manquillo (Sunderland) has tested the patience of referee Lee Mason and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Fabio Borini comes off the pitch to be replaced by George Honeyman (Sunderland).
Here is a change. Heung-Min Son is going off and Mauricio Pochettino gives the last tactical orders to Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham).
The substitution has been made. Vincent Janssen (Tottenham) has replaced Mousa Dembele.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Leroy Fer (Swansea) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Fraser Forster, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. Swansea earn a corner.
Gylfi Sigurdsson sends over a killer cross from the resulting corner and expertly finds Alfie Mawson (Swansea), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the top left corner. It's 1:0.
Jack Cork (Swansea) has tested the patience of referee Roger East and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Fraser Forster makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the roof of the net. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Swansea.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Here is a change. Dusan Tadic is going off and Claude Puel gives the last tactical orders to Sofiane Boufal (Southampton).

Ryan Bertrand sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Shane Long (Southampton) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot into the bottom left corner. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:1.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Wayne Routledge will be replaced by Luciano Narsingh (Swansea).

Goal! Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. Luciano Narsingh assisted in the goal. 2:1.
Leroy Fer goes off the pitch and Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea) comes on.
Paul Clement has decided to make a change. Angel Rangel (Swansea) replaces Martin Olsson.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Sam McQueen (Southampton) comes onto the pitch for Jordy Clasie.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Nathan Redmond leaves the pitch and Joshua Sims (Southampton) comes on.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Federico Fernandez (Swansea) was quite harsh and Roger East didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The match has just finished.
The match has just started.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Michael Dawson (Hull City) is punished with the yellow card.
That was close by Tom Huddlestone (Hull City)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes inches wide of the right post.
Ryan Mason is being substituted because of an injury. Marco Silva sends David Meyler (Hull City) on the pitch.
Harry Maguire (Hull City) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Harry Maguire (Hull City) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
A yellow card for a tackle by Curtis Davies (Hull City). Neil Swarbrick doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the crossbar. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Eldin Jakupovic with a fabulous save. Chelsea have been awarded a corner kick.
Neil Swarbrick shows the yellow card to N'Golo Kante (Chelsea) for a heavy challenge.

Harry Maguire (Hull City) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the right-hand post. Thibaut Courtois is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
What a sweet touch by Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Eldin Jakupovic to hold.
Goal! Victor Moses produces a great pass that finds Diego Costa (Chelsea) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom right corner. 1:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Andrew Robertson (Hull City) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Neil Swarbrick ignores the protests.

Diego Costa (Chelsea) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Diego Costa (Chelsea) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Chelsea.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Curtis Davies as he is replaced by Oumar Niasse (Hull City).

Michael Dawson (Hull City) makes contact with a cross and strikes a shot that lacks the power to find the back of the net, but the goalkeeper still has to make a good save to keep his effort out. It will be a corner kick for Hull.
Today's match ends for Eden Hazard who will be replaced by Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea).
Antonio Conte prepares a substitution. Pedro is replaced by Willian (Chelsea).
Adama Diomande (Hull City) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Abel Hernandez.
Gary Cahill (Chelsea) gathers a perfect a cross and nods home. The ball goes inside the right post. No chance for the goalkeeper.

Diego Costa (Chelsea) produced a promising shot towards the bottom right corner after his wonderful solo run, but Eldin Jakupovic thwarted him with a fabulous save. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Chelsea.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Diego Costa trots off the pitch and is replaced by Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea).
Oumar Niasse (Hull City) makes a good run inside the box to meet a precise cross. He latches on to it and shoots, but the goalkeeper pulls off an excellent save.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Burnley.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Jonathan Moss blows his whistle to start the second half.

Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar. The ball goes out of play and Burnley will have a goal kick.
Matthew Lowton (Burnley) has tested the patience of referee Jonathan Moss and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal) outjumps the defence inside the six-yard box to meet the corner and scores with a great header into the left side of the goal. The keeper had no chance to react. The score is now 1:0.
Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) makes a horror tackle on his opponent and the referee sends him off!
Substitution. Alex Iwobi is replaced by Francis Coquelin (Arsenal).

Steven Defour (Burnley) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top of net only for Petr Cech to dive and make a save. The ball goes out for a corner. Burnley can continue in their attacking effort.
Sean Dyche decides to make a substitution. Jeff Hendrick will be replaced by Joey Barton (Burnley).
Jonathan Moss shows a yellow card to Dean Marney (Burnley) for his blatant foul.
Dean Marney is being substituted because of an injury. Sean Dyche sends James Tarkowski (Burnley) on the pitch.
Here comes a substitution. Sam Vokes (Burnley) is brought on as a substitute for Steven Defour.
Here's the change. Olivier Giroud leaves the pitch and Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) comes on as a substitute.
Arsene Wenger has decided to substitute Mesut Ozil and he is replaced by Hector Bellerin (Arsenal).

Danny Welbeck (Arsenal) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the middle of the goal. Tom Heaton has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Francis Coquelin (Arsenal) commits a foul after making a slide tackle on his opponent. That's a penalty to Burnley! They have a good chance to score now.
Andre Gray (Burnley) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Andre Gray (Burnley) sends Petr Cech the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!
The referee cannot ignore such behaviour. Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal) sees a yellow card and needs to watch himself for the rest of the game.
Ben Mee (Burnley) should know this behaviour is beyond the rules. He was too careless with his challenge and left Jonathan Moss no option but to blow his whistle. Arsenal are awarded a penalty kick!
The referee gives a yellow card to Ashley Barnes (Burnley) for talking back. He must be careful for the remainder of the match.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) steps up and confidently puts his spot-kick into the middle of the net.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Nathan Redmond (Southampton) meets a cross inside the box and heads it goalwards. Unfortunately for him, he sends the ball narrowly over the crossbar. What a chance!
Goal! Cedric Soares tees up James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the left side of the goal. 1:0.
Goal! Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 2:0.
Demarai Gray (Leicester) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes narrowly over the bar. Terrific solo effort, though.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Claudio Ranieri probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Nampalys Mendy. He is replaced by Marc Albrighton (Leicester).
Good chance for Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) as he latched on to a cross on the edge of the box and blasted the ball towards the net! It flew wide of the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jack Stephens (Southampton) is coming onto the pitch as Virgil Van Dijk cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Ahmed Musa (Leicester) is coming onto the pitch as Shinji Okazaki cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Close! Wes Morgan (Leicester) is a whisker away from finishing-off the move he started. His close-range effort flies just over the bar.
The manager makes a subsitution with Jordy Clasie (Southampton) coming on for Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Jay Rodriguez walks off the pitch to be replaced by Shane Long (Southampton).
Wes Morgan (Leicester) makes a slide tackle, but referee Michael Oliver blows for a foul. It's a penalty! What an opportunity to score for Southampton.
What was Wes Morgan (Leicester) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Dusan Tadic (Southampton) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Dusan Tadic (Southampton) leaves the keeper helpless with his precise penalty shot into the top right corner.
That's it for today, Michael Oliver has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Kevin Wimmer (Tottenham) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Eric Dier (Tottenham) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee. A free kick has been awarded to Manchester City.

David Silva (Manchester City) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Hugo Lloris makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the bottom right corner. The ball goes behind for a corner. Manchester City will have an opportunity to threaten the opposition's goal.

Pablo Zabaleta (Manchester City) latches on to a fine cross from the resulting corner and attempts to finish from the edge of the box. His shot, however, misses the target narrowly wide of the left post.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) wins a header inside the box after a cross and steers it goalwards, but Hugo Lloris produces a wonderful reflex save.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it towards the left post. Unfortunately for him, Hugo Lloris makes a great save to stop his effort. Manchester City will take a corner kick.
Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Mauricio Pochettino has made a change at the break. Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) has come on in place of Kevin Wimmer.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Leroy Sane (Manchester City), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 1:0.
Andre Marriner rightly pulls out a yellow card and shows it to Dele Alli (Tottenham).
Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) is shown a yellow card by the referee.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) finds the back of the net with a lucky strike that goes into the middle of the goal after the goalkeeper makes a howler!
It's a goal! Dele Alli (Tottenham) gets on the end of a pass and it allows him to finish into an empty net with a close-range header. The score has changed to 2:1.
Mauricio Pochettino is forced to make a change. Toby Alderweireld is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Harry Winks (Tottenham).

Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the middle of the goal. Hugo Lloris is alert, though, and makes an easy save to deny him.

Harry Kane passes to Heung-Min Son (Tottenham), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom left corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 2:2.
Mousa Dembele goes off the pitch and Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) comes on.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) replaces Raheem Sterling.
Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) wins himself enough space to connect with a cross inside the box, but his fine header goes narrowly over the crossbar!
The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Gabriel Jesus (Manchester City) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Pep Guardiola prepares a substitution. Gael Clichy is replaced by John Stones (Manchester City).
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) for his blatant foul.
Substitution. David Silva did his best and is replaced by Fabian Delph (Manchester City).
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
GOAL! The corner comes over and Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera wins a simple header before Christian Kabasele (Watford) nods the ball into the back of the net. 0:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Lee Mason has ended it.
Lee Mason blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Goal! Adam Smith puts the ball on a plate for Joshua King (Bournemouth), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 1:1.
Substitution. Stefano Okaka walks off the pitch and Daryl Janmaat (Watford) comes on as a substitute.

Troy Deeney (Watford) jumped highest to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Tom Cleverley. His header was precise and ended up in the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. The score is 1:2.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jose Holebas (Watford) was quite harsh and Lee Mason didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth) on for Joshua King.
Eddie Howe decides to make a substitution. Junior Stanislas will be replaced by Benik Afobe (Bournemouth).
Younes Kaboul (Watford) infringed the rules and goes into the book. Lee Mason pulls out a yellow card.
It will be a substitution. Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) is ready to enter the pitch as Ryan Fraser walks off.

Andrew Surman produces a sweet pass and picks out Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the bottom right corner and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 2:2!
Here is a change. Christian Kabasele is going off and Walter Mazzarri gives the last tactical orders to Craig Cathcart (Watford).
Walter Mazzarri prepares a substitution. Abdoulaye Doucoure is replaced by Odion Ighalo (Watford).
Steve Cook (Bournemouth) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Lee Mason is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The match has just started.
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) tries his luck with a shot from the edge of the box, but the ball crashes against the crossbar! It would have been a superb goal.

Kevin Mirallas (Everton) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom left corner. Wayne Hennessey has a clear sight of it makes a comfortable save.
Mason Holgate (Everton) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
Ross Barkley (Everton) has a goal ruled out for offside!
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Morgan Schneiderlin (Everton) for Gareth Barry.
Samuel Allardyce has decided to make a change. Chung-Yong Lee replaces Loic Remy (Crystal Palace).
Here is a change. Yohan Cabaye is going off and Samuel Allardyce gives the last tactical orders to Joe Ledley (Crystal Palace).
The referee allows time for a substitution. Kevin Mirallas will be replaced by Ademola Lookman (Everton).

Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) displays brilliant awareness inside the six-yard box and leaps high to meet the free kick. He tries to put his header into the left side of the target, but Joel Robles keeps the ball out. The ball goes out for a corner. Crystal Palace can continue in their attacking effort.
Goal - 0:1! Tom Davies tees up Seamus Coleman (Everton) inside the box and he slams the ball into the roof of the net and past Wayne Hennessey.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jeffery Schlupp departs the field of play to be replaced by Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace).
We are about to witness a substitution. Phil Jagielka (Everton) is replacing Ross Barkley.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) was quite harsh and Martin Atkinson didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Manuel Lanzini takes over corner duties and expertly finds Andrew Carroll (West Ham), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the left side of the goal. The score is now 0:1.

Goal! Calum Chambers displays great vision and sends a pass to Christian Stuani (Middlesbrough), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 1:1.
Goal! Andrew Carroll (West Ham) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 1:2.
The end of the first half.
Martin Atkinson blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Problems for Slaven Bilic as Mark Noble is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Edimilson Fernandes (West Ham) replaces him.
It will be a substitution. Jonathan Calleri (West Ham) is ready to enter the pitch as Andrew Carroll walks off.
Substitution. Christian Stuani makes way for Patrick Bamford (Middlesbrough).
Benjamin Gibson (Middlesbrough) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Bernardo (Middlesbrough) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Martin Atkinson had an easy-decision to make.
Aitor Karanka de la Hoz has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Rudy Gestede (Middlesbrough) replacing Adam Forshaw.
We are about to witness a subsitution. James Collins (West Ham) for Sofiane Feghouli.
Goal! Manuel Lanzini plays it to Jonathan Calleri (West Ham), whose deflected shot from inside the box goes past the helpless Victor Valdes. 1:3.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) has tested the patience of referee Mark Clattenburg and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Own goal! Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) suffers a good deal of misfortune as he accidentally puts a pass from one of the attacking players into his own net. The score is 1:0.
Chance! Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Zlatan Ibrahimovic, but his shot from inside the box flashes just over the bar.
Mark Clattenburg has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Today's match ends for Marouane Fellaini who will be replaced by Marcus Rashford (Manchester United).
Caution goes to Lee Grant (Stoke City).
Erik Pieters (Stoke City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Mark Clattenburg had an easy-decision to make.
It is time for a substitution. Ibrahim Afellay (Stoke City) is on for Charles Graham Adam.
Jose Mourinho has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) replacing Juan Manuel Mata.
The game has come to an end for Henrikh Mkhitaryan. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Jesse Lingard (Manchester United).
Julien Ngoy (Stoke City) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Xherdan Shaqiri.
Jesse Lingard (Manchester United) latches on to a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a brilliant shot towards the goal, but he hits the crossbar!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Marko Arnautovic trots off the pitch and is replaced by Gianelli Imbula (Stoke City).
Joe Allen (Stoke City) gets booked for the first time in this match. It's a free kick to Manchester Utd, but it's in no position for a direct shot on goal.
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) scores a goal from the resulting free kick, sending it into the top right corner. What a strike that is, absolutely fantastic!
Mark Clattenburg is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.
Jose Rondon (West Brom) manages to meet a nice cross in front of the goal, but his header is unintentionally blocked by one of his teammates.
Goal - 1:0! Gareth McAuley tees up Darren Fletcher (West Brom) inside the box and he curls the ball into the right side of the net and past Vito Mannone.
OFF THE BAR! Jose Rondon (West Brom) latches on to an accurate pass inside the box and fires a bullet of a shot that crashes against the crossbar.
Goal! Chris Brunt (West Brom) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot into the top right corner. It's 2:0.
The match has reached half-time.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Here's the change. Adnan Januzaj leaves the pitch and Victor Anichebe (Sunderland) comes on as a substitute.
Here is a change. James Morrison is going off and Tony Pulis gives the last tactical orders to Jake Livermore (West Brom).
David William Moyes is forced to make a change. Jason Denayer is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Fabio Borini (Sunderland).
Substitution. Nacer Chadli will be replaced by James McClean (West Brom).
George Honeyman (Sunderland) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Craig Pawson had an easy-decision to make.
Substitution. Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) on for Jose Rondon.
Allan Nyom (West Brom) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Emre Can (Liverpool) jumps highest to meet an accurate cross and heads the ball towards the net. His fine header whistles just inches over the crossbar.
Thomas Carroll (Swansea) tries his luck and takes a shot from inside the box. His effort on goal is blocked by a defender. The linesman makes the right call and Swansea will have a corner.
Kevin Friend shows a yellow card to Ragnar Klavan (Liverpool) for his blatant foul.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The second half has just started.
Goal! Fernando Llorente (Swansea) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot inside the left post. He makes it 0:1.

It's a goal! Fernando Llorente (Swansea) makes it 0:2. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Thomas Carroll and planted his close-range header low into the middle of the goal. Simon Mignolet was helpless.
James Milner produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) rises high to head the ball into the bottom left corner and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:2.
Substitution. Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) on for Philippe Coutinho.
Alfie Mawson (Swansea) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
Goal! Georginio Wijnaldum puts a cross into the box and finds Roberto Firmino (Liverpool), who latches on to it and strikes the ball inside the left post. He makes it 2:2.
That will be all from Emre Can who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Divock Origi (Liverpool).
Goal! Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the right side of the goal. It's 2:3.

Lukasz Fabianski can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Divock Origi (Liverpool). The ball would have probably ended up low inside the middle of the net.
Today's match ends for Martin Olsson who will be replaced by Angel Rangel (Swansea).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Fernando Llorente trots off the pitch and is replaced by Borja Baston (Swansea).
Leroy Fer (Swansea) goes in the referee's notebook after being shown a yellow card.
Here is a change. Leroy Fer is going off and Paul Clement gives the last tactical orders to Jay Fulton (Swansea).
The substitution has been made. Joel Matip (Liverpool) has replaced Georginio Wijnaldum.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan plays a lovely pass into Paul Pogba (Manchester United), but he can't find the target. His strike from inside the box goes narrowly wide of the right post. The ball goes out of play and Liverpool will have a goal kick.
Paul Pogba (Manchester United) probably handled the ball inside the penalty area. Liverpool are given a huge opportunity to score - it's a penalty kick!
James Milner (Liverpool) is going to take the penalty!
James Milner (Liverpool) smoothly converts the penalty with a stunning effort which ends up inside the right post.
Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to Dejan Lovren (Liverpool) for a tough tackle.

Simon Mignolet pulls off a stunning save to block the free kick from Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United). The ball was heading towards the bottom left corner. Manchester Utd force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Simon Mignolet pulls off a great save to deny Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Manchester United), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Michael Oliver has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Jose Mourinho gives a chance to Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) and Michael Carrick is off.

The defence had a hard time blocking out the strike from Divock Origi (Liverpool). He didn't hesitate and finished from outside the box right after he had received a pass from his teammate. Liverpool earn a corner.
Substitution. Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) on for Divock Origi.

Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. David de Gea guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Yellow card! It's like Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) was asking for a caution with his behaviour. Michael Oliver agrees and books him.
Anthony Martial goes off the pitch and Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) comes on.
Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) climbs high to connect with a cross near the penalty spot but plants a header high over the bar.
Jose Mourinho has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) replacing Matteo Darmian.
Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) connects with a cross from out wide in the six-yard box, but only plants his header onto the right post.

Antonio Valencia displays his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross deep into the box. Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) gets onto the scoresheet by superbly heading it in off the crossbar  1:1.
The foul by Ander Herrera (Manchester United) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Oliver.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but David de Gea is alert and denies him.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) dribbles into the box, but Joel Robles is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.

Kevin Mirallas passes to Romelu Lukaku (Everton), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 1:0.
That was close by Raheem Sterling (Manchester City)! He receives a pass on the edge of the box and shoots, but the ball goes by a whisker over the crossbar.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Kevin Mirallas (Everton) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and drills a shot into the bottom left corner in trademark fashion.
Mason Holgate (Everton) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Mark Clattenburg didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Substitution. Pablo Zabaleta makes his way off the pitch and Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) comes on as his replacement.
Ronald Koeman has decided to substitute Kevin Mirallas and he is replaced by Morgan Schneiderlin (Everton).
Here's the change. Gareth Barry leaves the pitch and James McCarthy (Everton) comes on as a substitute.
The foul by David Silva (Manchester City) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Mark Clattenburg.
GOAL! Tom Davies (Everton) collects a pass and from inside the box he lifts the ball over Claudio Bravo, who was off his line. What a finish that is! 3:0.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Joel Robles, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.
That will be all from Ross Barkley who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Ademola Lookman (Everton).
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) receives a yellow card for infringement.
The referee gives a yellow card to Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City).
Goal! Ademola Lookman (Everton) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 4:0.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.

GOAL! Superb work from Eden Hazard, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Marcos Alonso (Chelsea), who beats Kasper Schmeichel with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner. 0:1.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
The whistle blows and Christian Fuchs (Leicester) is booked for an infringement.
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) picks it up in space and from the edge of the box lashes in a shot that is deflected past the helpless Kasper Schmeichel. 0:2.
It will be a substitution. Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) is ready to enter the pitch as Robert Huth walks off.
What a chance for Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball went just wide of the right post.
Pedro (Chelsea) leaps high to plant a header towards the left side of the goal. Kasper Schmeichel is unable to keep the ball out and the score is 0:3.
Ahmed Musa goes off the pitch and Demarai Gray (Leicester) comes on.
Here is a change. Marc Albrighton is going off and Claudio Ranieri gives the last tactical orders to Danny Simpson (Leicester).
Substitution. Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) on for Eden Hazard.
Antonio Conte has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea) replacing Willian.
The manager makes a subsitution with Ruben Loftus-Cheek (Chelsea) coming on for Pedro.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Maya Yoshida (Southampton) receives a yellow card.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Dean Marney (Burnley) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Paul Tierney had an easy-decision to make.
Oriol Romeu (Southampton) has tested the patience of referee Paul Tierney and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Claude Puel decides to make a substitution. Dusan Tadic will be replaced by Jay Rodriguez (Southampton).
Here comes a substitution. Joey Barton (Burnley) is brought on as a substitute for Dean Marney.
Sean Dyche has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Sam Vokes (Burnley) replacing Steven Defour.
Joey Barton (Burnley) fires a daisy-cutter inside the right post from the free kick just outside the box. Football supporters are always happy to see such a fabulous goal.
Substitution. Nathan Redmond leaves the pitch and is replaced by Joshua Sims (Southampton).
Sean Dyche prepares a substitution. Andre Gray is replaced by James Tarkowski (Burnley).
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
Harry Maguire (Hull City) knocks his opponent down with an over-the-top tackle. PENALTY to Bournemouth! Great chance to score.
Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) coolly converts the penalty. His precise shot goes inside the left post, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.

It's a goal! Abel Hernandez (Hull City) makes it 1:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Andrew Robertson and planted his close-range header into the middle of the goal. Artur Boruc was helpless.

Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and nets into the middle of the goal.
