The ball is directed to the bottom left corner, but it lacks power and David Marshall pulls off a comfortable save to thwart the effort. The ball goes out of play and Tottenham have been awarded a corner kick.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Curtis Davies (Hull City) for his blatant foul.

Jake Livermore (Hull City) attempts to turn the rebound in from close range. Nevertheless, the goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save and stops the ball from hitting the net. Great goalkeeping. Hull earn a corner.
It will be a substitution. Harry Winks (Tottenham) is ready to enter the pitch as Dele Alli walks off.

Goal! Kyle Walker displays great vision and sends a pass to Christian Eriksen (Tottenham), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball from close range in the back of the net. The score is 2:0.
Here is a change. Sam Clucas is going off and Mike Phelan gives the last tactical orders to Ryan Mason (Hull City).
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) releases a promising shot from the free kick from around 20 metres out. The ball goes towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a save and denies him.
Goal! Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 3:0.
Mauricio Pochettino has decided to substitute Harry Kane and he is replaced by Heung-Min Son (Tottenham).
The manager makes a subsitution with David Meyler (Hull City) coming on for Jake Livermore.
Mike Phelan prepares a substitution. Robert Snodgrass is replaced by Jarrod Bowen (Hull City).
Substitution. Joshua Onomah (Tottenham) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Moussa Sissoko walks off.
That's the end of the match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Jose Rondon (West Brom) receives a great pass inside the box and misses a golden chance. The goalkeeper pulls off a stunning save.
West Brom have a goal ruled out for offside!
The match has reached half-time.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.

Perfectly taken free kick! Matt Phillips sends a cross in and Jose Rondon (West Brom) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes low inside the right post and the score changes to 1:0.

Chris Brunt showcases his great technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box. Jose Rondon (West Brom) meets the cross and gets himself onto the scoresheet with a header into the bottom left corner. It's 2:0.

The ball hits the back of the net! Jose Rondon (West Brom) meets a brilliant cross from Chris Brunt and scores with a bullet header from close range in off the crossbar. Lukasz Fabianski had no chance of stopping that. The score is 3:0.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Modou Barrow (Swansea) is coming onto the pitch as Jefferson Montero cannot continue after picking up an injury.
That will be all from Nacer Chadli who is being replaced by the fresh legs of James McClean (West Brom).
Bob Bradley has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Borja Baston (Swansea) replacing Fernando Llorente.
Here is a change. Leon Britton is going off and Bob Bradley gives the last tactical orders to Jack Cork (Swansea).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Craig Gardner (West Brom) will replace James Morrison.
What a sweet touch by Borja Baston (Swansea) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Ben Foster to hold.
Goal! Wayne Routledge (Swansea) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 3:1.
The referee signals a substitution. Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) is brought on as a substitute for Jose Rondon.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Nathaniel Clyne produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Adam Lallana (Liverpool) rises high to head the ball into the left side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 0:1.

Viktor Fischer (Middlesbrough) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the right post. Simon Mignolet guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save. The linesman makes the right call and Middlesbrough will have a corner.
What a chance that is! Sadio Mane (Liverpool) wastes a huge opportunity as he receives a beautiful pass inside the box but is somehow only able to prod the ball onto the right post!
Divock Origi (Liverpool) blows a clear opportunity! He needed only to tap the ball in, but narrowly misses the goal.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
Victor Valdes pulls off a great save to deny Sadio Mane (Liverpool) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Sadio Mane (Liverpool) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Viktor Fischer departs the field of play to be replaced by Stewart Downing (Middlesbrough).
Aitor Karanka de la Hoz has decided to substitute Adam Clayton and he is replaced by Grant Leadbitter (Middlesbrough).
Adam Lallana provides Divock Origi (Liverpool) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.
Goal! Divock Origi provides Adam Lallana (Liverpool) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a precise effort inside the left post. 0:3.
Benjamin Gibson (Middlesbrough) sees a yellow card from Jonathan Moss after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The referee signals a substitution. Jordan Rhodes (Middlesbrough) is brought on as a substitute for Alvaro Negredo.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Adam Lallana leaves the pitch and Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) comes on.
Substitution. Oviemuno Ejaria (Liverpool) has come on for Georginio Wijnaldum.
Jurgen Klopp is forced to make a change. Divock Origi is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Trent Alexander-Arnold (Liverpool).
The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) scores! He latches on to a pass and produces a perfect strike from the edge of the box. The ball goes into the bottom right corner and past the goalkeeper.
Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
John O'Shea (Sunderland) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
The free kick from the edge of the box is taken by Willian (Chelsea), who fires in a direct effort inches over the crossbar. What a chance!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Neil Swarbrick has ended it.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.

Adnan Januzaj (Sunderland) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him. The linesman points to the corner flag, Sunderland are going to take it.
Willian (Chelsea) muscles his way past two defenders but his shot from inside the box smashes against the crossbar!
Diego Costa (Chelsea) came close to scoring but should have done much better. His poor attempt from close range ended up in the gloves of Jordan Pickford.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) meets a cross inside the box, but his header is blocked by an opposing player.
It's like he was asking for a caution. Pedro (Chelsea) receives a yellow card.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland) for Jan Kirchhoff.
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Billy Jones leaves the pitch to be replaced by Donald Love (Sunderland).
Fabio Borini (Sunderland) sees a yellow card. He should be more careful because one more challenge like that could result in a red card.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Nemanja Matic (Chelsea) is coming onto the pitch as Pedro cannot continue after picking up an injury.
It is time for a substitution. Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland) is on for Fabio Borini.
What a big chance! Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and misses the net well wide of the right post.
Antonio Conte has decided to substitute Willian and he is replaced by Nathaniel Chalobah (Chelsea).

Jason Denayer (Sunderland) attempts to convert a cross into a goal, but his promising header from near the penalty spot towards the middle of the net is denied by Thibaut Courtois. This effort really didn't trouble him.
Caution goes to Victor Moses (Chelsea).
That will be all from Victor Moses who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Branislav Ivanovic (Chelsea).

A neat pass is well received by Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland), who is lurking on the edge of the box and strikes the ball towards the left post, but the goalkeeper makes an incredible save to block his shot.
That's the end of the match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Pedro Obiang (West Ham) expertly controls a neat clever pass on the edge of the penalty area, but his effort rattles the left post! What a shot that was!
Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Aaron Cresswell (West Ham) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.
Mark Noble (West Ham) got hold of the ball and swiftly shot from the edge of the box. His fine strike, however, only found the right post.
Ben Mee (Burnley) commits a rough challenge and Robert Madley blows his whistle for a foul. PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for West Ham.
Mark Noble (West Ham) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Tom Heaton anticipates the direction of the penalty by Mark Noble (West Ham). He attempted to put the ball into the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper was there in time to deny him.
Goal! The rebound fell to Mark Noble (West Ham) and he fired home from close range. The score is 1:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The game restarts for the second half.
Darren Randolph pulls off a great save to deny Scott Arfield (Burnley), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal.
Ben Mee (Burnley) sees a yellow card from Robert Madley after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Slaven Bilic decides to make a substitution. Manuel Lanzini will be replaced by Andre Ayew (West Ham).
Scott Arfield (Burnley) takes the resulting free kick from 21 metres out. He attempts to send his effort into the right side of the goal, but Darren Randolph is alert and keeps the ball out.
Jeff Hendrick (Burnley) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Robert Madley didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
It is time for a substitution. Ashley Barnes (Burnley) is on for George Boyd.
Slaven Bilic has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ashley Fletcher (West Ham) replacing Andrew Carroll.
The game has come to an end for Mark Noble. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Havard Nordtveit (West Ham).
Sean Dyche has decided to substitute Scott Arfield and he is replaced by Patrick Bamford (Burnley).
Robert Madley is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The first half has just begun.

Jamie Vardy (Leicester) bursts inside the box, beats two defenders and produces a strike from the penalty spot. The shot has power, but lacks precision and the goalkeeper stops it easily. The scoreline remains the same.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) reacts well to latch onto a rebound inside the box, but his shot is well blocked. The ball goes out of play. Leicester are awarded a corner kick.
Robert Huth (Leicester) gets to the rebound just outside the box, but his attempt is blocked by one of the defending players. Leicester have been awarded a corner kick.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a shot towards the middle of the goal, which Ron-Robert Zieler was unable to keep it out. 1:0.
Andy King (Leicester) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Paul Tierney has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half has just started.
Claudio Ranieri has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) comes on the pitch for Islam Slimani.
What a chance that is! Adam Smith (Bournemouth) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
Substitution. Benik Afobe makes his way off the pitch and Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) comes on as his replacement.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Marc Albrighton will be replaced by Ahmed Musa (Leicester).
Robert Huth (Leicester) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
Eddie Howe has decided to make a change. Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) replaces Joshua King.
That will be all from Robert Huth who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester).
Paul Tierney shows a yellow card to Wes Morgan (Leicester) for his blatant foul.
Marc Pugh (Bournemouth) shoots after receiving a good pass. His effort from the edge of the box goes just wide of the left post.
Luis Hernandez (Leicester) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Paul Tierney ignores the protests.
Artur Boruc pulls off a great save to deny Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) who, makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive towards the middle of the goal.
Callum Wilson is substituted due to injury. Eddie Howe gives a chance to Tyrone Mings (Bournemouth).
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
Phil Jagielka (Everton) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Mark Clattenburg ignores the protests.

Goal! Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) takes the resulting free-kick from the edge of the box, but the ball takes a deflection off a defender and goes past the helpless Maarten Stekelenburg and into the net. 0:1.
Mark Clattenburg shows a yellow card to James McCarthy (Everton) for a tough tackle.

It's a goal! Seamus Coleman (Everton) makes it 1:1. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Leighton Baines and planted his close-range header into the bottom right corner. Petr Cech was helpless.
The end of the first half.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) creates some space for himself to pick up a pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a decent strike which goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Good team movement sets up Ross Barkley (Everton) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Kevin Mirallas (Everton) is coming onto the pitch as Aaron Lennon cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Substitution. Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) has come on for Theo Walcott.
Arsene Wenger prepares a substitution. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain is replaced by Alex Iwobi (Arsenal).
Substitution. Enner Valencia walks off the pitch and Dominic Calvert-Lewin (Everton) comes on as a substitute.
The foul by Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Mark Clattenburg. Everton are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.

James McCarthy (Everton) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the right-hand post. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Petr Cech with a fabulous save. Everton force a corner. Their opponents will face another attacking threat.
Ross Barkley sends over a killer cross from the resulting corner and expertly finds Ashley Williams (Everton), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the top left corner. It's 2:1.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Lucas Perez (Arsenal) for Francis Coquelin.
Ronald Koeman decides to make a substitution. James McCarthy will be replaced by Ramiro Mori (Everton).

Phil Jagielka (Everton) must have known he would be sent off for this foul, but he had to stop the opponent at all costs. Mark Clattenburg shows him a second yellow card and the game has ended for him.
Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) is first to the rebound but his shot is blocked. Wow, what an escape there for the opposition.

Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the bottom left corner that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has just begun.
Goal! Sadio Mane sends a precise cross into the box, Adam Lallana (Liverpool) latches on to it and puts the ball into the bottom right corner. He makes it 1:0.

Loris Karius pulls off a great save to deny Michail Antonio (West Ham), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to West Ham.
Dimitri Payet (West Ham) beats the goalkeeper with a superb 22-metre free kick. His shot goes inside the left hand post and ends in the back of the net.
GOAL! A terrible mistake leads to a goal. The defender ends up losing possession, allowing Michail Antonio (West Ham) to pick up the ball before slotting it into the back of the net to make it 1:2.
Joel Matip (Liverpool) rises high to connect with a cross from the corner kick, but his powerful header from near the penalty spot crashes against the crossbar!
Mark Clattenburg has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Referee Mark Clattenburg blows his whistle to start the second half.
Jurgen Klopp has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Ragnar Klavan (Liverpool) comes on the pitch for Dejan Lovren.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Divock Origi (Liverpool), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 2:2.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Mark Clattenburg didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
A brilliant individual effort! Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Andre Ayew trots off the pitch and is replaced by Andrew Carroll (West Ham).

Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) had a good opportunity from long range. His shot was directed towards the top right corner, but Darren Randolph was alert and made a comfortable save. Liverpool earn a corner.
Sadio Mane (Liverpool) gets a yellow card.
It is time for a substitution. Edimilson Fernandes (West Ham) is on for Manuel Lanzini.
Mark Clattenburg is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Paul Pogba (Manchester United) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike to the bottom left corner. Hugo Lloris pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Manchester United) takes a first-time shot from the edge of the box, but his effort is well blocked by the defender. The ball is out of play. Manchester Utd win a corner kick.

Goal! Ander Herrera displays great vision and sends a pass to Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Manchester United), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the top of the net. The score is 1:0.
Robert Madley shows a yellow card to Antonio Valencia (Manchester United) for his blatant foul.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the bottom left corner, but he can't get the power to direct it past Hugo Lloris, who gets down to save.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Heung-Min Son departs the field of play to be replaced by Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham).
A yellow card for a tackle by Victor Wanyama (Tottenham). Robert Madley doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Paul Pogba (Manchester United) lashes in a mid-range free kick and his effort crashes against the left post. That was an excellent shot, but unfortunately for him it didn't end up in the back of the net.

Paul Pogba (Manchester United) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Hugo Lloris makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the right side of the goal.
The foul by Paul Pogba (Manchester United) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Robert Madley.
That's the end of the game for Mousa Dembele, who is replaced by Harry Winks (Tottenham).
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) takes the free kick from the edge of the box, but David de Gea dives superbly to deny him. His shot went towards the left side of the goal.
Substitution. Anthony Martial did his best and is replaced by Marcus Rashford (Manchester United).
Robert Madley shows the yellow card to Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Manchester United) for a heavy challenge.
Kyle Walker (Tottenham) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Robert Madley shows a yellow card to Danny Rose (Tottenham), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
It is time for a substitution. Georges-Kevin N'Koudou (Tottenham) is on for Christian Eriksen.
Henrikh Mkhitaryan is being substituted because of an injury. Jose Mourinho sends Eric Bailly (Manchester United) on the pitch.
Jose Mourinho prepares a substitution. Ander Herrera is replaced by Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United).
That's it for today, Robert Madley has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half has just begun.
Antonio Barragan (Middlesbrough) uses bad language while talking to the referee and receives a yellow card for dissent.

Victor Valdes gets a well deserved ovation! Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) produces a decent first-time strike towards the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it. Nice goalkeeping skills.
Stuart Attwell shows the yellow card to Dusan Tadic (Southampton) for a heavy challenge.

What a chance! Viktor Fischer (Middlesbrough) gets on the end of a pass inside the box and takes a shot to the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players makes a crucial goal-line clearance.
Sofiane Boufal (Southampton) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Stuart Attwell didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Claude Puel decided to make a change. Dusan Tadic is replaced by Nathan Redmond (Southampton).
The foul by Adam Forshaw (Middlesbrough) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Stuart Attwell.
Goal - 1:0! Sofiane Boufal (Southampton) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the top left corner. James Ward-Prowse provided an assist for the goal.
Jose Fonte (Southampton) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Stuart Attwell shows a yellow card to Oriol Romeu (Southampton), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Sofiane Boufal will be replaced by Steven Davis (Southampton).
Adam Clayton (Middlesbrough) sees a yellow card from Stuart Attwell after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Christian Stuani will be replaced by Adama Traore (Middlesbrough).

Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) leaps to meet an excellent cross on the edge of the penalty box and sends in a fantastic header towards the bottom left corner of the goal. The opponents defence, however, masters the situation well and keeps the ball out.
Claude Puel has decided to make a change. Shane Long (Southampton) replaces Jordy Clasie.
What a big chance! Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball just over the crossbar.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Chris Brunt (West Brom) makes a good run with the ball, but his shot from the edge of the penalty area goes just wide of the left post. Terrific solo effort, though.
Chris Brunt (West Brom) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Dean had an easy-decision to make. Chelsea win a free kick and will be able to apply some pressure on the opposition goal.
Salomon Rondon (West Brom) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the right post.
The game has begun to heat up. Gareth McAuley (West Brom) challenges an opponent and receives a deserved yellow card for his ugly tackle.
David Luiz (Chelsea) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending the ball towards the bottom left corner only for Ben Foster to dive and make a save.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by N'Golo Kante (Chelsea) was quite harsh and Michael Dean didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Craig Dawson (West Brom) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt. Chelsea are awarded a free kick. Let's see what they create from this.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Claudio Yacob (West Brom) for his blatant foul.
Here is a change. Pedro is going off and Antonio Conte gives the last tactical orders to Willian (Chelsea).
Nemanja Matic (Chelsea) received a pass and didn't think long what to do with it. He fired a powerful long-range shot which went painfully close to the right post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) is coming onto the pitch as Victor Moses cannot continue after picking up an injury.
What a superb goal by Diego Costa (Chelsea). Take a bow, there is nothing you can do about shots like that. The ball goes straight into the top left corner.
Tony Pulis has decided to introduce fresh legs, with James McClean (West Brom) replacing Matt Phillips.
Substitution. Nacer Chadli (West Brom) in, James Morrison out.
Here's the change. Eden Hazard leaves the pitch and Branislav Ivanovic (Chelsea) comes on as a substitute.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Chris Brunt will be replaced by Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom).

N'Golo Kante sprays a wonderful pass out to Marcos Alonso (Chelsea), who cannot get enough power or direction to cause Ben Foster problems and the goalkeeper is able to watch the ball go just wide of the left post.
Nemanja Matic (Chelsea) has tested the patience of referee Michael Dean and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal! Islam Slimani displays great vision and sends a pass to Jamie Vardy (Leicester), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 1:0.
Goal! Islam Slimani slips it to Andy King (Leicester) on the edge of the box and he finds the top left corner with a great effort. The score is 2:0.
A yellow card for a tackle by Danny Simpson (Leicester). Michael Oliver doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision. Manchester City have a free kick.
Riyad Mahrez provides Jamie Vardy (Leicester) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot to the left side of the goal, but is thwarted by a great save from Claudio Bravo.
Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the right post.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Michael Oliver has ended it.
The game restarts for the second half.
Pablo Zabaleta (Manchester City) announces himself with a close-range shot after a cross, but one of the defenders gets in the way of the ball to thwart him.

What a chance that is! Ilkay Gundogan (Manchester City) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) is the one who receives a yellow card.
Pep Guardiola prepares a substitution. Jesus Navas is replaced by Raheem Sterling (Manchester City).
The referee signals a substitution. Yaya Toure (Manchester City) is brought on as a substitute for Kelechi Iheanacho.
Fernando (Manchester City) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Oliver ignores the protests.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ilkay Gundogan leaves the pitch and Nolito (Manchester City) comes on.
Claudio Ranieri has decided to substitute Islam Slimani and he is replaced by Shinji Okazaki (Leicester).
GOAL! Jamie Vardy (Leicester) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 4:0.
Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) converts the free kick from about 24 metres out with a perfectly bent shot that ends up inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance. What a shot!
Substitution. Demarai Gray (Leicester) has come on for Jamie Vardy.

GOAL! Superb work from Aleksandar Kolarov, who plays a vital role in the build-up. He squares it to Nolito (Manchester City), who beats Ron-Robert Zieler with a brilliant shot into the bottom right corner. 4:2.
Nolito (Manchester City) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies narrowly wide of the right post.
The game has come to an end for Riyad Mahrez. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Matthew James (Leicester).
Michael Oliver shows the yellow card to Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) for a heavy challenge.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Bruno Martins Indi (Stoke City), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches over the top.

Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Great ball in from Christian Fuchs. Jamie Vardy (Leicester) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the right post. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Sunderland.
Andre Marriner has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Andre Marriner blows his whistle and the second half starts.

Today's match ends for Islam Slimani who will be replaced by Shinji Okazaki (Leicester).
Patrick van Aanholt (Sunderland) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.

Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the left post. Ron-Robert Zieler has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Sebastian Larsson (Sunderland) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The game has come to an end for Riyad Mahrez. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Ahmed Musa (Leicester).

Goal! Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 2:0.
Yellow card. Papy Djilobodji (Sunderland) goes into the book for a bad tackle on his opponent.

Robert Huth (Leicester) latches onto a precise lofted pass into the penalty area and produces a header at goal, but his attempt low to the middle of the target fails to beat Jordan Pickford, who makes a sensational save.
Goal - 2:1! Demarai Gray laid the ball off to Shinji Okazaki (Leicester), who shot from close range into the bottom left corner, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Christian Fuchs (Leicester) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Andre Marriner had an easy-decision to make.

Danny Simpson (Leicester) gets to the rebound and shoots, but the effort is blocked.
Wes Morgan (Leicester) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and sends a shot to the top right corner of the goal, but is denied by a reflex save from Jordan Pickford.
Wes Morgan (Leicester) misses a rebound from close range. His effort floats narrowly over the crossbar! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Sunderland.

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Jay Fulton (Swansea) was quite harsh and Jonathan Moss didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.

Dele Alli (Tottenham) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Lukasz Fabianski anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going low into the middle of the target. Tottenham have been awarded a corner kick.

Jordi Amat (Swansea) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Borja Baston (Swansea) replaces Jefferson Montero.
A goal, which was scored by Harry Kane (Tottenham), was disallowed due to offside.
Dele Alli (Tottenham) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots low to the middle of the goal, but Lukasz Fabianski pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) is in the right place at the right time. He picks up the rebound after the goalkeeper's poor save and scores easily!
It must be a yellow card. It is. Leroy Fer (Swansea) receives the caution after an awful tackle.

The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Great solo effort by Nordin Amrabat (Watford) as he tricks his way through two defenders before firing a drive from just outside of the box towards the top left corner. The goalkeeper is ready and produces a stunning save. Watford have been awarded a corner kick.
Gareth McAuley (West Brom) sees a yellow card from Graham Scott after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Jonny Evans (West Brom) jumped highest to meet a perfectly executed corner kick by Chris Brunt. His header was precise and ended up in the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper flapping in the wind. The score is 1:0.
What a beauty from just outside the box! Chris Brunt (West Brom) lashed the ball with incredible pace and power into the bottom right corner.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The referee blows his whistle to signal the start of the second half.
Goal! Christian Kabasele (Watford) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Troy Deeney. The score is 2:1.

CLOSE! Matt Phillips (West Brom) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that goes inches wide of the right post! The ball goes out of play and Watford will have a goal kick.

There's no point in Roberto Pereyra (Watford) arguing about the referee's decision as it's an obvious red card for a dangerous tackle.

Troy Deeney (Watford) picked up a yellow card from referee.

What a chance for Eden Hazard (Chelsea) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball went just wide of the right post.
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) for his blatant foul.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the roof of the net is blocked by Thibaut Courtois, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net. Manchester City have been awarded a corner kick. The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Fernandinho (Manchester City) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) blows a good chance to score. He collects a pass inside the box, but his effort to the middle of the goal is brilliantly blocked. Great defending!
What a chance that is! Kevin De Bruyne swings the ball into the box, and Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the right post.
It's an own goal! A pitiful moment for Gary Cahill (Chelsea), who tries to clear a cross into the six-yard box but instead sends the ball behind his own keeper. The score is 1:0.
The match has reached half-time.

Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
N'Golo Kante (Chelsea) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pedro departs the field of play to be replaced by Willian (Chelsea).
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) reacts well to latch onto a rebound inside the box, but his shot is well blocked. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Manchester City.

Kyle Walker (Tottenham) produced a promising shot towards the bottom right corner after his wonderful solo run, but Thibaut Courtois thwarted him with a fabulous save. The referee points to the corner flag and Tottenham will take a corner.

Thibaut Courtois hears the fans clapping his superb goalkeeping. Harry Kane (Tottenham) shoots from the edge of the box towards the top of the net, but the goalkeeper makes a magnificent save. The referee signals a corner kick to Tottenham.

Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the right post is blocked by Jordan Pickford, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.

Steven Pienaar (Sunderland) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Loris Karius. The ball goes out of play. Sunderland are awarded a corner kick.

CLOSE! Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) shows off his amazing skills with a solo run to the edge of the box before fashioning a shot that whistles over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Sunderland.
That's the end of the game for Philippe Coutinho, who is replaced by Divock Origi (Liverpool).
Dejan Lovren (Liverpool) leaps high deep inside the box to meet a beautiful cross from the resultant free kick. He glances a header goalwards, but it goes narrowly wide of the right post.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper. He fires a low shot towards the right side of the net, but Jordan Pickford leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Lamine Kone (Sunderland) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
John O'Shea (Sunderland) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
What an opportunity that was! The ball rebounded out to Emre Can (Liverpool), whose shot from the edge of the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.
What was Dejan Lovren (Liverpool) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) dribbles into the box, but Loris Karius is quick enough to come off his line and stop him.
Steven Pienaar (Sunderland) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

Sadio Mane (Liverpool) gets to the ball from the resulting corner and tries his luck with a shot, but one of the defenders steps in to block the effort. The ball is out of play and Liverpool manage to earn a corner.
Goal - 1:0! Divock Origi (Liverpool) tries his luck from the edge of the box and scores with an accurate shot inside the right post. Jordan Henderson provided an assist for the goal.
Substitution. Lynden Gooch (Sunderland) replaces Steven Pienaar.
David William Moyes decides to make a substitution. Duncan Watmore will be replaced by Adnan Januzaj (Sunderland).

Emre Can (Liverpool) dribbles into space and finds himself in a shooting position, but his shot from the edge of the box is bravely blocked. The referee points to the corner flag and Liverpool will take a corner.
It is time for a substitution. Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) is on for Roberto Firmino.
Referee Anthony Taylor sees the trip by Didier Ndong (Sunderland) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. It's a penalty! What an opportunity to score for Liverpool.
James Milner (Liverpool) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
James Milner (Liverpool) confidently powers his spot-kick into the left side of the goal.
Substitution. Benjamin Woodburn (Liverpool) in, Georginio Wijnaldum out.
That's it for today, Anthony Taylor has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Goal! Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the net. He makes it 0:1.
Wayne Routledge (Swansea) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Kevin Friend ignores the protests.
Jack Cork (Swansea) sees a yellow card from Kevin Friend after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

That was a brilliant piece of goalkeeping! Lukasz Fabianski dived superbly to block the header from around the penalty spot, which was aimed straight towards the bottom left corner by Connor Wickham (Crystal Palace).

Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) struck with a perfectly taken free kick from the edge of the box. He curled the ball straight inside the left post. There are not enough superlatives that can be used to describe that goal.
Wayne Hennessey (Crystal Palace) is booked.
Modou Barrow (Swansea) misses a sitter from inside the six-yard box after striking the ball towards goal and it goes narrowly wide of the right post.
The end of the first half.
The second half has just started.
Alan Pardew is forced to make a change. Connor Wickham is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace).
Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Kevin Friend didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Wayne Routledge will be replaced by Fernando Llorente (Swansea).
Gylfi Sigurdsson takes the corner kick and sends over a fantastic cross to the edge of the penalty area. Leroy Fer (Swansea) jumps highest and plants a header into the goal. It's 2:1.
Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) is booked by the referee.
The foul by Martin Kelly (Crystal Palace) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Kevin Friend.
Goal! Leroy Fer (Swansea) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 3:1.
Kyle Naughton (Swansea) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Martin Kelly goes off the pitch and Zeki Fryers (Crystal Palace) comes on.
Goal! The rebound fell to James Tomkins (Crystal Palace) and he fired home from close range. The score is 3:2.
The manager makes a subsitution with Angel Rangel (Swansea) coming on for Modou Barrow.
Alan Pardew has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Bakary Sako (Crystal Palace) replacing James McArthur.
Goal! Jack Cork (Swansea) sent the ball towards his own goal in an attempt to intercept a pass.
GOAL! Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) got to the ball in front of the goal and he couldn't miss from there. His strike went in off the left-hand post. The score is 3:4.
A yellow card for a tackle by Jay Fulton (Swansea). Kevin Friend doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
That will be all from Kyle Naughton who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Jefferson Montero (Swansea).
Goal! Fernando Llorente (Swansea) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 4:4.
Fernando Llorente (Swansea) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
Kevin Friend shows the yellow card to Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) for a heavy challenge.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
What an absolute cracking goal! Dean Marney (Burnley) hits a perfect volley from far out and the ball flies inside the left post. Take a bow.
Dean Marney (Burnley) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Goal! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 1:1.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the left-hand post, but Paul Robinson was alert and the score remains the same. Now Manchester City have a corner.
Dean Marney is being substituted because of an injury. Sean Dyche sends Scott Arfield (Burnley) on the pitch.
Substitution. James Tarkowski (Burnley) in, Johann Gudmundsson out.
Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Substitution. Raheem Sterling is replaced by Leroy Sane (Manchester City).
Goal - 1:2! Fernandinho tees up Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) inside the box and he curls the ball into the right side of the net and past Paul Robinson.
Matthew Lowton (Burnley) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) violates the laws of the game and is shown a deserved yellow card by the referee.
Nolito (Manchester City) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Michael Keane (Burnley) plants a goal-bound header towards the right post after a nice cross inside the box, but one of the defenders reacts superbly and makes a timely interception.

Goal! Matt Phillips (West Brom) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot into the top of the net. He makes it 1:0.
Golden chance! Jeff Hendrick (Burnley) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
James Morrison (West Brom) doesn't hesitate to lash home from just outside the box. He hits the ball precisely into the bottom right corner and it nestles in the net.
Matt Phillips plays a terrific cross over to Darren Fletcher (West Brom), who finds some space inside the box and puts the ball into the back of the net.

Mike Jones blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Sean Dyche has decided to make a substitution during the half-time break. Ashley Barnes (Burnley) comes on the pitch for Steven Defour.

A yellow card for a tackle by Adam Clayton (Middlesbrough). Jonathan Moss doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Victor Moses (Chelsea) latches on to a pass inside the box and strikes the ball to the middle of the goal, but one of the defending players makes a goal-line clearance.

CHANCE! Pedro (Chelsea) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a sublime shot towards Victor Valdes, but the goalkeeper stands tall and produces an excellent save. The ball goes out for a corner. Chelsea can continue in their attacking effort.
Victor Valdes pulls off a great save to deny Pedro (Chelsea), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick low drive to the bottom left corner.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Alvaro Negredo (Middlesbrough), whose header flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Diego Costa (Chelsea) meets the well-taken corner kick and quickly shoots towards the goal. His effort goes into the bottom right corner. What a finish!
Alvaro Negredo (Middlesbrough) rises above the defence inside the box to power a fine header, but the goalkeeper is lucky as the ball flies narrowly wide of the right post.
The match has reached half-time.
The whistle blows and Jonathan Moss starts the second half.
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the net, but Victor Valdes is alert and denies him.
Pedro (Chelsea) gets to the rebound and shoots, but the effort is blocked.
Cesar Azpilicueta (Chelsea) has received a yellow card for his foul.
Gaston Ramirez (Middlesbrough) makes a yard for himself on the edge of the box and produces a poor effort that sails miles wide of the right post.

OFF THE BAR! Pedro (Chelsea) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the crossbar! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Today's referee Jonathan Moss rightly decides to book David Luiz (Chelsea) for his harsh tackle.

Ambitious effort from Victor Moses (Chelsea). He finds himself in a great position after collecting a precise pass inside the penalty area and goes for goal, but it never troubles the goalkeeper and flies well over the bar.

Thibaut Courtois pulls off a great save to deny Alvaro Negredo (Middlesbrough), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal. Middlesbrough force their opponents to concede a corner.

That's it for today, Jonathan Moss has blown his whistle and the game is over.

The assistant referee raises his flag and the referee blows his whistle. Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) puts the ball into the net, but he is flagged for offside.
Cheikhou Kouyate (West Ham) pounces on a loose ball from the corner kick and fires from the edge of the box. His brilliant effort smashes against the crossbar.
It's in the back of the net! Winston Reid puts the ball on a plate for Michail Antonio (West Ham), who has an easy finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 0:1.
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Michael Dean ignores the protests.
Mousa Dembele (Tottenham) attempts to discuss the decision with Michael Dean, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Michael Dean blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal! Harry Winks (Tottenham) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 1:1.
Kyle Walker (Tottenham) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Michael Dean didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.

Eric Dier (Tottenham) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Darren Randolph, who pulls off a comfortable save!

Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) is going to take the penalty!

Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) is rightly booked by the referee because it could not have been anything other than a yellow card.
Nolito (Manchester City) is given a fully deserved yellow card.

Excellent touch by Sergio Aguero (Manchester City)! He latches on to an inch-perfect pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the middle of the goal. The goalkeeper reacts superbly and makes a save.

Sadio Mane (Liverpool) has a good chance to score with a mid-range attempt after collecting a pass. He aims for the top right corner, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Fraser Forster. It will be a corner kick for Liverpool.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.

The whistle blows and Mark Clattenburg starts the second half.
What a big chance! Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball well wide of the left post.

Joel Matip (Liverpool) receives the ball inside the box from the resulting free kick, but fails to score as his shot is blocked by one of the defenders. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Liverpool.

Perfectly taken free kick!Junior Stanislas sends a cross in and Nathan Ake (Bournemouth) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes into the top of the net and the score changes to 0:1.

Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) is shown the yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee. It could have been worse!

That was a brilliant piece of goalkeeping! Adam Federici dived superbly to block the header from around the penalty spot, which was aimed straight towards the bottom left corner by Wilfried Bony (Stoke City).
Roger East blows his whistle after Phillip Bardsley (Stoke City) kicks an opponent's legs instead of the ball. Penalty awarded! Bournemouth will take a penalty kick.

Bojan Krkic (Stoke City) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.

Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the bottom left corner. Adam Federici shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.

Jack Wilshere (Bournemouth) accepts a sweet pass on the edge of the box and unleashes a shot towards the goal, but he only hits the left post! What an unlucky moment for him. The ball goes out of play and Stoke will have a goal kick.

Sam Clucas (Hull City) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Jordan Pickford makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the bottom right corner.
Papy Djilobodji (Sunderland) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Lee Mason had an easy-decision to make.

An amazing individual effort from Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) ends with a strike from inside the penalty area. He sends the ball precisely into the bottom left corner and makes it 1:0. David Marshall was helpless.
Victor Anichebe (Sunderland) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and bends his effort inches wide of the left post.
The end of the first half.

Everything seems to be alright after the game was interrupted, the referee blows his whistle and the match can continue.

Patrick van Aanholt produces a sweet pass and picks out Victor Anichebe (Sunderland) inside the box. He quickly takes a shot which goes into the bottom right corner and leaves the goalkeeper helpless. He makes it 1:0!
