Etienne Capoue (Watford) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes inside the left post. He couldn't have done it any better. 1:0.
Roberto Pereyra (Watford) takes a great first touch to control a killer pass on the edge of the box and curls the ball inside the right post in trademark fashion.

Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle for a foul after Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) hacks down one of his opponents. The referee uncompromisingly points to the spot and it's a penalty to Leicester.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) is going to take the penalty!
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) smartly converts the penalty into the top of the net. The spot kick is too good for the goalkeeper.
Camilo Zuniga (Watford) has tested the patience of referee Neil Swarbrick and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) receives a yellow card!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Neil Swarbrick has ended it.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Christian Fuchs (Leicester) was quite harsh and Neil Swarbrick didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Roberto Pereyra (Watford) meets a splendid cross on the edge of the 6-yard box and sends the ball towards the left post, forcing Ron-Robert Zieler into a superb diving save to keep it out.
Daniel Drinkwater (Leicester) picks up a yellow card.
Younes Kaboul (Watford) rises above the defence to meet a cross from the corner. His timing is good, but he directs his header just a few inches wide of the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Christian Fuchs leaves the pitch and Jeffery Schlupp (Leicester) comes on.
Claudio Ranieri has decided to substitute Shinji Okazaki and he is replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Marc Albrighton as he is replaced by Ahmed Musa (Leicester).
Demarai Gray (Leicester) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Adlene Guedioura (Watford) will replace Nordin Amrabat.
Walter Mazzarri prepares a substitution. Troy Deeney is replaced by Stefano Okaka (Watford).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) takes a shot from a mid-range free kick and the ball flies inches wide of the left post!
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) for his blatant foul.
Matteo Darmian (Manchester United) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.

Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the right post. Petr Cech pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed. The ball is out of play. Manchester Utd win a corner kick.

That was a nice football moment. Anthony Martial (Manchester United) receives an amazing defence-splitting low pass on the edge of the box and blasts the ball towards the roof of the net. Petr Cech guesses his intention and dives superbly to deny him with a remarkable save! Manchester Utd have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) comes onto the pitch for Anthony Martial.
Here is a change. Matteo Darmian is going off and Jose Mourinho gives the last tactical orders to Daley Blind (Manchester United).
Goal - 1:0! Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) tries his luck from the edge of the box and scores with an accurate shot inside the left post. Ander Herrera provided an assist for the goal.
Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) goes into the book and receives a yellow card.
A substitution has been made. Mohamed Elneny is replaced by Olivier Giroud (Arsenal).

What an opportunity! Marcos Rojo (Manchester United) squanders a huge opportunity as he latches on to a perfect cross from the wing. He produces a bullet header from around the penalty spot which goes just wide of the left post!
The game has come to an end for Francis Coquelin. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Granit Xhaka (Arsenal).
Arsene Wenger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) replacing Carl Jenkinson.
Substitution. Morgan Schneiderlin (Manchester United) on for Juan Manuel Mata.
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) is booked.

Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) rises high to head the ball into the left side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 1:1.
Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) picked up a yellow card for talking out of turn to the referee. He has to be careful for the remainder of the match.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.

Matt Phillips (West Brom) strikes a first-time shot towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper denies him with an excellent save. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to West Brom.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Claudio Ranieri gives a chance to Jamie Vardy (Leicester) and Shinji Okazaki is off.

Goal  0:1! Matt Phillips sends a precise lofted pass into the box, James Morrison (West Brom) rises above the defenders to meet the ball near the penalty spot and heads it straight into the left side of the goal.

Islam Slimani (Leicester) finds his way to the ball and finishes with a bullet header. Ben Foster couldn't do anything to stop his effort which was directed into the right side of the target and bounced in off the post. The score is 0:0.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Ahmed Musa trots off the pitch and is replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).
What a goal that is! Matt Phillips (West Brom) gets to the ball inside the box and brilliantly lifts the ball over Ron-Robert Zieler and into the net. 1:2.
The substitution is prepared. Craig Gardner (West Brom) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Matt Phillips.
Claudio Ranieri has decided to substitute Robert Huth and he is replaced by Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester).
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Craig Gardner (West Brom) is given a yellow card.
Chris Brunt (West Brom) is cautioned by the referee.
Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) joins the action as a substitute, replacing James Morrison.
That's it for today, Craig Pawson has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
What a big chance! Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Goal! Paul Pogba (Manchester United) picks up the ball from a rebound and from the edge of the box he unleashes a shot inside the right post. It's 0:1.
Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort misses the right post by a whisker.
Goal! Wayne Rooney tees up Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the bottom left corner. 0:2.

Goal! Wayne Rooney displays great vision and sends a pass to Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the top of the net. The score is 0:3.
The end of the first half.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Here is a change after the half-time break. Wayne Routledge is replaced by Modou Barrow (Swansea).
Bob Bradley makes a switch. Jefferson Montero (Swansea) is coming on in place of Fernando Llorente at the start of the second period.

Perfectly taken free kick! Gylfi Sigurdsson sends a cross in and Mike van der Hoorn (Swansea) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes inside the right post and he makes it 1:3.
That will be all from Leon Britton who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Leroy Fer (Swansea).
A yellow card for a tackle by Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United). Neil Swarbrick doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.
Chance! Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Wayne Rooney, but his shot from inside the box flashes inches wide of the right post.
Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Juan Manuel Mata will be replaced by Jesse Lingard (Manchester United).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Morgan Schneiderlin (Manchester United) for Wayne Rooney.
Here comes a substitution. Paul Pogba is given a rest as he is replaced by Timothy Fosu-Mensah (Manchester United).
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

Curtis Davies (Hull City) commits a minor foul to interrupt the attacking move of his opponent and is warned by the referee that he will get a yellow card if he does it again. It's a penalty for Southampton!
Charlie Austin (Southampton) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.
Charlie Austin (Southampton) scores from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Abel Hernandez is substituted due to injury. Mike Phelan gives a chance to Dieumerci Mbokani (Hull City).
Will Keane is being substituted because of an injury. Mike Phelan sends Robert Snodgrass (Hull City) on the pitch.
The foul by Dusan Tadic (Southampton) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Graham Scott.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
A cross from the corner kick arrives close to the penalty spot. Virgil van Dijk (Southampton) outjumps the defence, but his promising header bounces away off the bar!
Graham Scott shows a yellow card to Jordy Clasie (Southampton), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.

Sam Clucas passes to Robert Snodgrass (Hull City), who collects the ball and unleashes a terrific shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the bottom right corner. Fabulous goal! The score is 1:1.

Michael Dawson (Hull City) outjumps the defence in the centre of the box and connects with the free kick from Robert Snodgrass. He sends the ball into the top left corner with his towering header and alters the score to 0:1.
Substitution. Dusan Tadic leaves the pitch and is replaced by Sofiane Boufal (Southampton).
Ryan Bertrand (Southampton) sees a yellow! His tackle wasn't that harsh, but he probably talked himself into Graham Scott's book.
The substitution has been made. Tom Huddlestone (Hull City) has replaced Harry Maguire.
The manager makes a subsitution with Jay Rodriguez (Southampton) coming on for Nathan Redmond.
Claude Puel has decided to make a change. James Ward-Prowse (Southampton) replaces Jordy Clasie.
Graham Scott shows the yellow card to Maya Yoshida (Southampton) for a heavy challenge.

Charlie Austin (Southampton) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom right corner. David Marshall has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Oriol Romeu (Southampton) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Graham Scott didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Graham Scott is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

A cross following the corner kick finds its way to Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) inside the box and he manages to steer it to the left side of the target. He is about to start celebrating a goal, but Costel Pantilimon makes a save in the nick of time and maintains the current score.
Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) spurns a great opportunity from inside the 6-yard box. The ball flies narrowly wide of the left post.
Philippe Coutinho slides a brilliant pass into Roberto Firmino (Liverpool), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the right post.

James Milner (Liverpool) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Costel Pantilimon anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going into the bottom left corner.

The ball hits the back of the net! Philippe Coutinho showcases his brilliant technique and produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Sadio Mane (Liverpool) manages to convert it into a sweet goal. He heads it inside the right post and gets on the scoresheet  0:0.
What a stunner from just outside the box! Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) produces a perfect low drive into the middle of the goal.
Heurelho Gomes is substituted due to injury. Walter Mazzarri gives a chance to Costel Pantilimon (Watford).

A perfect lofted pass from Adam Lallana finds Emre Can (Liverpool), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the right side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Costel Pantilimon had no chance of stopping that. 2:0.

James Milner (Liverpool) was close to scoring from the resulting free kick. He unleashed a decent strike from the edge of the box towards the top left corner, but the goalkeeper made a great save to keep him out. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Liverpool.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Jose Holebas (Watford) is awarded a yellow card. The referee showed him no mercy.
Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) received a delightful pass inside the box before slotting the ball past the goalkeeper. What a brilliant finish!
Goal! Sadio Mane (Liverpool) finds himself some space inside the box to get on the end of a pass from Roberto Firmino, then sends the ball into the middle of the net. 5:0.
Valon Behrami comes off the pitch to be replaced by Ben Watson (Watford).
Jurgen Klopp prepares a substitution. Sadio Mane is replaced by Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool).
Etienne Capoue (Watford) gets to the rebound on the edge of the penalty area and fires a shot towards the right side of the goal, but Loris Karius gets a hand to it and keeps it out.
That will be all from Adam Lallana who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool).

Etienne Capoue (Watford) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
Daryl Janmaat (Watford) receives a well-taken defence-splitting pass inside the box and scores! He buries the ball into the bottom left corner.
Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) fires a shot from close range, but he is somehow only able to hit the crossbar!
The referee gives a yellow card to Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford).

Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) runs with the ball towards the keeper and pulls the trigger from close range, but Costel Pantilimon anticipates his intention and makes an amazing save to stop the shot going low into the middle of the target.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Camilo Zuniga (Watford) comes onto the pitch for Roberto Pereyra.
Jurgen Klopp decides to make a substitution. Philippe Coutinho will be replaced by Oviemuno Ejaria (Liverpool).
Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) gets a shot from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the crossbar!
Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) is booked by the referee.
Goal! Georginio Wijnaldum (Liverpool) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 6:1.
That's all for today as the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Today's referee Mark Clattenburg rightly decides to book Kevin Wimmer (Tottenham) for his harsh tackle.
Christian Eriksen clips a neat ball into the box towards Harry Kane (Tottenham), whose header from the centre of the box goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) latches on to a precise pass and finds himself one-on-one with the keeper, but his effort is straight at Hugo Lloris, who is alert and makes an easy save to deny him.
Theo Walcott (Arsenal) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the right post! What an opportunity that was!
OWN GOAL! The free kick is whipped in and Kevin Wimmer (Tottenham) is unlucky enough to head the ball into his own net. 1:0.
The end of the first half.
Referee Mark Clattenburg blows his whistle to start the second half.
Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) is penalised after knocking an opponent down. Tottenham are awarded a penalty kick!
Harry Kane (Tottenham) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Harry Kane (Tottenham) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Petr Cech to move before rolling the ball into the middle of the goal!
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) is coming onto the pitch as Francis Coquelin cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) sees a yellow card from Mark Clattenburg after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Substitution. Alex Iwobi will be replaced by Olivier Giroud (Arsenal).
Arsene Wenger decides to make a substitution. Theo Walcott will be replaced by Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal).
Aaron Ramsey (Arsenal) pounced on a rebound on the edge of the box and his shot goes a whisker over the crossbar.
Substitution. Vincent Janssen (Tottenham) in, Harry Kane out.
Eric Dier (Tottenham) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Mark Clattenburg ignores the protests.

Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) received a pass inside the box and sent a dangerous shot in on goal, but keep the champagne on ice as one of the defenders stepped in and blocked the effort. It's hard to say whether the keeper would have stopped it.
Kieran Trippier (Tottenham) comes onto the pitch because Kyle Walker simply cannot continue any longer after picking up an injury.
Substitution. Heung-Min Son is replaced by Harry Winks (Tottenham).
Vincent Janssen (Tottenham) gets on the end of a pass and produces a promising first-time shot at goal. His effort is blocked by Petr Cech with a brilliant diving save!
That's it for today, Mark Clattenburg has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Robert Madley shows a yellow card to Yannick Bolasie (Everton) for a tough tackle.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) dribbles into the box and drills a low shot into the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper had no chance. Sensational solo goal.
Marcos Alonso (Chelsea) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and nets low into the middle of the goal.
The main referee, Robert Madley, is apparently not going to tolerate any discussions. Phil Jagielka (Everton) is given a yellow card for dissent.
Victor Moses (Chelsea) gathers a cross inside the box and strikes the ball. He wastes a great scoring opportunity as his shot only hits the right-hand post.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Bryan Oviedo as he is replaced by Kevin Mirallas (Everton).
Goal! The resulting corner is whipped into the box and Diego Costa (Chelsea) buries the ball into the back of the net from a Nemanja Matic knock down. 3:0.
A brilliant individual effort! Diego Costa (Chelsea) tricks his way past challenges into the box and drags his shot narrowly wide of the right post.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The game restarts for the second half.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Maarten Stekelenburg with a strike into the bottom right corner. He makes it 4:0.
Substitution. Aaron Lennon (Everton) on for Yannick Bolasie.

Maarten Stekelenburg gets a well deserved ovation! Diego Costa (Chelsea) produces a decent first-time strike towards the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper is positioned well to block it. Nice goalkeeping skills.
Gareth Barry (Everton) sees a yellow card from Robert Madley after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a sitter. His shot was directed towards the right post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
Goal! Pedro (Chelsea) was in the right place at the right time to pounce on the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball home. It's 5:0.
The substitution has been made. Tom Davies (Everton) has replaced Gareth Barry.
Substitution. Pedro did his best and is replaced by  Oscar (Chelsea).
Substitution. Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea) replaces Eden Hazard.

David Luiz (Chelsea) misses a big chance from point-blank range as he struck the ball towards the crossbar. His promising effort following the corner kick was, to his disappointment, thwarted by Maarten Stekelenburg with a fabulous save. The ball goes out for a corner. Chelsea can continue in their attacking effort.
That will be all from Gary Cahill who is being replaced by the fresh legs of John Terry (Chelsea).
That's it for today, Robert Madley has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.
Harry Arter (Bournemouth) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
It's in the back of the net! Adam Smith plays it into the box, and Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) gets on the end of the cross to put it into the middle of the net. 1:0.

Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and releases a promising effort. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies painfully close to the right post. The ball goes out of play and Sunderland will have a goal kick.

Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Artur Boruc, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Joshua King (Bournemouth) picks up a pass and unleashes a strong shot from inside the box, but the goalkeeper is equal to it!
Joshua King (Bournemouth) goes into the book for a horrible tackle. A yellow card is necessary in this case.
Victor Anichebe (Sunderland) latches on to a precise pass inside the penalty box and produces a sweet strike that beats the goalkeeper as it goes inside the top left corner, bouncing in off the post.

Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom right corner. Artur Boruc has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. Sunderland have been awarded a corner kick.
Steven Pienaar (Sunderland) makes a bad challenge on his opponent and is booked by the referee.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The substitution has been made. Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) has replaced Jordon Ibe.

Didier Ndong (Sunderland) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the top right corner. Artur Boruc has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save.
Steven Pienaar (Sunderland) should have been more careful. He commits a bad foul, receives his second yellow card and is sent-off!
Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the right post! What an opportunity that was!
Golden chance! Jack Wilshere (Bournemouth) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the right post.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Victor Anichebe (Sunderland) was quite harsh and Michael Dean didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Paddy McNair walks off the pitch to be replaced by Jason Denayer (Sunderland).
Adam Smith (Bournemouth) trips an opposition player and Michael Dean signals a foul. No point in arguing there. Sunderland will take a penalty kick.
Adam Smith (Bournemouth) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Dean had an easy-decision to make.
Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) leaves the keeper helpless with his precise penalty shot into the top right corner.

Golden chance! Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) meets a cross in the box and finds some space for a shot. He produces an inaccurate effort that goes wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Sunderland will have a goal kick.
Substitution. Lys Mousset (Bournemouth) on for Harry Arter.
Eddie Howe has decided to make a change. Ryan Fraser (Bournemouth) replaces Junior Stanislas.

Benik Afobe (Bournemouth) stands over the resultant free kick from mid-range, but his shot goes just over the crossbar. It could have been a fantastic goal! The ball goes out of play and Sunderland will have a goal kick.

Joshua King (Bournemouth) latched on to an accurate pass just outside the box and immediately lashed the ball towards the top left corner. His effort was thwarted by Jordan Pickford, who pulled off a stunning save. Bournemouth have a corner.
It is time for a substitution. Donald Love (Sunderland) is on for Duncan Watmore.
Here comes a substitution. Lynden Gooch (Sunderland) is brought on as a substitute for Jermain Defoe.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Lynden Gooch (Sunderland) for his blatant foul.
The match has just finished.
The first half has just begun.
Matthew Lowton (Burnley) gathers a nice lofted pass deep inside the box and attempts to put the ball low into the middle of the goal, but his shot is deflected away by one of the defending players.
Goal! Sam Vokes (Burnley) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 1:0.
Dean Marney (Burnley) has tested the patience of referee Anthony Taylor and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) picks up the rebound after chaos in the box and directs a sweet strike towards the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper, however, denies him with a stunning save.

Stunning strike! Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley) latches on to a precise through ball from Sam Vokes and surprises the goalkeeper with a low shot from the edge of the box that goes into the middle of the goal. The score is now 2:0.

Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Anthony Taylor blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Sam Vokes (Burnley) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.
Wilfried Zaha feeds the ball through to Connor Wickham (Crystal Palace), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the top right corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 2:0!
James McArthur (Crystal Palace) picks up a yellow card.
The substitution is prepared. Connor Wickham (Crystal Palace) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Jason Puncheon.
Here is a change. Martin Kelly is going off and Alan Pardew gives the last tactical orders to Zeki Fryers (Crystal Palace).
Sean Dyche has decided to introduce fresh legs, with George Boyd (Burnley) replacing Scott Arfield.
That will be all from Steven Defour who is being replaced by the fresh legs of James Tarkowski (Burnley).
Anthony Taylor shows a yellow card to Damien Delaney (Crystal Palace) for his blatant foul.
Matthew Lowton (Burnley) handles the ball inside the box. PENALTY! Wonderful opportunity to score for Crystal Palace.
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) is going to take the penalty!
Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after firing the ball into the bottom left corner of the goal to give the goalkeeper no chance!
Substitution. Jeff Hendrick leaves the pitch and is replaced by Ashley Barnes (Burnley).
Alan Pardew prepares a substitution. James McArthur is replaced by Joe Ledley (Crystal Palace).

It's in the back of the net! Superb finishing from Ashley Barnes (Burnley). Johann Gudmundsson plays a fantastic through ball and finds Ashley Barnes (Burnley), who reacts quickly to get in front of the goalkeeper and fire a close-range shot into the roof of the net. It's now 3:2.

What a great touch by Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace)! He picks up a precise pass on the edge of the box and immediately unleashes a shot on goal. His effort, however, only rattles the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.
That's it for today, Anthony Taylor has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Today's referee Kevin Friend rightly decides to book Adam Forshaw (Middlesbrough) for his harsh tackle.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) receives a precise pass inside the box and takes a shot that flies just wide of the right post.

Victor Valdes can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Sergio Aguero (Manchester City). The ball would have probably ended up inside the left post.
David Silva (Manchester City) has a sight of goal and shoots towards the right post, but the goalkeeper makes a superb save.

What a goal-scoring opportunity! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) makes a good run into the box to meet a cross and fires the ball in on goal, but the shot is amazingly blocked by a defender. Manchester City have been awarded a corner kick.

Kevin De Bruyne sends a precise lofted cross into the box. Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) latches on to it and finishes with a quick shot inside the right post. The goalkeeper had no chance. The score changes to 1:0.
The match has reached half-time.
Kevin Friend blows his whistle and the second half starts.
Adam Forshaw (Middlesbrough) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Claudio Bravo.
Adam Clayton (Middlesbrough) sees a yellow card from Kevin Friend after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) meets a cross from Kevin De Bruyne, but he cannot keep his header on target. It goes high over the crossbar.
That's the end of the game for Ilkay Gundogan, who is replaced by Nolito (Manchester City).
Aitor Karanka de la Hoz decides to make a substitution. Stewart Downing will be replaced by Viktor Fischer (Middlesbrough).
Chance! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) comes within inches of scoring after picking up a pass from Jesus Navas, but his shot from inside the box flashes just over the bar.
Substitution. Jesus Navas leaves the pitch and is replaced by Aleix Garcia (Manchester City).
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) is booked for saying more than Kevin Friend was willing to tolerate.
The referee Kevin Friend awards Marten de Roon (Middlesbrough) a yellow card.
Substitution. Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) has come on for Sergio Aguero.

A perfect lofted pass from George Friend finds Marten de Roon (Middlesbrough), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header to the middle in the countermovement of the keeper. His effort was both strong and precise, and Claudio Bravo had no chance of stopping that. 1:0.
Aitor Karanka de la Hoz has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Christian Stuani (Middlesbrough) replacing Adama Traore.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.

CHANCE! Shkodran Mustafi (Arsenal) rises high to meet the resultant corner kick and attempts to steer his fine header past the goalkeeper, but only hits the crossbar! The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Swansea.
Leroy Fer (Swansea) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and has an effort on goal. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies inches high over the bar.
The ball finds its way to Theo Walcott (Arsenal) after a confusing situation inside the goalmouth. He finds some space and easily knocks the ball in with his body and alters the score to 0:0.
Theo Walcott (Arsenal) scores from the corner kick. The ball slipped through the box to Theo Walcott (Arsenal) and he slotted it past the goalkeeper.
GOAL! Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 2:1.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half gets underway.
Neil Taylor (Swansea) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Jonathan Moss had an easy-decision to make.
Goal! Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) shows good awareness inside the box as he latches on to a brilliant pass and fires a first-time shot into the top left corner. Alexis Sanchez assisted in the goal. 2:1.
It will be a substitution. Borja Baston (Swansea) is ready to enter the pitch as Leon Britton walks off.
Goal - 3:2! Modou Barrow laid the ball off to Borja Baston (Swansea), who shot from close range low into the back of the net, leaving the goalkeeper helpless.
Substitution. Alex Iwobi will be replaced by Francis Coquelin (Arsenal).

It's a foul from Granit Xhaka (Arsenal). Surprisingly, the referee comes and pulls out a red card. It was a very harsh one and Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) complains, but it's no use of course. The decision has been made.
The substitution is prepared. Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Jack Cork.

Petr Cech doesn't have to worry about this one. Modou Barrow plays a pass into the feet of Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea), who is unable to find the target as his effort from inside the box goes high over the bar.
Substitution. Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain (Arsenal) on for Alexis Sanchez.
Arsene Wenger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Kieran Gibbs (Arsenal) replacing Mesut Ozil.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Modou Barrow walks off the pitch to be replaced by Angel Rangel (Swansea).

OFF THE POST! Theo Walcott (Arsenal) runs towards the goal to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from the edge of the box, but it crashes against the right post. It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Leroy Fer (Swansea) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the middle of the goal. His effort, however, is blocked by Petr Cech, who pulls off a comfortable save!
What a save from Petr Cech! Federico Fernandez (Swansea) jumps high to meet a cross and glances a promising header from close range, but the goalkeeper pulls off a brilliant stop to keep it out.

Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) bursts inside the box, beats two defenders and produces a strike from the penalty spot. The shot has power, but lacks precision and the goalkeeper stops it easily. The scoreline remains the same.
CHANCE! Theo Walcott (Arsenal) fires just over the crossbar from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) decides to have a direct shot at goal from the free kick, but the ball hits the right post.
Goal! Charlie Daniels (Bournemouth) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 1:0.
Lee Mason shows a yellow card to Sam Clucas (Hull City) for his blatant foul.
Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) received a precise low pass and immediately unleashed a shot on goal. His attempt lacked a few centimetres to make it home as it crashed against the crossbar!
Close! Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth) unleashes a rocket of a shot from the edge of the box and his shot flies just a few inches over the crossbar.
Goal! Ryan Mason (Hull City) collected a pass and decided to try his luck from distance. The shot was deflected and it was enough to turn the ball past helpless Artur Boruc. 1:1.

Perfectly taken free kick! Junior Stanislas sends a cross in and Steve Cook (Bournemouth) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes inside the right post and he makes it 2:1.
Robert Snodgrass (Hull City) fouls an opponent. At least that's what referee Lee Mason signals. It's a penalty! What an opportunity to score for Bournemouth.
Robert Snodgrass (Hull City) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Lee Mason had an easy-decision to make.
Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) converts the spot kick with a blast into the roof of the net.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Lee Mason has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
The manager makes a subsitution with Tom Huddlestone (Hull City) coming on for Shaun Maloney.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Andrew Robertson (Hull City) was quite harsh and Lee Mason didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee allows time for a substitution. Jordon Ibe will be replaced by Joshua King (Bournemouth).
The manager has been forced to make a substitution and the injured Andrew Robertson leaves the pitch to be replaced by Adama Diomande (Hull City).
Goal! Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) scores after an assist by Adam Smith that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 4:1.
That's the end of the game for Ryan Mason, who is replaced by David Meyler (Hull City).
Eddie Howe has decided to substitute Jack Wilshere and he is replaced by Dan Gosling (Bournemouth).

A perfect lofted pass from Joshua King finds Callum Wilson (Bournemouth), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the left side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and David Marshall had no chance of stopping that. 4:1.
Eddie Howe decides to make a substitution. Callum Wilson will be replaced by Benik Afobe (Bournemouth).

Brilliant finish! Dan Gosling (Bournemouth) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Charlie Daniels, then produced a nice strike into the left side of the goal. The score is 6:1.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half has started.
Kevin De Bruyne picks out David Silva (Manchester City), who drives a shot just over the crossbar from the edge of the box.
Phil Jagielka (Everton) is penalised after knocking an opponent down. PENALTY to Manchester City!
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) will take the responsibility and he is already preparing the ball.

Penalty saved! Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) sends the penalty towards the right hand side of the goal, but Maarten Stekelenburg pulls off a wonderful save to deny him. Manchester City force a corner. They send men into the box.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Michael Oliver blows his whistle to start the second half.

Gerard Deulofeu (Everton) had a good opportunity from long range. His shot was directed under the crossbar, but Claudio Bravo was alert and made a comfortable save. The referee and one of his assistants signal for a corner kick to Everton.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Kelechi Iheanacho departs the field of play to be replaced by Sergio Aguero (Manchester City).
Ronald Koeman has decided to make a change. James McCarthy (Everton) replaces Gerard Deulofeu.
Romelu Lukaku (Everton) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Claudio Bravo with a strike into the right side of the goal. He makes it 0:1.

Phil Jagielka (Everton) trips an opposition player and Michael Oliver signals a foul. PENALTY to Manchester City! Almost the entire opposition team is gathered around the referee and complaining. However, the decision has been made and it's final.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) places the ball on the penalty spot and sends it towards the right post. His effort isn't powerful enough, allowing Maarten Stekelenburg to dive and keep the ball out with an excellent save.
Pep Guardiola has decided to substitute Leroy Sane and he is replaced by Nolito (Manchester City).

Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) had a good chance to change the score. He ran towards the goal and unleashed a shot from just outside the penalty area which went towards the top left corner, but the goalkeeper was ready and made an amazing save. The referee points to the corner flag and Manchester City will take a corner.

David Silva sends a superb cross into the box. Nolito (Manchester City) latches on to it and from close range plants a header into the bottom left corner, leaving Maarten Stekelenburg beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:1.
The referee has issued a yellow card to Seamus Coleman (Everton).
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) decided to surprise the goalkeeper with a quick shot from the edge of the box, but his effort came back off the right post!
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Yannick Bolasie walks off the pitch to be replaced by Kevin Mirallas (Everton).
Michael Oliver shows a yellow card to Ashley Williams (Everton) for a tough tackle.
Here is a change. Ilkay Gundogan is going off and Pep Guardiola gives the last tactical orders to Vincent Kompany (Manchester City).
The manager makes a subsitution with Ramiro Mori (Everton) coming on for Tom Cleverley.
The match has just finished.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

It's a goal! Joe Allen (Stoke City) makes it 1:0. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Marko Arnautovic and planted his close-range header low into the middle of the goal. Jordan Pickford was helpless.
David William Moyes is forced to make a change. Patrick van Aanholt is unable to continue due to injury, Billy Jones (Sunderland) comes on.

The game restarts for the second half.

The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) comes onto the pitch for Phillip Bardsley.

A substitution has been made. Wilfried Bony is replaced by Jonathan Walters (Stoke City).

That was absolutely fantastic! Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) tries his luck with a hammer shot from long range, but his effort only rattles the crossbar! Here is an example of luck not being on your side.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Billy Jones (Sunderland) was quite harsh and Mike Jones didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
James McClean (West Brom) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) produces a decent strike goalwards from the resulting set piece. His effort crashes against the crossbar and the ball stays out of the net. The goalkeeper was quite lucky!

Victor Moses (Chelsea) picks up a pass and hits the ball towards the bottom right corner, but he can't generate enough power to trouble Kasper Schmeichel. Chelsea get a corner.
The ball slips through the box from the corner and Diego Costa (Chelsea) is standing in the right place to hit it with an accurate shot inside the left post.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Robert Huth (Leicester) was quite harsh and Andre Marriner didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
David Luiz (Chelsea) lashes in a mid-range free kick and his effort crashes against the left post. That was an excellent shot, but unfortunately for him it didn't end up in the back of the net.

Victor Moses (Chelsea) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the left post is blocked by Kasper Schmeichel, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.

Nemanja Matic (Chelsea) wasted a huge opportunity! The fans already began to celebrate as he produced a shot from the edge of the box after a brilliant solo effort. The ball went towards the right side of the goal, but Kasper Schmeichel made an astonishing save! Chelsea earn a corner.

Goal! Nathaniel Chalobah plays in Victor Moses (Chelsea), who shows great determination to get to the ball before a couple of defenders. He shoots from inside the box into the right side of the net! Great finish - 3:0.

Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) picks up a rebound inside the penalty area and drills a shot to the bottom right corner, but is denied by a reflex save from Tom Heaton.

Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley) attempts to convert a cross into a goal, but his promising header from near the penalty spot towards the left post is denied by a decent save from Petr Cech. Burnley force their opponents to concede a corner.

Good team movement sets up Theo Walcott (Arsenal) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.

Charlie Austin (Southampton) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the penalty spot wasn't accurate enough and the ball bounced away off the left post!

The game is interrupted. Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) is given a yellow card. He has to be more careful now.

Nathan Redmond (Southampton) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a low shot in the direction of the right post. Kasper Schmeichel is alert and denies him with a nice save.

Charlie Austin (Southampton) tries his luck with a long-range effort after receiving a precise pass. It goes to the roof of the net, but Kasper Schmeichel has a clear view of it and makes a comfortable save.

Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) makes a bad challenge and receives a yellow card. The referee had no doubt.

It must be a yellow card. It is. Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
Heung-Min Son feeds the ball through to Dele Alli (Tottenham), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 1:0!

A dangerous towering header by Paul Pogba (Manchester United) from around the penalty spot goes just wide of the left post. This corner kick didn't change the score.

Nordin Amrabat (Watford) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and releases it under the roof. Unfortunately for him, Artur Boruc makes a great save to stop his effort. Well-positioned Nordin Amrabat (Watford) was first to the rebound and fired in a shot towards the right post, but Artur Boruc reacted superbly to keep the ball out. The fans could not believe their eyes. It was a miraculous stop! It will be a corner kick for Watford.

Troy Deeney (Watford) with a wonderful piece of finishing. He makes a yard for himself after a well-taken pass inside the box and nets into the middle of the goal.

handles the ball inside the box. Liverpool are awarded a penalty kick!
