David William Moyes has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Victor Anichebe (Sunderland) replacing Adnan Januzaj.
The substitution is prepared. Paddy McNair (Sunderland) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Lee Cattermole.
What a huge chance for Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace). He collects a precise pass inside the box and slices a shot that goes a whisker wide of the left post.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace) comes onto the pitch so that Jason Puncheon can be given a rest.

Superbly taken set piece! Chung-Yong Lee takes the free kick and sends a cross into the six-yard box. Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) flicks the ball lightly with his head towards the top of the net. Jordan Pickford can't react quickly enough and the score changes to 2:3.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Bacary Sagna feeds the ball through to Sergio Aguero (Manchester City), who picks up the pass inside the box and quickly sends it into the bottom left corner! The goalkeeper was helpless. 0:1!
A wonderful cross found Fernando Llorente (Swansea) in the box who shows good control of the ball and sends it inside the right post.
What a chance that is! Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) finds himself in a promising position after receiving a pass on the edge of the box. His attempt goes just over the bar.
Neil Swarbrick shows the yellow card to Bacary Sagna (Manchester City) for a heavy challenge.
Sergio Aguero links up with Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City), who fires just wide of the left post from the edge of the box.
Fernandinho (Manchester City) has too much to say to the referee and receives a caution.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Referee Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle to start the second half.
What a chance for Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) as he produced a stunning snap shot from the edge of the box! The goalkeeper was a bit lucky as the ball goes inches over the crossbar.
Jordi Amat (Swansea) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Neil Swarbrick didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
What a great touch by Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom right corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.
Mike van der Hoorn (Swansea) was too forceful with his tackle and Neil Swarbrick interrupted the game to signal a free kick. It's a penalty! Great chance to score for Manchester City!
Mike van der Hoorn (Swansea) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) is going to take the penalty!
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) steps up to take the penalty and converts it with a shot into the roof of the net.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Ilkay Gundogan as he is replaced by Fernando (Manchester City).
Fernandinho (Manchester City) receives a precise pass on the edge of the box and has an effort on goal. Unfortunately for him, his strike flies inches high over the bar.
Here comes a substitution. Modou Barrow (Swansea) is brought on as a substitute for Wayne Routledge.
Francesco Guidolin decides to make a substitution. Jack Cork will be replaced by Sung-Yong Ki (Swansea).
Fernandinho (Manchester City) connects with the corner kick around the penalty spot, but steers his header just wide of the right post.
Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) makes a great solo run and pulls the trigger from inside the box, beating Lukasz Fabianski with a strike into the bottom left corner. He makes it 1:3.
The referee gives a yellow card to Raheem Sterling (Manchester City).
Substitution. Pablo Zabaleta (Manchester City) has come on for Bacary Sagna.
Francesco Guidolin has decided to substitute Leon Britton and he is replaced by Borja Baston (Swansea).
Substitution. Kevin De Bruyne makes his way off the pitch and Jesus Navas (Manchester City) comes on as his replacement.
Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) has tested the patience of referee Neil Swarbrick and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Neil Swarbrick is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Gooal! Daley Blind takes over corner duties. Chris Smalling (Manchester United) gets his head on the ball from the corner and puts it into the right side of the net. 1:0.
Zlatan Ibrahimovic sprays a pass out to Marcus Rashford (Manchester United), but he produces a poor effort from inside the box which goes well wide of the right post.
Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.

Paul Pogba (Manchester United) receives a pass and tries his luck with a shot from 25 metres out. Ron-Robert Zieler pulls off a decent save to stop the effort going in the top left corner. The linesman points to the corner flag, Manchester Utd are going to take it.
Goal! Jesse Lingard slips it to Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) on the edge of the box and he finds the left side of the net with a great effort. The score is 2:0.
Goal! Juan Manuel Mata puts the ball on a plate for Marcus Rashford (Manchester United), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 3:0.
Daley Blind takes over corner duties and expertly finds Paul Pogba (Manchester United), who jumps highest and coolly plants a bullet header into the right side of the goal. The score is now 4:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The need to improve in the second half has brought about a change. Riyad Mahrez comes off for Andy King (Leicester).
Claudio Ranieri has made a change at the break. Demarai Gray (Leicester) has come on in place of Jamie Vardy.
Today's referee Michael Dean rightly decides to book Robert Huth (Leicester) for his harsh tackle.

Demarai Gray (Leicester) scores a splendid goal as he finishes his great individual effort with a venomous shot from around 21 metres out into the top right corner. Take a bow son. The score is now 4:1.
Here's the change. Marc Albrighton leaves the pitch and Jeffery Schlupp (Leicester) comes on as a substitute.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) latches on to a precise defence-splitting pass and fires a nice strike from a promising distance towards the bottom right corner. Ron-Robert Zieler has a clear sight of it and makes a comfortable save. The ball goes out of play. Manchester Utd are awarded a corner kick.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Danny Simpson (Leicester), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Michael Carrick (Manchester United) comes onto the pitch so that Jesse Lingard can be given a rest.
Jose Mourinho has decided to make a change. Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) replaces Marcus Rashford.
A substitution has been made. Juan Manuel Mata is replaced by Ashley Young (Manchester United).
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
The first half has just begun.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.

Harry Kane (Tottenham) came close to scoring. He connected with a pass inside the box and perhaps should have done better than direct his shot straight at Jordan Pickford. The referee points to the corner flag. It's a corner to Tottenham.

Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) holds his head in his hands after wasting a promising chance. He latches onto a rebound, creates some space for himself and fires the ball from the edge of the box well wide of the left post.
Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) creates a good chance for himself and goes for goal from mid-range, but he fails to change the score as his effort deflects away off the left post.
Steven Pienaar (Sunderland) collects a brilliant pass inside the box and finds himself in a goal scoring opportunity. He takes a shot, but the effort is well blocked by one of the defending players.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Javier Manquillo (Sunderland) was quite harsh and Michael Dean didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.

Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the top left corner is blocked by Jordan Pickford, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Michael Dean shows a yellow card to Jason Denayer (Sunderland) for his blatant foul. Tottenham have been awarded a free kick.
Goal! Harry Kane (Tottenham) is quickest to react to the rebound and stabs the ball into the back of the net. It's 1:0.
Lee Cattermole (Sunderland) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Dean had an easy-decision to make.
The referee signals a substitution. Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) is brought on as a substitute for Steven Pienaar.
Didier Ndong (Sunderland) has tested the patience of referee Michael Dean and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.

Jordan Pickford makes a brilliant save! Dele Alli (Tottenham) easily weaves through the defence and fires the ball from mid-range. His effort goes towards the bottom right corner but is saved by the keeper! The ball goes out for a corner. Tottenham can continue in their attacking effort.
Eric Dier (Tottenham) misses the left post by a whisker with a mid-range rebound. What a chance that was!
Today's match ends for Mousa Dembele who will be replaced by Erik Lamela (Tottenham).
Mauricio Pochettino prepares a substitution. Eric Dier is replaced by Ben Davies (Tottenham).
Substitution. Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Jan Kirchhoff walks off.
Adnan Januzaj (Sunderland) is awarded a yellow card for his behaviour.
Ben Davies (Tottenham) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
What a chance that is! Erik Lamela (Tottenham) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
Mauricio Pochettino is forced to make an unplanned substitution as Harry Kane suffers an injury and Vincent Janssen (Tottenham) comes on.
Michael Dean blows his whistle and Adnan Januzaj (Sunderland) is shown a second yellow card for his foul. His manager will not be pleased. He has lot of time to think about it as he walks off.
Papy Djilobodji (Sunderland) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card. A free kick to Tottenham.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jason Denayer departs the field of play to be replaced by Paddy McNair (Sunderland).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.
Andros Townsend sends a cross in from the free kick. James Tomkins (Crystal Palace) wins the ball and smashes it into the bottom left corner, increasing the score to 1:0.

Goal! Jason Puncheon sent a fine cross from the corner kick. The perfect pass found Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) and his bullet header from around the penalty spot went straight into the left side of the goal. The score is 2:0.
Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Shay Given to dive and make a save.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Craig Pawson has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
Alan Pardew makes a switch. Damien Delaney (Crystal Palace) is coming on in place of James Tomkins at the start of the second period.
Scott Dann (Crystal Palace) peeled away from his marker and got on the end of the corner, but his fine header towards the left post is brilliantly saved by the diving goalkeeper.
James McArthur (Crystal Palace) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar. The ball is out of play. A goal-scoring opportunity from a corner for Crystal Palace.
A substitution has been made. Bojan Krkic is replaced by Mame Diouf (Stoke City).
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) is booked.
James McArthur (Crystal Palace) latches on to a superb pass and breaks through the defence before firing a shot from mid-range that goes past the goalkeeper inside the left post.

Goal! Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) weaves his way past opponents, and he unleashes a magnificent effort from the edge of the box into the bottom right corner. Shay Given had no chance of reaching it. The score is 4:0.
Jason Puncheon (Crystal Palace) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Joe Ledley walks off the pitch to be replaced by Mathieu Flamini (Crystal Palace).
Mame Diouf (Stoke City) timed his run perfectly to connect with the resulting corner kick, but his finish from around the penalty spot was rather poor as it went way over the bar.
The manager makes a subsitution with Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace) coming on for Andros Townsend.
Jonathan Walters (Stoke City) receives a lofted pass from the side and shoots from around the penalty spot, but the ball flies slightly wide, almost brushing the left-hand post.

The ball rebounds and arrives at the feet of Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) just outside the box. He doesn't think twice and fires a great shot into the bottom right corner. His attempt was beyond the reach of Steve Mandanda, so the score changes to 4:0.
The match has just finished.
The first half of this match is about to start.
Unbelievable miss! Leroy Fer (Swansea) reacts superbly to latch on to a rebound, but he blazes the ball high over the crossbar!

Shane Long (Southampton) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the bottom right corner is blocked by Lukasz Fabianski, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.
Great ball in from Shane Long. Steven Davis (Southampton) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker over the crossbar.
Virgil Van Dijk (Southampton) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the bottom left corner is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper.
Shane Long (Southampton) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
Dusan Tadic slides a brilliant pass into Nathan Redmond (Southampton), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker over the crossbar.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Stephen Kingsley is replaced by Angel Rangel (Swansea).
Shane Long (Southampton) is the one to unleash a good effort towards the bottom right corner. His shot, however, is saved by the goalkeeper. What a save!
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Shane Long (Southampton) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Shane Long goes off the pitch and Charlie Austin (Southampton) comes on.
Claude Puel has decided to substitute Jordy Clasie and he is replaced by Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton).
Great ball in from Ryan Bertrand. Charlie Austin (Southampton) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the right post.
Dusan Tadic sends over an inswinging corner and Oriol Romeu (Southampton) gets his head on the ball, but it goes just over the bar.

OFF THE BAR! Charlie Austin (Southampton) drifts into the box to give his teammate support. He receives a fantastic pass and shoots from close range, but it crashes against the crossbar! It could have been a brilliant goal, unlucky.
Goal! Charlie Austin (Southampton) fires the rebound into the top right corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:0.
Substitution. Jefferson Montero (Swansea) has come on for Sung-Yong Ki.
Substitution. Dusan Tadic makes his way off the pitch and Cuco Martina (Southampton) comes on as his replacement.
Here is a change. Jack Cork is going off and Francesco Guidolin gives the last tactical orders to Borja Baston (Swansea).

Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Kyle Naughton (Swansea) was quite harsh and Mike Jones didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The match has just started.

Sebastian Prodl (Watford) wastes a great chance as he climbs high around the penalty spot to connect with a cross from the resulting free kick. He produces a header which goes just wide of the left post.
Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) blows a clear opportunity! He sends a rebound from close range narrowly wide of the left post.
Crossbar! Paul Pogba (Manchester United) picks up a precise pass and produces a bullet of a strike from distance that smashes against the crossbar. It could have been a brilliant goal.
Goal! Some very poor defending from the opponent allows Etienne Capoue (Watford) the chance to get to the edge of the box and he makes no mistake with a lovely finish. It's 1:0.
Jose Mourinho is forced to make a change. Anthony Martial is not able to carry on due to injury. He is replaced by Ashley Young (Manchester United).
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
Michael Oliver blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Nordin Amrabat (Watford) comes onto the pitch so that Daryl Janmaat can be given a rest.
Substitution. Antonio Valencia will be replaced by Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United).
Goal! Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) fires the rebound into the bottom left corner after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
Whoa! Such gestures are commonly penalised and Paul Pogba (Manchester United) duly receives a yellow card.
Miguel Angel Britos Cabrera (Watford) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Michael Oliver had an easy-decision to make.
The referee demonstrates he won't tolerate this behaviour. Jose Holebas (Watford) is given a yellow card.

That was a brilliant piece of goalkeeping! Heurelho Gomes dived superbly to block a header by Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) from around the penalty spot. His effort was directed straight towards the left post, but Heurelho Gomes pulled off a remarkable save!
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Camilo Zuniga (Watford) replaces Etienne Capoue.
Goal! Juan Zuniga (Watford) shows perfect technique and produces a first-time effort from just outside the box that goes into the bottom left corner. It's 2:1.
Jose Mourinho prepares a substitution. Luke Shaw is replaced by Memphis Depay (Manchester United).
Troy Deeney (Watford) takes out his opponent with a horrific tackle and is relieved when the referee only shows him a yellow card.
Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) attempts to discuss the decision with Michael Oliver, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
Memphis Depay (Manchester United) will have to be careful for the rest of the match as he is shown a yellow card.
Substitution. Odion Ighalo is replaced by Isaac Success (Watford).
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) picks up a yellow card for an infringement.
Michael Oliver blows the whistle, Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) is penalised for a foul. The referee points to the penalty spot. Watford are awarded a penalty kick!
Troy Deeney (Watford) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Troy Deeney (Watford) smartly converts the penalty into the top of the net. The spot kick is too good for the goalkeeper.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Ross Barkley (Everton) decided to shoot after receiving a sweet pass. If it wasn't for Victor Valdes's superb save the ball would have probably ended up in the top of the net.
Maarten Stekelenburg (Everton) scores an own goal!
Maarten Stekelenburg (Everton) attempts to discuss the decision with Lee Mason, but he soon realises that it's not the right thing to do as he sees the yellow.
Goal! Gareth Barry (Everton) fires the rebound inside the left post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
Today's referee Lee Mason rightly decides to book Daniel Ayala (Middlesbrough) for his harsh tackle.
Goal! Romelu Lukaku produces a great pass that finds Seamus Coleman (Everton) inside the penalty area, who takes advantage of the situation to rifle a shot into the bottom right corner. 2:1.
What an excellent finish! Romelu Lukaku (Everton) latched on to an inch-perfect cross into the box and slotted the ball ino the middle of the net. Unstoppable shot!
Gareth Barry (Everton) takes his opponent down and receives a yellow card from the referee.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
That's the end of the game for Emilio Nsue, who is replaced by David Nugent (Middlesbrough).
Ronald Koeman is forced to make a change. Romelu Lukaku is unable to continue due to injury, Enner Valencia (Everton) comes on.
Substitution. Gaston Ramirez is replaced by Viktor Fischer (Middlesbrough).
Ronald Koeman decides to make a substitution. Kevin Mirallas will be replaced by Gerard Deulofeu (Everton).
It's time for a substitution. Adam Clayton (Middlesbrough) comes on in place of Adam Forshaw.
The referee signals a substitution. Tom Cleverley (Everton) is brought on as a substitute for Gareth Barry.
That's the end of the match.
The match has just started.
Goal! Alex Iwobi takes aim and his effort deflects off Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) to beat the goalkeeper. 0:1.

Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) was close to scoring a goal after unleashing a first-time effort from inside the six-yard box. The ball was aimed towards the bottom left corner, but the goalkeeper read it well and pulled off a brilliant save to thwart the attempt.
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
The players claim that Jake Livermore (Hull City) handled the ball inside the box and it seems they are right. It's a penalty for Arsenal!
That will be the end of the match for Jake Livermore (Hull City), who is shown a red card!
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) wastes a huge opportunity to score from the penalty spot. He attempts to slot into the bottom left corner, but Eldin Jakupovic pulls off a superb save.
Tactical substitution due to red card. Adama Diomande departs the field of play to be replaced by Harry Maguire (Hull City).
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
Referee Roger East blows his whistle to start the second half.
Goal! Alex Iwobi gets to the ball, slips Theo Walcott (Arsenal) into the area and he scores with a delightful chipped finish to make it 0:2.
Substitution. Ryan Mason (Hull City) replaces Tom Huddlestone.
Here comes a substitution. Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) is brought on as a substitute for Santi Cazorla.
That will be all from Abel Hernandez who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Dieumerci Mbokani (Hull City).
Arsene Wenger has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Mohamed Elneny (Arsenal) replacing Alex Iwobi.
Petr Cech (Arsenal) tackles a bit over-zealously and Roger East blows for a foul. The referee blows the whistle and gives a penalty to Hull!!
Petr Cech (Arsenal) picks up a yellow card for a foul.
Robert Snodgrass (Hull City) is going to take the penalty!
Robert Snodgrass (Hull City) fires the penalty inside the left post.
Eldin Jakupovic pulls off a great save to deny Theo Walcott (Arsenal), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
Goal! Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball into the top right corner. It's 1:3.
Substitution. Theo Walcott will be replaced by Lucas Perez (Arsenal).
Granit Xhaka (Arsenal) latches on to a pass and controls it with a good first touch. He unleashes a deadly strike from around 30 metres out which goes into the roof of the net.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has started.

Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) weaves through the defence with ease and gets one-on-one with the keeper, but fails to score with his low strike to the middle of the target as Tom Heaton produces a good save.
What a wasted chance that was! A precise cross into the box finds Riyad Mahrez (Leicester), whose header flies narrowly wide of the left post.

Perfectly taken free kick!Christian Fuchs sends a cross in and Islam Slimani (Leicester) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes low into the middle of the net and the score changes to 1:0.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Goal! Jamie Vardy finds Islam Slimani (Leicester) and he shows great determination to get to the ball and plant a header into the back of the net. 2:0.
We are about to witness a subsitution. Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley) for Scott Arfield.
Here is a change. Steven Defour is going off and Sean Dyche gives the last tactical orders to Sam Vokes (Burnley).
This is definitely not what Ben Mee (Burnley) wanted. Attempting to intercept an offensive pass, he scored an own goal and made it 3:0.
Sean Dyche prepares a substitution. Andre Gray is replaced by Patrick Bamford (Burnley).
Here comes a substitution. Daniel Drinkwater is given a rest as he is replaced by Andy King (Leicester).
Substitution. Riyad Mahrez is replaced by Demarai Gray (Leicester).
Matthew Lowton (Burnley) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Anthony Taylor didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Anthony Taylor is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.

Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) unleashes a shot from the free kick just outside the box, and his brilliant low drive goes inside the left post. Football supporters are always happy to see such a fabulous goal.
Nolito (Manchester City) has a great chance inside the six-yard box, shoots to the right side of the goal, but Artur Boruc pulls off an exquisite save to deny him.
Nicolas Otamendi (Manchester City) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Jonathan Moss ignores the protests.
Goal! Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) scores after an assist by Raheem Sterling that allowed him to tap in the ball into an empty net. The score is 2:0.

Artur Boruc can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Raheem Sterling (Manchester City). The ball would have probably ended up in the bottom left corner. Manchester City have been awarded a corner kick.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Jonathan Moss blows his whistle to start the second half.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Eddie Howe gives a chance to Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) and Jordon Ibe is off.
Goal! Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Kelechi Iheanacho. The score is 3:0.
Substitution. John Stones (Manchester City) in, Nicolas Otamendi out.

Claudio Bravo can hear the fans clapping for his superb goalkeeping after he magnificently stops the close-range effort from Callum Wilson (Bournemouth). The ball would have probably ended up in the middle of the net.
Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) creates a good chance for himself and fires in a powerful close-range shot, but his effort ricochets off the left post.
Goal - 4:0! Ilkay Gundogan (Manchester City) gets a shot away from the edge of the box and scores into the bottom right corner. Kevin De Bruyne provided an assist for the goal.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jack Wilshere departs the field of play to be replaced by Dan Gosling (Bournemouth).
It will be a substitution. Leroy Sane (Manchester City) is ready to enter the pitch as Ilkay Gundogan walks off.
Here is a change. Junior Stanislas is going off and Eddie Howe gives the last tactical orders to Max Gradel (Bournemouth).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Aleix Garcia (Manchester City) for Kevin De Bruyne.
Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) fires a shot from close range, but he is somehow only able to hit the crossbar!
What an opportunity! Harry Arter (Bournemouth) picked the ball up and fired a projectile of a shot from long range which threatened the goalkeeper. The shot went painfully close to the right post!
A strict call by Jonathan Moss! He pulls out the red card and sends Nolito (Manchester City) off the pitch.
It's a yellow card for Adam Smith (Bournemouth).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Handball by Arthur Masuaku (West Ham). West Brom are awarded a penalty kick!
Nacer Chadli (West Brom) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Nacer Chadli (West Brom) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the left side of the net.

Michail Antonio (West Ham) receives a precise pass and is given time inside the box to send a promising strike towards the middle of the goal. Ben Foster guesses his intention and denies him with a fine save.
Goal! Nacer Chadli displays great vision and sends a pass to Salomon Rondon (West Brom), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 2:0.
Craig Dawson (West Brom) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Mark Clattenburg didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
Goal! Nacer Chadli takes aim and his effort deflects off James McClean (West Brom) to beat the goalkeeper. 3:0.
The first half of today's match has just finished.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Slaven Bilic makes a half-time substitution. Sofiane Feghouli (West Ham) comes on in place of Mark Noble.
The game is over for Simone Zaza. Jonathan Calleri (West Ham) comes on for the second half.
Goal! Nacer Chadli (West Brom) fires home from very close range after latching on to a pass from Salomon Rondon. The score is 4:0.

A perfect lofted pass from Dimitri Payet finds Michail Antonio (West Ham), who jumps highest and steers a close-range header into the left side of the goal. His effort was both strong and precise, and Ben Foster had no chance of stopping that. 3:0.

James McClean (West Brom) was trying to get to the ball but clattered into the legs of the opponent as well. Mark Clattenburg blows his whistle for an infringement. PENALTY to West Ham! Great chance to score.
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) is going to take the penalty!
Manuel Lanzini (West Ham) steps up and confidently powers the spot kick into the bottom left corner.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Allan Nyom (West Brom) is coming onto the pitch as Brendan Galloway cannot continue after picking up an injury.
The substitution is prepared. James Morrison (West Brom) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Nacer Chadli.
Slaven Bilic prepares a substitution. Arthur Masuaku is replaced by Ashley Fletcher (West Ham).

What a goal-scoring opportunity! Matt Phillips (West Brom) makes a good run into the box to meet a cross and fires the ball in on goal, but the shot is amazingly blocked by a defender. The linesman makes the right call and West Brom will have a corner.

James Collins (West Ham) produces a ferocious strike from the edge of the box. His dangerous effort towards the right post is blocked by Ben Foster, who pulls off a superb save to keep the ball out of the net.

What a sweet touch by James McClean (West Brom) as he collects a pass. From near the edge of the box he produces a shot which goes towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a decent save to thwart him!
Sofiane Feghouli (West Ham) is booked for saying more than Mark Clattenburg was willing to tolerate.
Mark Clattenburg shows a yellow card to Allan Nyom (West Brom), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
Substitution. Jose Rondon makes his way off the pitch and Hal Robson-Kanu (West Brom) comes on as his replacement.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
What a hit! Dejan Lovren (Liverpool) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot inside the left post. 0:1.

Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) quickly gets to a rebound. He is not worried how far out he is and slams the ball towards the goal. To the amazement of all, it goes all the way into the top right corner. He makes it 0:1 with this magnificent strike.
The referee gives a yellow card to Willian (Chelsea) for talking back. He must be careful for the remainder of the match.
The match has reached half-time.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Substitution. Daniel Sturridge will be replaced by Divock Origi (Liverpool).
Nemanja Matic provides Diego Costa (Chelsea) with a nice pass inside the box. It allows him to finish with a low shot into the middle of the goal.

This was a piece of cake for Simon Mignolet. Diego Costa (Chelsea) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went low to the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
Thibaut Courtois makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded towards the bottom right corner by Divock Origi (Liverpool) after a cross from the side.
We are about to witness a substitution. Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) is replacing Philippe Coutinho.
Antonio Conte has decided to substitute Willian and he is replaced by Victor Moses (Chelsea).
The substitution is prepared. Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Nemanja Matic.
Substitution.  Oscar leaves the pitch and is replaced by Pedro (Chelsea).
Lucas Leiva (Liverpool) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Today's match ends for Georginio Wijnaldum who will be replaced by Kevin Stewart (Liverpool).
That's it for today, Martin Atkinson has blown his whistle and the game is over.
The match has just started.

Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his strike from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball went inches over the bar. The ball is off of the pitch and it's a goal kick for Everton.

Romelu Lukaku (Everton) rises above the opponent's defence and heads a precise cross towards the roof of the net. His effort, however, is blocked by Jordan Pickford, who pulls off a stunning save! The ball is out of play. Everton win a corner kick.
Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) violates the rules and gets a yellow card.
Mike Jones has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
Mike Jones blows his whistle and the second half starts.
The teams are back out for the second half and here is a change on the pitch. Ronald Koeman gives a chance to Gerard Deulofeu (Everton) and Ross Barkley is off.
Idrissa Gueye (Everton) gets a yellow card. The referee Mike Jones made the right call.
The game has come to an end for Lynden Gooch. He has contributed as much as he could today. He will be replaced by the fresh legs of Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland).

Goal  0:1! Idrissa Gueye sends a precise lofted pass into the box, Romelu Lukaku (Everton) rises above the defenders to meet the ball near the penalty spot and heads it straight into the bottom left corner.
Great touch by Romelu Lukaku (Everton) as he receives a precise pass deep in the box. He rips a snap shot and the ball bounces off the goalkeeper's gloves and hits the post.
Yannick Bolasie produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Romelu Lukaku (Everton) rises high to head the ball straight under the crossbar and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 0:2.

Stunning strike! Romelu Lukaku (Everton) latches on to a precise through ball from Kevin Mirallas before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the bottom left corner from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 0:3.
Substitution. Didier Ndong (Sunderland) replaces Duncan Watmore.
Ronald Koeman prepares a substitution. Yannick Bolasie is replaced by Tom Davies (Everton).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Jason Denayer (Sunderland) comes onto the pitch for Jan Kirchhoff.
Substitution. Romelu Lukaku makes his way off the pitch and Arouna Kone (Everton) comes on as his replacement.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.

The ball goes out of play. Chelsea are awarded a corner kick. Willian (Chelsea) picks up the ball, dribbles to the edge of the penalty area and unleashes a brilliant shot to the top right corner, but is thwarted by a great save from Lukasz Fabianski.

Stunning strike! Diego Costa (Chelsea) latches on to a precise through ball from  Oscar before unleashing an unstoppable shot into the bottom right corner from the edge of the area. Fantastic goal. The score is now 0:1.

Eden Hazard (Chelsea) unleashes a promising shot towards the bottom left corner after his wonderful solo run, but Lukasz Fabianski thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same. Chelsea get a corner.
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Leroy Fer (Swansea) for a tough tackle.
An accurate pass to the edge of the box is well taken by Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea), whose instinctive shot towards goal flashes inches wide of the left post.
Andre Marriner shows the yellow card to Diego Costa (Chelsea) for a heavy challenge.
Substitution. Modou Barrow (Swansea) on for Neil Taylor.
Federico Fernandez (Swansea) sees a yellow card from Andre Marriner after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.

Diego Costa (Chelsea) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his effort goes narrowly wide of the left post. This should be a big warning for the defence.
The match has reached half-time.
Referee Andre Marriner blows his whistle to start the second half.
What a sensational goal that would have been! Eden Hazard (Chelsea) picks up the ball inside the box and fires a beautiful first-time shot, but it goes just a few inches wide of the left post.
Today's referee Andre Marriner rightly decides to book Jordi Amat (Swansea) for his harsh tackle.
Thibaut Courtois (Chelsea) brings an opponent down and Andre Marriner interrupts the game. The referee points to the penalty spot. It's a penalty for Swansea!
Thibaut Courtois (Chelsea) has tested the patience of referee Andre Marriner and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) is going to take the penalty!
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Thibaut Courtois to move before rolling the ball into the middle of the goal!
Goal! It's a catastrophic error from the opponent which has gifted a chance to Leroy Fer (Swansea), who rolls the ball into the back of the net from close range. 2:1.

An unsuccessful long-range effort by Eden Hazard (Chelsea) after he collected a pass and unleashed a shot. The ball was directed into the top right corner, but it was an easy job for the keeper to make a save. The ball goes out of play. Chelsea are awarded a corner kick.
Substitution. Nemanja Matic leaves the pitch and is replaced by Cesc Fabregas (Chelsea).
Antonio Conte has decided to make a change. Victor Moses (Chelsea) replaces Willian.
Good chance for  Oscar (Chelsea) as he latched on to a cross on the edge of the box and blasted the ball towards the net! It flew wide of the left post.
Eden Hazard swings the cross over.  Oscar (Chelsea) gets his head to it but it goes just over the crossbar.
GOAL! Diego Costa (Chelsea) gets to the rebound inside the box and fires in a stunning overhead kick. Phenomenal finish! 2:2.

Lukasz Fabianski pulls off a great save to deny Diego Costa (Chelsea), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal. The ball goes out for a corner. Chelsea can continue in their attacking effort.

Gary Cahill (Chelsea) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the middle of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
Antonio Conte decides to make a substitution.  Oscar will be replaced by Michy Batshuayi (Chelsea).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Angel Rangel (Swansea) replaces Gylfi Sigurdsson.
Andre Marriner shows a yellow card to Eden Hazard (Chelsea), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
John Terry (Chelsea) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Andre Marriner didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!
Goal! James Milner slips it to Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) on the edge of the box and he finds the bottom left corner with a great effort. The score is 1:0.

Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low drive is headed for the bottom right corner, but the goalkeeper pulls off a marvellous diving save and denies him.
Daniel Amartey (Leicester) has to be very careful for the rest of the match after receiving a yellow card from the referee for a bad tackle on an opponent.
Goal! Daniel Sturridge gets to the ball, slips Sadio Mane (Liverpool) into the area and he scores with a delightful chipped finish to make it 2:0.
Danny Simpson is being substituted because of an injury. Claudio Ranieri sends Luis Hernandez (Leicester) on the pitch.
Goal! A mistake from the defence gifted a chance to a lurking Jamie Vardy (Leicester), who keeps his cool and rolls the ball into the net from close range. 2:1.
Robert Huth (Leicester) leaps high to meet a lofted pass around the penalty spot, but his header crashes against the crossbar!
What was Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The second half gets underway.
There will be a change on the pitch for the second half. Claudio Ranieri probably wasn't satisfied with the performance of Shinji Okazaki. He is replaced by Ahmed Musa (Leicester).

This was a piece of cake for Kasper Schmeichel. Daniel Sturridge (Liverpool) found himself some space after latching on to a pass, but his strike only went low to the middle of the goal and into the gloves of the prepared keeper.
Fantastic team goal! Adam Lallana (Liverpool) was set free in the area by Georginio Wijnaldum and made no mistake with a lovely finish into the top left corner. 3:1.
Daniel Drinkwater (Leicester) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) collects a great pass inside the box and misses a golden opportunity. His low shot was directed into the middle of the goal, but the goalkeeper does well to stop his effort.
Marc Albrighton will be replaced by Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester).
Jurgen Klopp prepares a substitution. Georginio Wijnaldum is replaced by Kevin Stewart (Liverpool).
Substitution. Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) replaces Daniel Sturridge.
Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) receives a brilliant pass and wastes a big opportunity as his shot from inside the penalty area flies just over the crossbar.
It must be a yellow card. It is. Robert Huth (Leicester) receives the caution after an awful tackle.
GOAL! Roberto Firmino (Liverpool) gets to the ball on the edge of the box after a huge mistake by an opponent and slams it into the back of the net. He makes it 4:1.
A substitution has been made. Sadio Mane goes off and Alberto Moreno (Liverpool) comes on.
Craig Pawson is looking at his watch and immediately ends this match.

Nacho Monreal (Arsenal) gets booked for the first time in this match.
Dusan Tadic (Southampton) fires in the free kick from a promising position just outside the box. It's a fantastic strike and looks set for glory, but it only rattles the crossbar!
OWN GOAL! The free kick is whipped in and the ball hits Petr Cech (Arsenal), who finds the back of his own net. 0:1.
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) receives a yellow card for a nasty tackle.
Goal! Laurent Koscielny (Arsenal) fires the rebound inside the right post after the ball breaks to him in the box. The score is 1:1.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Robert Madley has ended it.
The whistle blows and Robert Madley starts the second half.
That will be all from Jay Rodriguez who is being replaced by the fresh legs of Shane Long (Southampton).
That will be a yellow card for one of the players. The one who gets booked is Fraser Forster (Southampton).
Hector Bellerin (Arsenal) blows an opportunity as he sends a rebound from just outside of the box narrowly wide of the left post.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) comes onto the pitch for Lucas Perez.
Arsene Wenger has decided to make a change. Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) replaces Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain.
Substitution. Jordy Clasie did his best and is replaced by Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton).
CHANCE! Shane Long (Southampton) fires just wide of the left post from inside the box after running onto a splendid pass from Dusan Tadic.

Mesut Ozil sprays a wonderful pass out to Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal), who cannot get enough power or direction to cause Fraser Forster problems and the goalkeeper is able to watch the ball go just over the crossbar.
Shane Long (Southampton) wins himself enough space to connect with a cross inside the box, but his fine header goes narrowly over the crossbar!
A substitution has been made. Theo Walcott goes off and Alex Iwobi (Arsenal) comes on.
What a great touch by Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) as he controls a fine pass into the box and takes a shot to the bottom left corner, but an opposing player makes a clearance. Great defending.
That's the end of the game for Dusan Tadic, who is replaced by James Ward-Prowse (Southampton).

Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton) picks up the rebound inside the penalty area and releases a good shot to the bottom left corner. Unfortunately for him, Petr Cech shows how quick his reflexes are and dives superbly to stop his effort. What a save but what a wasted opportunity! Southampton will have a chance to score from a corner kick.
Great ball in from Santi Cazorla. Olivier Giroud (Arsenal) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the left post.
Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
Jose Fonte (Southampton) is shown a yellow card by the referee for making a challenge on his opponent, but he looks angry with the decision.
Jose Fonte (Southampton) trips an opposition player and Robert Madley signals a foul. PENALTY! A huge scoring opportunity for Arsenal.
A yellow card for bad language! Virgil Van Dijk (Southampton) couldnt remain silent and the result is obvious.
Ryan Bertrand (Southampton) criticises the decision of the referee and immediately receives a yellow card.
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) smoothly converts the penalty with a beautiful low drive into the left side of the net.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.

Ben Foster pulls off a great save to deny Joshua King (Bournemouth), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot towards the middle of the goal.
What a chance that is! Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) leaps high to meet a lofted pass inside the six-yard box, but his header crashes off the crossbar!
Joshua King (Bournemouth) misses a rebound from close range. His effort floats narrowly over the crossbar!
The referee blows his whistle for half-time, bringing to a close the first 45 minutes of the match.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.
Claudio Yacob (West Brom) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Kevin Friend ignores the protests.
Jordon Ibe (Bournemouth) gets on the end of a pass on the edge of the area, but he drags his shot just wide of the right post.
Gareth McAuley (West Brom) rises highest from the corner to head at goal, but his effort towards the left side of the goal is brilliantly kept out by the goalkeeper.
Substitution. Jordon Ibe is replaced by Jack Wilshere (Bournemouth).
Tony Pulis prepares a substitution. Saido Berahino is replaced by Salomon Rondon (West Brom).
Junior Stanislas (Bournemouth) latches on to a precise pass and one-on-one with the keeper slams the ball towards the left-hand post. Ben Foster is alert, though, and leaps like a salmon to deny him.
Adam Smith (Bournemouth) has received a yellow card for his foul.
The manager makes a subsitution with Craig Gardner (West Brom) coming on for Darren Fletcher.
Substitution. Joshua King did his best and is replaced by Max Gradel (Bournemouth).
Eddie Howe decides to make a substitution. Junior Stanislas will be replaced by Dan Gosling (Bournemouth).
GOAL! Callum Wilson (Bournemouth) finishes off a sublime move with a delightful back-heel goal. Adam Smith provided the assist with a brilliant pass. 1:0.
Tony Pulis has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Jonathan Leko (West Brom) replacing Claudio Yacob.
Jonny Evans (West Brom) fouls his opponent and receives a yellow card from the referee, but he is clearly not happy with the decision.
Kevin Friend shows a yellow card to Sam Field (West Brom) for a tough tackle.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The first half has started.
What a great effort! Stephen Ward (Burnley) decides to unleash a long-range shot. Despite hitting it very well, it scorches inches over the crossbar. We could have witnessed a magnificent goal.
The foul by Ben Mee (Burnley) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Paul Tierney.
David Meyler (Hull City) receives a precise pass and goes for goal, but his effort crashes against the left post!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Paul Tierney has ended it.
The second half gets underway.
What a big chance! Adama Diomande (Hull City) picks up an inch-perfect pass inside the box and fires the ball a whisker wide of the right post.
Substitution. Will Keane (Hull City) receives a signal from the referee and is now allowed to enter the pitch as Adama Diomande walks off.

What a beautiful moment! Steven Defour (Burnley) got to the ball and unleashed a strong shot from distance. It turned out to be a good decision as his effort found its way into the bottom right corner. Eldin Jakupovic just shakes his head in disbelief. The score changes to 1:0.
Mike Phelan has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Ryan Mason (Hull City) replacing David Meyler.
Substitution. Steven Defour did his best and is replaced by Jeff Hendrick (Burnley).
Johann Gudmundsson comes off the pitch to be replaced by Scott Arfield (Burnley).
CHANCE! Curtis Davies (Hull City) rises high to meet the resultant corner kick and attempts to steer his fine header past the goalkeeper, but only hits the crossbar!
Substitution. Patrick Bamford (Burnley) replaces Andre Gray.
Scott Arfield (Burnley) is yellow-carded for breaking the rules of the game.
Mike Phelan has decided to substitute Sam Clucas and he is replaced by Shaun Maloney (Hull City).
Robert Snodgrass (Hull City) takes a brilliant free kick and curls the ball inside the right post to give the goalkeeper no chance!
That's all for today as the game is over.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
It's a goal! Christian Benteke (Crystal Palace) does well to meet a cross inside the box and strikes a perfect header into the roof of the net.

Crystal Palace get a corner. Andros Townsend (Crystal Palace) receives a low pass just outside the box and unleashes a fine strike towards the left post. Victor Valdes pulls off a reflexive save to block his effort. Nice goalkeeping skill, indeed.
Stewart Downing sends in a great cross from the corner and finds Daniel Ayala (Middlesbrough), who outjumps the defence to finish into the top left corner with a header. The score is 1:1.

Steve Mandanda pulls off a great save to deny Alvaro Negredo (Middlesbrough) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Neil Swarbrick has ended it.
Neil Swarbrick blows his whistle and the second half starts.

A superb goal from great team play! Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) latches on to a perfect pass and fires an excellent shot inside the left post. There is nothing a goalkeeper can do about shots like that.

Stewart Downing (Middlesbrough) makes a yard for himself and attempts to endanger the goalkeeper with a long-range shot. His great effort, however, goes a whisker wide of the left post. The ball goes out of play and Crystal Palace will have a goal kick.
Here is a change. Adam Clayton is going off and Aitor Karanka de la Hoz gives the last tactical orders to Marten de Roon (Middlesbrough).
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Viktor Fischer leaves the pitch and Gaston Ramirez (Middlesbrough) comes on.
Neil Swarbrick has issued a yellow card to Gaston Ramirez (Middlesbrough).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Chung-Yong Lee (Crystal Palace) will replace Andros Townsend.
Substitution. Christian Stuani makes his way off the pitch and Adama Traore (Middlesbrough) comes on as his replacement.
Joel Ward (Crystal Palace) is given a yellow card.
Alan Pardew prepares a substitution. Joe Ledley is replaced by Mathieu Flamini (Crystal Palace).
Substitution. Christian Benteke did his best and is replaced by Jonathan Benteke (Crystal Palace).
Gaston Ramirez (Middlesbrough) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot in the direction of the left post. Steve Mandanda is alert and denies him with a nice save.
Tempers flare after a clattering challenge by Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace), who receives a yellow card from the referee. It could have been worse for him!
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The first half has just begun.
GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Glenn Whelan (Stoke City) has tested the patience of referee Anthony Taylor and goes into the book for a previous late challenge.
Dele Alli (Tottenham) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Shay Given makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the top right corner.
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) receives a yellow card.

Goal! Christian Eriksen displays great vision and sends a pass to Heung-Min Son (Tottenham), who shows brilliant composure inside the box to bury the ball into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:1.
Victor Wanyama (Tottenham) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Anthony Taylor had an easy-decision to make.
That is it for the first half after the referee blows his whistle and the players head to their respective dressing rooms.
The players are back out on the pitch following the half-time break and the second half is about to start.
Substitution. Victor Wanyama leaves the pitch and is replaced by Erik Lamela (Tottenham).
Goal! Christian Eriksen tees up Heung-Min Son (Tottenham) on the edge of the box and he fires the ball into the top of the net. 0:2.
Brilliant finish! Dele Alli (Tottenham) perfectly collected a pass on the edge of the penalty area from Kyle Walker, then produced a nice strike into the bottom left corner. The score is 0:3.
Mark Hughes has decided to substitute Glenn Whelan and he is replaced by Bojan Krkic (Stoke City).
Harry Kane (Tottenham) receives a precise pass inside the box from Heung-Min Son and he beats the goalkeeper with a neat finish into the right side of the net. 0:4.
Here comes a substitution. Gianelli Imbula is given a rest as he is replaced by Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City).
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Vincent Janssen (Tottenham) is coming onto the pitch as Harry Kane cannot continue after picking up an injury.

That was a brilliant piece of goalkeeping! Hugo Lloris dived superbly to block a header by Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) from around the penalty spot. His effort was directed straight towards the left post, but Hugo Lloris pulled off a remarkable save!
Christian Eriksen comes off the pitch to be replaced by Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham).
Moussa Sissoko (Tottenham) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Charles Graham Adam (Stoke City) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.

Great solo effort by Michail Antonio (West Ham) as he beats two defenders before firing in a drive from just outside of the box towards the bottom right corner. The goalkeeper is ready and makes an amazing save.

Goal! Dimitri Payet sent in a fine cross from the corner kick. The perfect pass found the head of Michail Antonio (West Ham) and his precise header from around the penalty spot ended up in the bottom right corner. The score is 1:0.

What a chance! Odion Ighalo (Watford) gets on the end of a pass inside the box and takes a shot to the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players makes a crucial goal-line clearance. Watford have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Martin Atkinson shows the yellow card to Simone Zaza (West Ham) for a heavy challenge.
Goal! Dimitri Payet produces a brilliant lofted pass and Michail Antonio (West Ham) gets on the end of it to finish with a header into an empty net. The score is 2:0.

Valon Behrami (Watford) receives a yellow card for infringement.
Troy Deeney (Watford) struck from medium range, curling the ball into the top right corner. What a hit! Pure magic.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Martin Atkinson has ended it.
The half-time break is over and the second half is about to start.

GOAL DISALLOWED! Controversy and anger as Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) has a goal ruled out, incredibly, for offside.
Post! Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) latches on to a sweet pass inside the box and unleashes a shot which only hits the right post. What an unlucky moment for him.

Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) is awarded a yellow card for his tackle. He doesn't seem to agree with the decision, but Mark Clattenburg ignores the protests.

Perfectly taken free kick! Kevin De Bruyne sends a cross in and Fernandinho (Manchester City) leaps high to connect with it on the edge of the 6-yard box. His close-range header goes into the top left corner and the score changes to 2:0.
Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) produces a shot from a direct free kick on the edge of the box. His effort sails narrowly over the crossbar. The goalkeeper was lucky there.

The game restarts for the second half.
Half-time substitution. Slaven Bilic decided to make a change. Gokhan Tore is replaced by Samuel Byram (West Ham).
A goal, which was scored by Nolito (Manchester City), was disallowed due to offside.
The whistle blows and Ashley Fletcher (West Ham) is booked for an infringement.
The referee gives a yellow card to Mark Noble (West Ham) for talking back. He must be careful for the remainder of the match.
Arthur Masuaku produces a beautiful lofted cross into the box, where Michail Antonio (West Ham) rises high to head the ball into the right side of the goal and beyond the goalkeeper. He makes it 2:1.

CHANCE! Kevin De Bruyne finds Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) with a sweet pass, but he can't find the target as his effort from inside the box goes just wide of the left post!

Problems for Slaven Bilic as Winston Reid is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Jonathan Calleri (West Ham) replaces him.

It's in the back of the net! David Silva picks out Raheem Sterling (Manchester City) with a sweet pass, and he latches on to it deep inside the box and beats the goalkeeper. 3:1.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
What was Daniel Ayala (Middlesbrough) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.

Jose Rondon (West Brom) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner, but his effort goes narrowly wide of the right post. This should be a big warning for the defence.

Referee Anthony Taylor blows his whistle to start the second half.

Marouane Fellaini (Manchester United) picks up a yellow card for a foul. Hull will take a free kick.
Close! Robert Snodgrass (Hull City) takes the resultant free kick from 25 metres out and his shot goes just wide of the right post.

Juan Manuel Mata (Manchester United) produced a promising shot towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Eldin Jakupovic thwarted him with a fabulous save and the score remains the same.

Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the middle of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.

Zlatan Ibrahimovic (Manchester United) wasted a huge opportunity! He received a fine cross from the free kick and fired a decent shot in from close range. Unfortunately for him, it sailed narrowly wide of the left post!

The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Juan Manuel Mata departs the field of play to be replaced by Marcus Rashford (Manchester United).
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) creates a yard of space for himself and tries an effort from the edge of the box, but it goes just wide of the left post.
Wayne Rooney (Manchester United) has too much to say to the referee and receives a yellow card.
Jonathan Moss shows a yellow card to David Meyler (Hull City), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late. Manchester Utd are awarded a free kick from a dangerous position.

Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) goes on a mazy run, skips past two defenders and pulls the trigger in front of the keeper. Eldin Jakupovic makes a great save to stop the effort going into the bottom right corner. The ball is out of play and the linesman points at the corner flag. Corner to Manchester Utd.

Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Manchester United) misses a good chance to score. An inch-perfect cross into the box finds Henrikh Mkhitaryan (Manchester United) who rises for a header, but sends the ball well over the bar.

Good team movement sets up Paul Pogba (Manchester United) on the edge of the box, but he slices the ball narrowly wide of the right post.
Goal! Wayne Rooney puts the ball on a plate for Marcus Rashford (Manchester United), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 0:1.
Marcus Rashford (Manchester United) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Chris Smalling (Manchester United) is coming onto the pitch as Wayne Rooney cannot continue after picking up an injury.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Eden Hazard (Chelsea) perfectly wriggles his way through two or three opponents, and he produces a low drive from the edge of the box which goes inside the right post. Wonderful goal!

What a chance! Eden Hazard (Chelsea) gets on the end of a pass inside the box and takes a shot to the bottom right corner, but one of the defending players makes a crucial goal-line clearance. Corner kick. Chelsea will have an opportunity.

Gary Cahill (Chelsea) fashions a shot from the edge of the box after receiving an accurate pass. Tom Heaton makes a stunning save to stop the effort from flying into the left side of the goal. The referee blows his whistle, Chelsea are awarded a corner kick.
Oscar (Chelsea) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Mark Clattenburg didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
What a sweet touch by Diego Costa (Chelsea) as he collects a pass deep inside the box and decides to go for goal. It's on target but easy for Tom Heaton to hold.
Willian (Chelsea) finishes his beautiful individual effort with a superb strike from inside the box. Tom Heaton is just a bystander as the ball flies into the bottom left corner. The score is 2:0.
What a chance that is! Scott Arfield (Burnley) finds himself unmarked in a promising position after receiving a cross on the edge of the box and his attempt sails a whisker wide of the left post.
Branislav Ivanovic (Chelsea) picks up a yellow card for a foul.

Mark Clattenburg shows a yellow card to Michael Keane (Burnley), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late. Chelsea earn a free kick.

Eden Hazard (Chelsea) won himself some space after the corner kick and tries his luck with a shot from the edge of the box. His effort is directed towards the right post, but the goalkeeper is alert and makes the save.

Lukasz Fabianski pulls off a great save to deny Ahmed Musa (Leicester) after receiving a precise defence-splitting pass. The effort is headed for the right side of the goal, but the goalkeeper dives superbly to stop it. Definitely the best save of this match so far!

This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Steven Davis (Southampton) was quite harsh and Lee Mason didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Lamine Kone (Sunderland) collects the ball from the free kick and immediately sends his close-range effort narrowly wide of the left post!

Jose Fonte (Southampton) carelessly slides into the feet of his opponent and he'll be lucky to avoid punishment. Lee Mason blows for the foul but keeps his cards in his pocket on this occasion. PENALTY AWARDED to Sunderland!
Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) is going to take the penalty!
Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) coolly converts the penalty, sending the ball into the top left corner.

James Ward-Prowse passes to Jay Rodriguez (Southampton), who collects the ball and unleashes a low shot from the edge of the box. His effort goes into the middle of the net and past the surprised goalkeeper. The score is 1:1.
Close! Matt Targett (Southampton) stands over the resulting free kick from around 28 metres out and his shot goes just wide of the left post!
Booking. Jack Rodwell (Sunderland) receives a caution from the referee.
That's it for today, Lee Mason has blown his whistle and the game is over.
Today's match has just started, enjoy the game!

Nordin Amrabat (Watford) is obviously not following the Golden Rule: Treat others as you want to be treated. He makes a bad challenge and leaves Kevin Friend with no other option than to blow for a foul. Arsenal are awarded a penalty! The opposing players are protesting, but the referee had an easy-decision to make.
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) is going to take the penalty!
Santi Cazorla (Arsenal) makes no mistake from the penalty spot after waiting for Heurelho Gomes to move before slotting the ball low into the middle of the goal!
The foul by Sebastian Prodl (Watford) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Kevin Friend.
Christian Kabasele (Watford) shows good awareness inside the box to meet a delightful cross from the free kick. He fails to direct the ball into the net as it flies narrowly wide of the right post.

Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal) receives a precise low pass inside the box, controls the ball and drills it towards the right post. Unfortunately for him, Heurelho Gomes makes a great save to stop his effort.
Goal! Theo Walcott puts the ball on a plate for Alexis Sanchez (Arsenal), who scores with a simple close-range finish. It's 0:2.

It's a goal! Mesut Ozil (Arsenal) makes it 0:2. He jumped highest to connect with a perfect cross from Alexis Sanchez and planted his close-range header into the middle of the goal. Heurelho Gomes was helpless.

Etienne Capoue (Watford) reacts well to get to the rebound and takes a shot from the edge of the box, but he fails to get the ball through the players standing between him and the goal.
Goal! Roberto Pereyra (Watford) pounced on a loose ball inside the box and beats the goalkeeper with a shot inside the left post. He makes it 1:3.
Today's referee Kevin Friend rightly decides to book Troy Deeney (Watford) for his harsh tackle.
Odion Ighalo (Watford) takes the ball on and fires in a shot from 23 metres out. Petr Cech stops the effort which is headed to the left post.
It's time for a substitution. That's the last involvement from Mesut Ozil as he is replaced by Jack Wilshere (Arsenal).
Substitution. Mohamed Elneny (Arsenal) has come on for Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain.

The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.

Excellent touch by Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool)! He latches on to a precise pass deep into the box and unleashes a low drive towards the left post, but the goalkeeper pulls off a terrific save.
Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the right post only for Simon Mignolet to dive and make a save.

Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) wastes a huge opportunity! He receives a precise cross inside the penalty area and releases a quick shot that sails towards the bottom left corner. His effort, however, lacks power and the goalkeeper dives to make a stunning save.

Danny Rose (Tottenham) is cautioned by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.

James Milner (Liverpool) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.

Philippe Coutinho (Liverpool) is literally asking for a yellow card with his behaviour. The referee agrees and books him.

Dejan Lovren (Liverpool) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.

Erik Lamela (Tottenham) stands over the free kick and opts to take it himself, sending it towards the top of net only for Simon Mignolet to dive and make a save. The ball is out of play. Tottenham win a corner kick.

What a great chance for Toby Alderweireld (Tottenham). He times his jump superbly when he leaps high to meet a precise cross from the corner, directing his towering header inside the left post, but the goalkeeper denies him with a miraculous save. Tottenham have been awarded a corner kick.

What was Jordan Henderson (Liverpool) thinking? He will not get away with that. The referee shows him a yellow card.
