Substitution. Wayne Rooney did his best and is replaced by Memphis Depay (Manchester United).

CHANCE! Harry Arter (Bournemouth) goes very close! He gathers a cross inside the box and fires a sublime shot towards the right side of the goal, but David de Gea produces an excellent save. Bournemouth will take a corner kick.
That's all for today as the game is over.
The match has just started.
Duncan Watmore (Sunderland) had a good opportunity when he latched on to a cross from the wing, but his header from the six-yard box wasn't accurate enough and the ball glanced away off the bar!
Referee Robert Madley sees the trip by Patrick van Aanholt (Sunderland) and doesn't hesitate to blow his whistle. Manchester City are awarded a penalty!
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) is heading towards the penalty spot to take it.
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) confidently powers his spot-kick into the left side of the goal.
Wilfredo Caballero pulls off a great save to deny Jermain Defoe (Sunderland), who makes himself some space inside the box and unleashes a quick shot to the right side of the goal.
Robert Madley shows a yellow card to Lynden Gooch (Sunderland), who isn't surprised as the tackle was really hard and late.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The game restarts for the second half.
Here comes a substitution. Nolito is given a rest as he is replaced by Jesus Navas (Manchester City).
Sergio Aguero (Manchester City) makes space inside the box for a shot, but his effort goes just wide of the left post.
Here is a change. David Silva is going off and Pep Guardiola gives the last tactical orders to Fabian Delph (Manchester City).
Today's match ends for Duncan Watmore who will be replaced by Adnan Januzaj (Sunderland).
We are about to witness a subsitution. Wahbi Khazri (Sunderland) for Lynden Gooch.
A yellow card for a tackle by Donald Love (Sunderland). Robert Madley doesn't hesitate at all to make this decision.

Kevin De Bruyne (Manchester City) unloads a good strike from the free kick just outside the box. His effort towards the left post is stopped by Vito Mannone, who pulls off a glorious save! It will be a corner kick for Manchester City.
Jermain Defoe (Sunderland) latches on to a precise pass deep inside the box from Jack Rodwell, and he beats the goalkeeper with a low shot into the middle of the goal. He makes it 1:1.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Gael Clichy leaves the pitch and Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) comes on.
It is time for a substitution. Paddy McNair (Sunderland) is on for Jermain Defoe.
An own goal! Paddy McNair (Sunderland) had a great deal of bad luck. He wanted to intercept a dangerous pass, but he hit it in badly and sent it past his goalkeeper.
Kelechi Iheanacho (Manchester City) receives a sweet pass inside the box, but his effort on goal is blocked by the defender. Manchester City earn a corner.
Today's referee Robert Madley rightly decides to book Aleksandar Kolarov (Manchester City) for his harsh tackle.
That's the end of the match.
The first half has started.
This would have been a magnificent goal from Wayne Routledge (Swansea), who collected the ball inside the box and prodded a first-time shot on goal that flew just narrowly wide of the left post.
Andre Gray (Burnley) unleashes a promising shot towards the middle of the goal after his wonderful solo run, but Lukasz Fabianski thwarts the effort with a fabulous save. The score remains the same.
David Jones (Burnley) receives a yellow card from the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier.
The ball from the resulting corner kick slipped through the box to Leon Britton (Swansea), who instantly fires a low shot towards the left side of the goal, but his effort is blocked. So unlucky.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The whistle blows and Jonathan Moss starts the second half.
A precise cross towards the edge of the box was latched onto by Dean Marney (Burnley) . He outjumped the defence and produced a powerful header which goes a whisker over the crossbar.

Leon Britton (Swansea) is the first to arrive to a rebound inside the penalty area and unleashes a quick strike towards the left side of the target that beats the keeper. One of the defenders, however, makes a goal-line clearance.
Jordi Amat (Swansea) shouldn't be surprised it's a yellow from the ref, who cooled the situation down well.
Michael Keane (Burnley) rises above the defence to meet the corner. His timing is good, but he arrows his header just a few inches wide of the right post.

Sam Vokes (Burnley) connected with a pass around the edge of the box, aimed and shot. His attempt went towards the right-hand post, but Lukasz Fabianski was alert and the score remains the same. Burnley will take a corner kick.
Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) joins the action as a substitute, replacing Leon Britton.
Nightmare of a shot. Matthew Lowton (Burnley) is first to a rebound inside the 6-yard box but his shot goes high and wide of the goal.

Gylfi Sigurdsson (Swansea) releases a promising shot from the free kick from around 20 metres out. The ball goes towards the left side of the goal, but the goalkeeper makes a save and denies him. Corner kick. Swansea will have an opportunity.
Federico Fernandez (Swansea) comes close to scoring! He gets the ball inside the box from the resulting corner but his shot flies just over the crossbar. This should be a big warning for the defence.
Francesco Guidolin has decided to substitute Modou Barrow and he is replaced by Jefferson Montero (Swansea).
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Stephen Ward (Burnley) was quite harsh and Jonathan Moss didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
The substitution has been made. Johann Gudmundsson (Burnley) has replaced Scott Arfield.
Great ball in from Jefferson Montero. Fernando Llorente (Swansea) should really have done better with a close-range header, but he heads it a whisker wide of the right post.
Matthew Lowton (Burnley) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Jonathan Moss had an easy-decision to make. Swansea are awarded a mid-range free kick.
Tom Heaton makes a superb save to deny a header which was nodded low towards the middle of the goal by Fernando Llorente (Swansea) after a cross from the side.
Goal! Leroy Fer (Swansea) was in the right place at the right time to get to the rebound inside the box and gleefully rifles the ball low inside the right post. It's 0:1.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Angel Rangel (Swansea) is coming onto the pitch as Wayne Routledge cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Sean Dyche has decided to introduce fresh legs, with Lukas Jutkiewicz (Burnley) replacing David Jones.
Federico Fernandez (Swansea) gets a yellow card.
Dean Marney (Burnley) collects a rebound and produces a mid-range attempt. The ball goes to the top right corner, but Lukasz Fabianski keeps it out with an amazing save.
There will be no more action in this match as the referee signals full time.
The first half of this match is about to start.

Salomon Rondon (West Brom) attempts to convert a lofted cross as he jumps high and heads the ball to the right side of the goal. Wayne Hennessey shows his brilliant reflexes and pulls off a glorious save to stop the ball from hitting the net.
Craig Dawson (West Brom) is booked after bringing down an opponent. Craig Pawson had an easy-decision to make.
The referee blows his whistle to end the first half and the players are now heading to their respective dressing rooms.
The second half has just started.

Nice individual effort by Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace). He gets all the way through to the keeper and hits a low drive to the bottom left corner, but Ben Foster does a good job to anticipate the direction of the ball and keeps it out.
The goalkeeper pulls off a remarkable reflex save to deny a rebound from Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace)! That was a huge opportunity!
Alan Pardew prepares a substitution. Chung-Yong Lee is replaced by Yannick Bolasie (Crystal Palace).
The manager has decided to make a substitution and Craig Gardner walks off the pitch to be replaced by James McClean (West Brom).
Jose Rondon (West Brom) celebrates a beautiful goal. He wins the ball inside the box from the free kick and plants a header inside the left post. 0:1.
Alan Pardew has decided to make a change. Yohan Cabaye (Crystal Palace) replaces Jason Puncheon.
Jonny Evans (West Brom) is given a fully deserved yellow card.
Wilfried Zaha (Crystal Palace) gives the referee no choice but to show him a yellow card.
Substitution. James Morrison (West Brom) replaces Saido Berahino.
Yannick Bolasie (Crystal Palace) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card without any hesitation from the referee.
Substitution. Martin Kelly (Crystal Palace) in, Pape Souare out.
The referee blows for the end of today's match.
The referee blows his whistle and we are underway.
Ross Barkley (Everton) sends the ball into the net from a long-distance direct free kick. It goes exactly inside the right post. Sensational free kick.

Phil Jagielka (Everton) latches onto a precise cross from the free kick and produces a header at goal from the penalty spot, but his attempt towards the roof of the net fails to beat Michel Vorm, who makes a fine save. The ball is out of play. Everton will have a chance to score from a corner.
Problems for Mauricio Pochettino as Hugo Lloris is not able to play anymore. His injury is too serious and Michel Vorm (Tottenham) replaces him.
Gerard Deulofeu (Everton) gets inside the penalty area and sends a powerful shot that almost ends inside the net. The keeper is alert and makes a good save.
There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Martin Atkinson has ended it.
Everything is set for the start of the second half.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Eric Dier departs the field of play to be replaced by Vincent Janssen (Tottenham).

Kyle Walker sends a superb cross into the box. Erik Lamela (Tottenham) latches on to it and from close range plants a header inside the left post, leaving Maarten Stekelenburg beaten. He displayed his eye for goal there - excellent finish. The score is 1:0.
Gerard Deulofeu will be replaced by Arouna Kone (Everton).
Today's match ends for Kevin Mirallas who will be replaced by Aaron Lennon (Everton).

Vincent Janssen (Tottenham) finds himself some space inside the box, collects a rebound and sends an effort in on goal. Maarten Stekelenburg pulls off a fantastic reflex save to stop the ball going inside the right-hand post.

Christian Eriksen (Tottenham) attempts to threaten the goalkeeper from the free kick on the edge of the box. He produces a stunning blast which only flies inches over the crossbar. It could have been a beautiful goal!

Erik Lamela (Tottenham) darts into the penalty area to latch on to a pass, and he unleashes a shot towards the roof of the net, but Maarten Stekelenburg is alert and denies him with a nice save. Tottenham have been awarded a corner kick. The referee and one of his assistants both point at the corner flag.
Ronald Koeman decides to make a substitution. Gareth Barry will be replaced by Tom Cleverley (Everton).
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
The match has just started.
Goal! Gaston Ramirez finds Alvaro Negredo (Middlesbrough) with a headed pass and the latter glances a header past the goalkeeper to make it 1:0.
Kevin Friend shows the yellow card to Ryan Shawcross (Stoke City) for a heavy challenge.
Marten de Roon is being substituted because of an injury. Aitor Karanka de la Hoz sends Adam Forshaw (Middlesbrough) on the pitch.
This yellow card was deserved. The tackle by Stewart Downing (Middlesbrough) was quite harsh and Kevin Friend didn't hesitate to show him a yellow card.
Is that a yellow card in the referee's hand? It is! Shay Given (Stoke City) gets booked.
The whistle is blown for an infringement and Gaston Ramirez (Middlesbrough) receives a yellow card!
Gaston Ramirez (Middlesbrough) expertly controls a neat clever pass inside the box, but his effort crashes against the right post! What an opportunity that was!
The end of the first half.
The game restarts for the second half.
Phillip Bardsley (Stoke City) is awarded a yellow card.
Xherdan Shaqiri (Stoke City) converts a direct free kick from the edge of the box with a powerful low shot, spinning into the back of the net off the right post.
Mark Hughes has decided to substitute Mame Diouf and he is replaced by Jonathan Walters (Stoke City).
That's the end of the game for Bojan Krkic, who is replaced by Joe Allen (Stoke City).
Philipp Wollscheid (Stoke City) commits a foul and is shown a yellow card.
Albert Adomah (Middlesbrough) misses a great chance! He latches on to a fine cross into the box, but his effort misses the right post by a whisker.
Substitution. David Nugent (Middlesbrough) on for Gaston Ramirez.

Stewart Downing (Middlesbrough) wastes a great scoring opportunity! He receives a precise lofted cross inside the box and sends a quick shot to the left side of the goal, but he can't get the power to direct it past Shay Given, who keeps it out.
Adam Forshaw (Middlesbrough) is yellow-carded.
Marko Arnautovic (Stoke City) gets a yellow card.
The referee blows his whistle for the final time to end this match.
Here we go, today's match is starting right now.
Goal! Troy Deeney gets to the ball and heads it over the defence to Etienne Capoue (Watford), who meets it nicely and fires in into the back of the net. 0:1.
What a chance that is! Dusan Tadic swings the ball into the box, and Shane Long (Southampton) gets in front of his man and powers his header just wide of the left post.
Roger East has ended the first half by blowing the whistle.
The second half gets underway.
The referee stops play so that a substitution can be made and Pierre-Emile Hojbjerg (Southampton) replaces James Ward-Prowse.
What a hit! Nathan Redmond (Southampton) shows good composure inside the box to fire a first-time shot into the bottom left corner. 1:1.
Adlene Guedioura (Watford) receives a yellow card from the referee as expected.
Substitution. Valon Behrami makes his way off the pitch and Ben Watson (Watford) comes on as his replacement.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Camilo Zuniga (Watford) is coming onto the pitch as Adlene Guedioura cannot continue after picking up an injury.
Ben Watson (Watford) is being sent off by the referee for a foul that he committed a little earlier!
Substitution. Jeremy Pied (Southampton) in, Cedric Soares out.
Walter Mazzarri has decided to make a change. Ikechi Anya (Watford) replaces Odion Ighalo.
The referee signals that it is time for a substitution and Charlie Austin (Southampton) comes onto the pitch so that Shane Long can be given a rest.
Nathan Redmond (Southampton) has a goal ruled out for offside!
The referee gives a yellow card to Heurelho Gomes (Watford).
Virgil Van Dijk (Southampton) makes it easy for the referee to show him a yellow card.
That's the end of the match.
The first half of this match is about to start.
A dangerous towering header by Curtis Davies (Hull City) from around the penalty spot goes just wide of the right post. This corner kick didn't change the score.

Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) weaves through the defence with ease and gets into a good position in front of goal. He pulls the trigger in an effort to beat the keeper, but fails as the ball zooms around the right post.
Riyad Mahrez slides a brilliant pass into Daniel Drinkwater (Leicester), but his shot from inside the box goes a whisker wide of the left post.
Christian Fuchs (Leicester) sees a yellow card from Michael Dean after he sent one of the opposing players to the ground.
The foul by Danny Simpson (Leicester) is worthy of a card and a yellow is duly shown by Michael Dean.

Christian Fuchs (Leicester) must feel embarrassed now. He received a killer pass, but his shot from the six-yard box was a disaster. He miskicked and made it very easy for Eldin Jakupovic to get hold of the ball.
Jamie Vardy (Leicester) reacts well to get to the rebound and takes a shot from the edge of the box, but he fails to get the ball through the players standing between him and the goal.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) is furious with himself as he misses a golden opportunity from inside the six-yard box. He sends a rebound a few inches wide of the left post.
Ahmed Musa plays a pass to Jamie Vardy (Leicester), but he fails to get a decent shot away from inside the box and the ball goes high over the bar.

Curtis Davies (Hull City) outjumps the defence to meet the resulting corner and heads the ball towards the right side of the goal. The long-range header is not powerful enough, and the keeper comfortably makes a save.
GOAL! Adama Diomande (Hull City) gets to the rebound inside the box and fires in a stunning overhead kick. Phenomenal finish! 1:0.
The end of the first half.
Referee Michael Dean blows his whistle to start the second half.

Tom Huddlestone (Hull City) brings an opponent down and Michael Dean interrupts the game. Leicester are awarded a penalty! The opposing players are protesting, but the referee had an easy-decision to make.
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) is going to take the penalty!
Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) sends Eldin Jakupovic the wrong way and fires the penalty into the middle of the goal!

Robert Snodgrass (Hull City) gets to the ball on the edge of the box and fires in a first-time shot without any hesitation. The strike is excellent and goes straight into the bottom right corner. He couldn't have done it any better. 2:1.
Claudio Ranieri has decided to make a change. Shinji Okazaki (Leicester) replaces Demarai Gray.
Andy King goes off the pitch and Daniel Amartey (Leicester) comes on.
Today's referee Michael Dean rightly decides to book Curtis Davies (Hull City) for his harsh tackle.

Riyad Mahrez (Leicester) takes the resulting free kick from 25 metres out. He attempts to send his effort into the right side of the goal, but Eldin Jakupovic is alert and keeps the ball out. The ball goes out for a corner. Leicester can continue in their attacking effort.
Sam Clucas (Hull City) can't expect anything else than a yellow card for his hard tackle. And a yellow it is. Michael Dean didn't think twice about pulling it out of his pocket.
The referee signals a substitution. Leonardo Ulloa (Leicester) is brought on as a substitute for Danny Simpson.
Nothing more will happen in this game as the referee blows for full time.
